comment: Tiger Direct has been around for many years and I have purchased items from it but ten or more years ago.  On Oct 18/14 I ordered a wireless print server and paid $14.25 for shipping and handling.  Payment made through PayPalm on the same day.  The following Monday (20th) I received an e-mail stating that my item had been shipped and providing a UPS tracking number.  The following day I checked the progress of the shipment and was told that it had been delivered.  Used the chat feature and was told that the item was trans shipped and that it would be on its way to me shortly.  Foolishly expecting a further e-mail up-to-date shipping information, I waited until the 27th and then called the chat line again.  I was particularly curious that my order did not show up when I checked my account and all I got was a message saying "no orders found". The chat ultimately provided a new shipping reference and I was able to determine that the item had made its way to Concord, ON after stops in several places Concord, ON, Canada  10/29/2014  5:42  Departure Scan Concord, ON, Canada  10/28/2014  0:32  Arrival Scan Windsor, ON, Canada  10/27/2014  20:12  Departure Scan 10/27/2014  18:57  Import Scan 10/27/2014  13:59  Arrival Scan Detroit, MI, United States  10/27/2014  12:21  Arrival Scan Livonia, MI, United States  10/27/2014  11:58  Departure Scan Livonia, MI, United States  10/25/2014  9:56  Arrival Scan Chicago, IL, United States  10/25/2014  3:51  Departure Scan 10/25/2014  1:33  Arrival Scan Addison, IL, United States  10/25/2014  0:54  Departure Scan Addison, IL, United States  10/24/2014  23:17  Export Scan 10/24/2014  23:17  Origin Scan United States  10/24/2014  9:54  Order Processed: Ready for UPS It was now over one week and the item had only just started its shipment to me  I got an e-mail this morning saying "Thank you for your recent order. Our records indicate your order was completely shipped approximately 10 days ago. At this point, you should have received every item of your order." I ordered some items on the same day as I placed my TD order about the same weight;  shipping cost less than half of what TD charged and the package was received in nine days. While the shipping processes in this instance were rediculous, the fact that the company never provided any follow up e-mails was abominal. If Tiger Direct expects to compete with online retailers who know what they are doing then it had better pull up its socks and pay attention to its customers.

It was my very first trip with AffordableWorld and it will be my last trip using this travel agency. Over $ 4200 per person this is NOT we expected. Why? Japan: & Hong Kong 1. No welcoming agent upon arrival at the hotel. 2. No meeting scheduled with guide to introduce the traveling companions and describe the itinerary 3. No luggage service whatsoever. == Customers had to carry their own luggage from airport to hotels and from hotels to bus. This is a mandatory service in particular for senior citizens 4. No wake up calls 5. In Japan, guide does not speak English well. Unable to understand most of his explanation 6. In Japan, not enough tours for all that money and too many free days for you to pay more for optional tours 7. Hotel accommodation in Hong Kong was the worst. We extended our stay with an additional 3 nights in the worse hotel in Hong Kong 8. In Hong Kong, we never met any representative from AffordableWorld. The next day, they scheduled a half day tour for us with a free lance guide, who I must say was excellent, but nobody from AffordableWorld. We believe that AW could have sent us a representative to welcome us and talk to us about what to expect and do in Honh Kong. We have been traveling overseas for the last 10 years with one or two  international trips per year. This trip has been the most expensive ones and the most terrible experience.We should get our money back.

I really appreciate Groupon's deals and flash sales, so 2 starts for that. However, I've tried to unsubscribe from Groupon emails about 10 times and I still get several emails every few days. It was so upsetting that I ended up marking all of the emails as spam. Fix your unsubscribe system and 5 stars would be my rating.
Books for me to buy are way too expensive Cover of book is not good quality
fed up with continual nagging to give a review.  Raspberry!

What happened to getting a pair for $10 this is bull stuff

Really bad customer service not recommended it all

The prices are in USD and does not calculate the total of the currency from the country you are form so I thought I was paying $31.99 because there was no currency stated and $51.66 came out of my account

This was my second order i have placed with them. The first order was delivered about 5 minutes before my wife’s business closed and I placed my order 3 days before it was to be delivered. The second time it was never delivered before my wife’s business was closed and she never received the package. Tried to cancel and get my refund and they give me the run around for 3 days. Still have not gotten my refund. I will never use them again. Worst experience ever

ups is the worst shipping company ever who deliver two package my kids school shoes and decide to left them out the apartment door eh who does that.i am in school and got a notice from sportchek to rate my package that was delivered rush home cause i wanted to know whats going on nothing no package nothing who leave package in front an apartment  door no one home u walk with it my kids are without shoe because of carelessness.today september 04 2019 .after i waited on them few days nothing now this
Showed up to find out I didn’t have a hotel room
they do not show negative reviews
I ordered the “Beautiful” by Estee Lauder.  Is this a knock off version? It doesn’t smell the same.  I’m sorry I ordered it.
Always helpful !

Such a hard program to understand and use the credits. Didn't think it was well explained, I don't see any emails warning me about an upcoming charge and I don't know why I can't use the credit on ONE pair of $44 pants. Too confusing.
Ordered on 01/03, got an email that my item was shipped on 01/04, and still have not received my package. Emailed a4c several times and no response. Today is 01/15.
You are sending emails and interacting with my son, who is 14 years old so I really don't appreciate it.

Misleading and deceptive - got asked for my payment details in order to 'activate my account' to later find out that I got charged $95.88 to my credit card with no confirmation or authorisation! Emailed their dropbox to demand a refund and they have not gotten back to me. BEWARE OF THIS COMPANY.

Since I'm away at college, I ordered flowers for my mom the day before Mother's day. Since I waited till the last minute, I was so excited that this site promised they'd be delivered ON Mother's Day. When they were delivered no one was home, so of course I don't blame the site for that. I called their customer service line and was promised they'd be re-delivered the next day. Since the surprise was already ruined, I just asked my mom to make sure she was home all day so she could receive them. They never came. I called again, they apologized, said they'd re-deliver with an apology note and give me a 15% refund. I got the partial refund, but again my poor mom waited all day for them and they never came. I couldn't ask my mom to sit around again all day so I called again and told them I didn't want them re-delivered, I just wanted a full refund. It took a while but the customer service woman finally said she would arrange a full refund. I never received the rest of my refund and I will certainly never be buying anything from this company again.

I took out a $800 dollar loan during my time of need. I owed $1000 back. Made my first payment of $200. When it was time to make my next payment. One of the Representative told me everything was paid in full. A week later I owed 1,700 dollars with late fees. Whattt. I couldn't believe it. They don't even know what happened saying they received money from me in a check online and the check bounced !!! I didn't do that. I always call and check with someone. I will NEVER do this again. Make sure you get your balance agreement people everytime you make a payment. Dont fall victim of fraud !!!

Horrible service, no one listened to a word I said. The guy I dealt with just read a script off of his computer and was very dry, then got mad at me for trying to sell me a $12,000 Car that I couldn’t afford after I told him 3 times I was not looking for a car over $6,000. Not to mention I keep receiving emails that I called and told them to stop sending me.

I was just starting out with Smile Direct looking to save some money over other products and things did not go well.  I made impressions at home as I live well away from any of the scanning locations.  I returned the impressions as instructed the day after I received them.  Instead of hearing back that they had received my impressions, I received near a dozen emails asking me to return the impressions.  Of course, I already had and had done so via their shipper with their pre-printed label.  I contacted Smile Direct thrice asking if they had, or had not, received the impressions and all I received was the run around.  On one occasion I was told they did not have them.  On another occasion I was told they received them but could not find them.  I was also told a new impression kit would be sent but that has not happened.  They just cannot seem to get themselves organized.  I am lucky to have found this out early on while I am only out a small amount of money.  I'd hate to have this kind of service and lack or organization should I ever have had a problem with the actual product.

My parcel was a week overdue. Never got a call or anything to tell me a problem had arisen. I rang as I got no update information about why my parcel was late on the tracking system. They have told me that the contents of the package was missing and that the package had been opened. This has happened before. They could not find the product. They offered me a refund but the refund would take approximately 2 weeks. I at this stage was furious. My parcel had been opened, the package was missing, they never found the package and never contacted me to why my parcel had not been delivered as per tracking data. I have told them I paid for it the same day I bought it and expect my money back within 24 hrs as it was not their right to hold my money, earn interest on my money, basically waste 2 weeks of research, 4 weeks delivery and another 2 weeks before any resolution and want another 2 weeks. I need the product for my planned time off and I will not have it in time. I asked what would happen if I did that to them or if I needed the item for my mum's surgery tomorrow. They had no response. REALLY, REALLY, REALLY poor. Thieves or just severe incompetence or both.

Bad stuff !  Sales person just want to sell . Also how do I will pay 3 months in advance to get a services . I requested you guys to stop by and take off this system . I don’t like that . I will go adt alarm .
I was told I could disconnect the router function and use my own router. Not trueperformance is horrible.
received email comfirming my purchase, biut never received the product. Was not charged, but never got the goods !!!

This was unacceptable. I ordered a pizza alright so first of all the guy went to the wrong house as I was waiting outside an started cussing up a storm, he than sped to my driveway an got out aggressively. He than handed me the food an said “are you gonna tip me”. I told him I already did through the app an didn’t have the cash on me, he than got all defensive saying f you an piece of sh**b!tch. Never in my life will I ever order from this site again. I also called customer service an they pretty much ignored my complaint. SO THATS A BIG F U GRUBHUB
Price went up within an hour

Very unhappy!  I ordered a 3 piece breakfast nook.  I received an e-mail stating my order had been delivered.  I received the corner bench, package 1 of 2.  I called immediately to report the missing package.  Yesterday the missing package came and it was another corner bench!  Who ever I spoke with on the phone had a difficult time understanding the English language and speaking it!  I called again and still am not sure what is going to happen due to another person not very fluent in English.  I have not had a kitchen table for 3 weeks, which makes it very difficult with children!  I am hoping to have my table and small bench by Thanksgiving.  It is very frustrating dealing with Gettington on the phone!

Bought one 12VDC time delay relay that did not work. I figured that i terminated incorrectly??  bought a second one, this one does not work either! I called to see if someone could confirm wiring. Technical support did confirm that i had wired correctly. i feel like i bought 2 duds! i left a message for the supervisor to return my call still waiting.....................

Jalbum is great software. So why only two stars. I've been using Jalbum for seven years, and it produces lovely galleries. But the upgrades rarely warrant the price. If you don't upgrade, the nagging is so annoyingly obtrusive, that the pleasure is gone.
Not Happy with the return policy We have a wedding and I had to send back 3 pairs of pants to change size and it cost me 75.00 I could of owned a pair of the pants
I have not ordered anything for a long long time & will never order any thing again as I had a BAD experience the last time & feel that you charge to much for S&H plus your return policy sucks.

Disappointed Ordered 5 passport personalised covers... Still not arrived, I have emailed to be told to check with local post office, NO NOT AT POST OFFICE this is £60 worth of orders. What makes this even worse is my self and my 3 children all had to get first time passports, i hve managed to order all our passports attend and interview for passport and get all 4 back before i have even got the covers from you guys!!

I ordered 2 day air and they shipped my order UPS ground. Instead of getting it in 2 or three days it took over a week. This delayed my project quite a bit. They refunded the difference in service, but that didn't buy back the time that I lost.

I'm very disappointed in the service I'm receiving. The internet speed is VERY slow and I'm having all sorts of trouble with both my cell phone and Magic Jack. Had to turn off my WI-FI setting on my cell phone just to get calls that weren't garbled and constantly being dropped! My Magic Jack phone is totally unusable! Additionally, it has affected my Ring doorbells and now they don't work properly either. Frustrating to say the least!!

We booked a flight with Bravofly, and all seemed ok until we realised that there was no luggage included in the flight. So we decided to call them to book and pay for baggage. Sounds easy... It wasn't. We called. And called. And called. When we managed to get through to any of the seemingly massive team of "customer service" advisors, each picked for their rudeness, terrible grasp of the English language and a seeming desire to ruin your trip, we eventually managed to force a promise from them to get someone to call us to arrange the baggage booking. Ok, so we should now get a call. Right? Not right. We did get a few tries at random times, (not English time friendly at all,) but when we couldn't answer (we are both very busy) they didn't bother trying again or leaving a message until we called and asked them to get someone to call again. We did try calling back but the number didnt work! And this happened again and again. Only once did they leave a message, which was completely rude and unintelligible. This despite the fact that we asked on a few occasions that they call us both on different numbers which they never did. Eventually we told them that if they don't sort it out then we would leave a bad review online. Miracle of miracles - they called the next morning (albeit before 8:00!) and sorted everything in less than 5 minutes! All I can say is avoid BravoFly like the plague - they have honestly given the very worst customer service (or lack thereof) that I have ever experienced. BravoFly - I know that you are going to try to contact us now to resolve this. Lets see what you can do - it will take a lot, as right now all I can think of is "too little too late...!"

worst customer service experience I have ever had.  This is not an exaggeration - No communication about the status of my order, late delivery, poor quality.  I filed complaints with the BBB and PayPal.  Unfortunately I was unable to get my money back.  When I did receive response from the company after 9 emails the contact was unapologetic and only made me more frustrated with the company.  Hoping no one else falls for this Facebook ad because the company certainly doesn't appreciate its customers.

I made an order with this company gor make up brushes and wanted to be enrolled into the box but somehow the subscription cancelled on it . i have already emailed twice and still havent gotten a response for how it got cancelled. I had a theroy since i am enrolled with one email for myself and did a purchase with email  for my daughter and tried to get the box enrolled for her on that order but the next day they let me know the brushes ship but that the order for the box got cancelled. So now imma have to re order and pay another shiping almost makes me feel like just getting her a subscription through another company this has been a hassell i should be able to pay for my daughters subscription.

I bought 3 tickets for Hamilton in NY, which cost over $1,500 combined, relying on the StubHub value indicator along with pictures shown on the StubHub website of my view from the seats.  I reviewed a number of seats for location, view, and cost before deciding on the ones I purchased.  After receiving my tickets it was noted that there was a partial view obstruction.  The obstruction was not shown on the view of my seats on the website nor would I consider any ticket to a sporting/theater event with a partial obstruction to be a best value seat.  StubHub's customer service representative was indifferent to my issue, they would not take the tickets back, and put the onus on me to resell the tickets so that I could then have the money to repurchase seats without an obstructed view.

Bizarre way of having to contact Redbubble by posting on here! I was told on Friday that they had sent me an e-mail regarding my order (placed on 3rd Dec) but there's nothing in my inbox or junk folder. Unless you count the promotional e-mail from Redbubble trying to sell me gift vouchers (as if I would inflict their dreadful customer service on anybody else!) If they can send me promotions, why hasn't the e-mail from customer support arrived? I know there was a stock problem with the kids shirts I ordered but I was told on 15th that they were finally being printed. So why haven't they shipped? At least if I had an answer I could explain to my kids why their presents didn't arrive in time for Christmas. Dreadful, dreadful customer service. Please e-mail me Redbubble!
Easy and great deals on tickets online but when it comes to the customer service they are rude, unprofessional and disgusting
Since the two digital giftcards were checked and each has a balance of zero, I am not the least bit happy

Don't waste your money on the phone insurance. Every time you send them information they will just ask for something else. A month later i had enough and just realized this company was a waste of money.

I had no idea there was a big fee for a reserved seat and carry-on bag.  I felt used and taken advantage of.  I certainly didn't get any kind of bargain, and in fact paid much more than what a reasonable amount would be.   My friends told me I really got screwed!
Waste of time. They won't even let you delete your profile. The biggest issue for me is the privacy and accuracy of the content available. I always tell my friends not to quote Facebook as a source.
Horrible experience
I ordered 2 bulls tickets I received the confirmation in my email but not the tickets! I got to the game and I was unable to get in.
way way too long your shipping sucks never again will I buy from you. there are plenty of others to buy from!
I sent mine back - the instructions were difficult to understand.  You need at least two people to put this together.   The advertisement was misleading about how to put the frame together.
I never received my shoes, and customer service told me it was my problem.
Lied about how easy it is to find the star
No other communication between seller and me after my purchase online. Seller left me hanging as to when I would receive the item. No email, nothing.

This was the worst website I have ever ordered from!  I got no conformation email, no tracking notice, no shipment notice, no answered phone calls or emails.  I called my credit card co and filled a dispute before I actually got my order.  It took forever to arrive in the mail in a cheap little plastic bag with no packing slip.  By the time I got my order the prices on the products were half at the stores.  I would never, ever order from this company again.

Horrible experience with Expedia. I made reservation and called hotel for detail information like it was directed on the website. Hotel didn't have any my information but Expedia keep saying my reservation is confirmed. They didn't have anyway to contact to the hotel and no clear answer until the day before my travel. Agent just says our "special team will work on it" no idea at all.
i was given a ticket even though I displayed my parking pass

Would give no stars for customer service, but that isn't an option. I had a rude lady who kept hanging up on me, would not give her name and when I asked to speak with someone else she told me to call back and hung up on me, so I called back she answered again I asked her name again then she hung up, she hung up on me six different times. Very poor customer service
What in the world is taking so long to ship my bracelets? This is a major supplier - shouldn't  take so long. . I ordered on April 23rd.  This is May 11th. ORDER HASN'T EVEN SHIPPED YET.  Why?

Ordered Christmas cards and paid via paypal.  My current address never updated on the order when I changed it so the order went to my old address. I called to let them know, they resent the order and still sent it to the old address.  They updated the Bill To address but did not update the Send To address. Two orders to the incorrect address.  Current residents of the OLD address returned to sender. I asked for a refund cause I was tired of dealing with them.  To date, they have not refunded the amount.

Lost my package and unable to give me explanation as to what happened to it and their facility is only 30mins away from my house. Took them a week to re-send me new one. Unhelpful rep on the phone, and unresponsive from email until I emailed the manager. In return ? They got me $10 goft card yayyyy!

Just save yourself allot of headache - don't use them -  very poor service ! Things that i discover after i made the order : FullFlex is insurance is covering 90% from the amount, BUT as a voucher !  YOU SHOULD BOLD IT! There is no any email address, meaning i need all the time to call them and to pay on international phone call and also to wait for 10-15  min on the phone , and after that to discover a person that is very kind but give a robotic service, no any intention to try to solve the case. 48 hours past since i order the flight , i did an advanced 2 months before the vacation - i have no idea what is going on with my tickets .

Not even a one star. Unreliable and totally and utterly rubbish business etiquette.  I ordered a necklace for my wife on the 16th of March and was guaranteed that it will be delivered on the 29th in time for Mother's day.The children picked the design and have been waiting for it to be delivered but to no avail. We are all so gutted and extremely disappointed. No present for their MUM. I want a full refund.

Unexpectedly cancelled my orders, TWICE. I had set up automatic delivery service for my mother to receive bouquets every month. First my valentine's day order was not received with no info from the company that it was cancelled. It was only have my mother called me to say she thought she was receiving flowers and didn't that I tried to contact the company and resolve. They had a technical error that cancelled my order. The company sent some cheap lilies instead of what I had ordered and my mother didn't care for them much. At least I wasn't charged since they entirely missed the holiday. Then for Easter I had another order to be sent and the exact same issue occurred. This time they only gave me a $15 credit and we completely missed any flowers to be sent for the occasion and it would take a month to get the order I had originally paid for sent. It's a great concept and when it works the flowers are nice. But if the orders keep getting mysteriously cancelled and never arrive I don't care how nice the flowers are, nothing arriving is the worst possible outcome for floral delivery company. They have no customer service phone number either, so everything needs to be done via e-mail, which means if you have an issue it takes a while to correct.
They blocked my id without any notification. Very bad indeed.
Waited for over 2 hours for the food and they never called to say they were late, they would just keep changing the time (not the first time it's happened)! Never using this service again!!

I needed to receive my item within 3-5 business days, yes it was my fault for waiting but I chose this site to get my order within that time. It was three days before my item was even shipped and I did not receive my order within the max of five days even though I paid quite a bit extra to do so. Don't order here if you need it in a short period of time, they get in no hurry even though they charge you for it.

Purchased a runner and when I received it, the colors were different in person than viewed on the computer. I immediately called to return it and said the colors did not match an existing rug. I was told the runner was on 'special' and was not returnable! I had no idea! I was very upset because  they advertise a 30-day free trial period. I'm stuck with a runner that does not match the colors in my home. I will not shop at Rugs-Direct again.

Super Shuttle in Cancun pvt car was a no show for return trip to the airport so I took a cab in desperation after 25 min of waiting. $30 charge. Emailed Super Shuttle and the hotel called but still no car. Expedia claims they have no responsibility for a no service problem from their vendors. Not sure which was worse; no show car or all that time with calls/emails to Expedia only to hear they are not responsible. Wasn't the money, just hate to pay for no service. Moral is book the car directly next time. One call to CC company and the charge would have been reversed.

I ordered a Pandora Charm. I received an email on Oct 9 it had been shipped by UPS. Pulled tracking number, no updates. Found out yesterday never shipped because out if stock and I was never notified. The Customer Service said shipping this week from another store. We shall see.

Have taken bus from Tampa to Orlando amtrak station numerous times This last Saturday June 16,2018 the driver at the end of the ride locked the doors after shutting bus down and would not allow passengers out until all bags were unloaded. Since the bus was full it took 10 to 15 minutes and several elderly passengers were complaining about being locked in bus without air-conditioning in early afternoon heat. If there had been medical emergency  or fire in bus this would have been a disaster for the passengers and a financial disaster for the company .This idiot driver should be fired

I ordered a dress here with the hopes that it would fit for a simple beach wedding.  I wanted my mom to see it first before we made the ultimate decision but she was not able to come over for a couple of weeks.  Unfortunately, that put me well past their ridiculous 5 day return policy.  I ended up finding something else I liked better through JcPenney who does not have such a tight window.  I ordered dresses from several places including Amazon, Macy's, Belk and ModCloth and had no trouble returning the dresses I did not want.  Now, I am just stuck with this dress and the cost of it.  Fortunately, I ordered a relatively cheap dress.  Simply dresses also has a 10% charge for returns along with an $8.00 shipping charge. There is a reason that millions of people shop at stores like Macy's and have never heard of Simply Dresses.  Customer service is key.

When the food does show up, the drivers are pleasant - the issue is that the food does not usually show up.  The driver calls and says they are lost - I refer them to the receptionist, who is good at giving directions; but they never show up.  Other groups are able to get here without issues, so I am not sure why Grubhub is not able to.

Bought my Latiss from Groupon send out the coupon and UPC label and all information I need for my free bottle .when I called they said oh we can't find it they want me to do it again.  I don't have all the paperwork TO do  it again and Groupon doesn't  help me obviously.so because the offer was  a  mistake  in  print , they found a way to make up there mistake.

i am fuming...after booking the car as full to full fuel at the counter i was told there was a 30 euros charge even if we brought it back full.. i challenged it was told if i took out the extra insurance they would forfeit the 30euros. i asked how much was it was told it was 100 euris so I agreed...only to find 168euros was charged to my card...as the 100 euros was actually 132 plus tax plus credit card charge!!! never never use firefly!!!! con artists!!
I recently ordered a lunch box as a gift for Father's Day only to have received it severely damaged and dented all over.
Because of the Promotional value period I have so many unused vouchers. I don't want to spend so much money after promotion is expired even though I can use the amount that I paid for.

I got my first iPhone (7) for Father’s Day. On setup I mistyped my apple password. I contacted tech support. Password could not be changed. Now it’s going too be another 13 days, 15 days in all. Starting too wonder if switching from android was a mistake. Tech support should not have had me try and reset my password repeatedly thus making a extended wait.

Lawyer was great about setting up a payment plan however once I paid off the $1,735 to file contact went to nonexistent.  He wont return any phone calls or texts or emails. Looks like I'll have to hire another lawyer to sue this lawyer to get my money back. DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY

I ordered these socks at the end of January for a Valentine’s Day gift, through a Valentine’s Day special. I still have not received them. When I emailed to complain I was told that nothing would be shipped until after valentine’s day. I still have not received them. I will not be ordering these services ever again.

Hi, I had ordered once domains name from them, couple years ago and I had deleted all my banking card details, just make sure that is not any details with them. That was couple years ago and then they Stealing money yesterday late night from me!!! I had to call to bank and change my business card plus I want to call to those thieves but I cannot find any contact number ! I need to get my money back! Peoples be careful, don’t order nothing from them, they will steal money from you just like from me!!!

The charge made to my account differed from the total amount shown on the hotel's receipt. When I contacted Priceline for clarification on the discrepancy I was told that I should not have been provided a receipt for my stay, as the amount charged by the hotel is negotiated by Priceline prior to any bookings. I was informed that no refund would be given for the difference between the two amounts. The customer representative that I spoke with was very curt and was clearly agitated that I received a receipt from the hotel, mentioning several times that the information listed on that receipt was not public knowledge?? After this conversation, I can say without a doubt that I will never use Priceline's service again.

this morning I decided too use Uber usually I use lyft but I put my pickup location and the driver decides he’s going too pull up where he wants and I’m supposed too walk and look for him after I put my pickup location clear as ever and not hard too find... the driver calls me after me texting him bc the app said he arrived he tells me he’s there and I go where bc I’m standing at my pickup location and dont c him and then he cancels my ride and Uber charges me $5 for what ? I never got the ride or wasted his time... what happens when your drivers do the bs too the customer were just left dry right ?
Abysmal. If apple was not a monopoly iTunes would never survive in the marketplace.

Free shipping???  Took 5 days for product to arrive after spending minimum of $49.  I don't consider that a deal. I purchased Fromm Dog food thinking I would get discounts as first time customer as their website advertised.  When I finished placing order I received a message that discounts are not allowed on Fromm products. Very disappointed so most likely will not order from them again.  Too slow on shipping and then no new customer discount.  Not good!

Order took too long  that my dog food ended up running out even though I placed the order 1 week ahead..I called the customer service who told me he will email me status of my order sine it was still in pending!!!! I have had dialup with better reliability. These were 2 of the worst years of having internet. When it rains, snow or cloud up (Which is when people really want to watch TV)  I can do no work, can't stream, heck just useless. I stay over an hour away from my office, and there were times I would rather drive that long distance than deal with my Hughesnet internet. Throttling down to 3Mbps after the expensive 50 Megs were used up? It takes about 4-5 days to use that up. I will NEVER subscribe nor will I recommend your services. 2 days after I got this subscription, I tried calling the scammer who sold it to me and he basically told me that well, it's yours now. Call the 800 number they gave you. The installation techs didn't even know how to use a toner to find the jumper they needed. Cable was stretched across my attic floor with no slack. This was a royal mess that I paid for for 2 long unreliable years. I really don't know of anyone who was happy with their Hughesnet subscription. Sat internet is not comparable to cable, but rural areas don't really have a choice. You all should really be ashamed pulling people into this scam. I guess it's ok for ATM machines, credit card machines, but nowhere near ready to be a real ISP.

Verify my activity before redeeming? What the hell does that even mean? Clearly the sites that pay us, have verified I have taken their surveys and have either paid me, or ok'ed it with your system to pay me. That's about all the verification I should need. So this is a new review. It's been a while. Haven't been having too many issues except tonight again. I do them as often as possible. Try and cash out weekly. Except this time I have $31.79 and it's not telling me to contact customer service to cash out? Excuse me but it states right in your Help menu, under Redemption, Option 1 There is no maximum limit. Yet, clearly there is. As for other reviews on here. "Rushing" through a survey is too simple for the fact that demographic questions over and over become habit and are easy answers. Also, when a company is asking me about subscription services and I mention in the beginning I don't have any, but then they ask me over and over and list every single subscription service they can find, It's not "rushing" to go to the bottom of the page and just hit "None" and "Next". That's the surveys fault for asking us questions they've asked us in the beginning. Not our faults. We don't make them, we just answer them. And we have to answer them the way they are presented to us. Some are more fast paced, some are super slow. Most are fast paced. You've also noticed the time suggestion is no longer on the survey cards. So they can't really hold a time limit to us since there isn't one. Most surveys also are digging for the answers they want. Not what we have to say. ie, JD Power and Chevy trying to claim they've been surveyed the best. That's not true. If I tell a survey I don't like that brand. I'm disqualified. Proving, they're only wanting answers that give them the best rep. Not what the REAL public has to say I'd also like to point out to my Oregon readers and users. In this great state. If you earn it. IT'S YOURS. They aren't allowed to withhold, or keep your earnings. What you earn in Oregon is yours too keep, They can make limits, but they can't take it or not pay you. I've contacted the AG's office on sites like this many times, and I've always been paid..

Airbnb is crap shoot when it comes to places to stay while traveling. Unfortunately I did not know this until after using the service just once! In my case, my wife accidentally left her laptop at the place we were staying in LA (#SUPER LOCATION!!! 2BED W/ GREAT AMENITIES!). This should have been pretty simple to recover. I contacted the host first thing the very next day via phone so I was talking to him. They claim to have searched high and low and did not find the laptop. It was sitting right there!!! So either the cleaning people took it, the host took it, or someone else that had a key to the place took it. Note that anyone can have a key to the place so lock up your valuables or better yet use a reputable hotel where the keys are generated new for each customer. I read a couple more reviews about the place we stayed at and several other renters reported things disappearing and luggage being searched. In addition to this, the place was not as close to the attractions as listed, the amenities like pool and hot tub were either not working or poorly maintained, the dinning room light was out, it was right next to LAX so you heard planes all day and night, and there was not enough room for people to sit at. Crazy! Bad experience and I do not recommend Airbnb. Renters beware!!!

I was trying to do an application/order of service through dishnetwork.com, but I was trying to get the gift card that was being offered via dishnetwork flyer I had received. I called the number on the flyer thinking i was calling dishnetwork directly....and placed the order over the phone. When i asked the technician what the "one time" processing fee was he said he had no idea but, he would call for me and see. I was told that I had placed my order with GoDish instead of calling Dishnetwork directly. if I had called dishnetwork directly I wouldn't be charged the one time processing fee. This is false advertisement. The GoDish is in small print on the flyer. It doesn't tell you in print that they are a retailer and If I didn't want the one time processing fee I should call dishnetwork directly. And, NOT ONE TIME on the phone did they tell me they were a retailer of dishnetwork and they would charge me a processing fee until after everything was done and the order was placed. I am very upset with this, now having paid 2x what my regularly monthly bill is going to be. Just to have service installed.

Not a trustworthy company. I rented a book for a Spring 2014 class, "Modern Management: Concepts and Skills" by Samuel Certo and Trevis Certo, ISBN: 9780132176316. After sending it back in what I thought was an acceptable condition, packaging it in the same box I received it in (along with another rental book), I received an email from a Knetbooks customer service representative telling me that the book was damaged beyond usability and that the company would charge me a replacement fee. I checked my bank account and discovered that the fee had been charged the day BEFORE I was informed. I was charged $262.82, which I assume is the price of a brand new copy (I wasn't told why that was the amount). The so-called damaged copy is a 2011 edition that has been obviously rented out before, as evidenced by scribbled notes, highlights, and the normal wear and tear I saw when first receiving it. I could buy this 2011 edition today, brand new, for $25. I have contacted their customer service twice already to protest their predatory behavior. I have also asked them to send me a photo of the damaged book as proof, but I was told they do not have the "capability" to do so. Their responses amount to the usual corporate avoidance tactics: a sentence or two apologizing for the inconvenience and the rest a "copy and paste" of company policy claiming that they can charge me any fee, up to the cost of the book, at their discretion. In summary, I have been given no chance to protest this unethical action. I 'm contacting my bank and will be writing Knetbooks' owner(s), my college, and if needed, the County Prosecutor and other internet forms to reclaim my money. I have already contacted some college professors, who have agreed to circulate the information to their students. Do business with them at your peril. RESPONSE TO AMANDA: Hello Amanda. Thank you for your response. There is no active dispute with the bank at the moment. I've posted this as a comment and also emailed Knetbooks to make sure you get it. I am not familiar with Trustpilot's notification system. 1) As I requested in an email to Knetbooks customer service, I want to see a picture of the item, the damage, and an explanation of why I was charged that amount. Looking at other reviews on Knetbooks, your company seems to circulate damaged books, and as such, you are very vague on what is "unusable." 2) Thank you for opening up with an offer, but what you propose is not enough. What you are suggesting is that I pay you and also get you a new book. It is not my responsibility as the customer to replace your books; that is on you. Example: If I total a car, the insurance company will pay me a check at the current value of the car so that I replace it. At no point is the insurance company expected to replace my car. 3) I will continue pushing for a full refund. If you send me proof of damage incurred by ME, I will negotiate, and only if I get a signed letter from your company saying you will honor the agreement. A number of negative reviews have popped up in the last three days, some similar to mine, and my trust level towards your company is even lower than it was prior to your response. Igor

As a small business we have a lot of experience with DHL. We do not send stuff out to customers using DHL, but sometimes our suppliers use DHL to send products to us or our directly to our customers. We find 80% of these shipments just disappear and are never delivered. When you look into it via tracking or emailing them or whatever, you get the 'the driver couldn't access the delivery address' routine. We are a business and are here all the time and day in day out we get perfect service for other carriers like Hermes, UPS, and many many others. But DHL fail to deliver, they never leave a card if you are out and always try to pin the blame on the delivery address being in accessible. Obviously we do not send shipments with DHL but we will now also insist that products we order from suppliers are delivered by any carrier except DHL. My sincere advice to anyone reading this review is never, ever, ever use this company.

What should happen is that the website indicates when the product will be delivered (and be truthful about it); failing that, there should be an immediate follow-up email with the option to cancel the order. Had I known how long it would take, I probably would have jumped to a different seller.

Beware of deceptive sale practices--Zenni cannot make progressive lenses in the way that most people need them.  Zenni was unable to make my progressive sense properly. They indicated that their progressives are mainly for distance.  They did not tell me this PRIOR to me buying my glasses, and when I found this out after I paid for and received them, I simply wanted to return my glasses for a full refund.  They refused, offering only a 50% refund or a full store credit.  Obviously a store credit is useless to me, since they are unable to make glasses that work for me!  Zenni was deceptive in not stating up front that they only make progressive lenses for mainly distance.  They did not tell me until after they had my money and they are refusing to refund me.  BEWARE!

I just returned home after being stranded in Ireland by Globus during the snow storm.  When things are going well, Globus is a great company. But during adverse events such as the snow storm Globus dropped the ball on customer service.  I realize this weather was beyond their control but please just communicate with it’s passengers.  I had ZERO  direc contact from Globus even tho they had our contact information. All we needed was reassurance from them that everything would be okay.  That’s why we booked directly through them, so we would not have to worry about transport and hotel issues.  40% of the tour was cancelled.  We were told  we had to rebook the cancelled flights ourselves and find our own way to the airport.  And when they finally ended up rescheduling the cancelled  flight 3 days later, all the hotel arrangements were on us.  When Saturday rolled around,  the original end date of the tour, they dropped you off either at the airport (where most flights had been cancelled anyway) or to the  last hotel originally scheduled.  They then said “see ya”. I felt totally stranded in a foreign country which is why I thought I would have avoided these problems by booking with a tour company.  ABANDONED, TIRED, and DISAPPOINTED with the customer care I received by Globus.  A direct apology would have been nice or a partial refund, or a voucher towards another trip.

I bought a part from Parts Geek and the purchase was flawless, however, UPS lost my package.  I could not get help from UPS for over two weeks as to a resolution and, after that period, was told to contact the shipper (Parts Geek).  The only way to contact your company is through an automated email system.  This contact via email took another 4 days to reach a resolution.  I have since been told that my refund would be credited but will require another 5 to 8 days.  What this amounts to is an approximate time span of a month to be reimbursed for something I DID NOT receive.  I was repairing this vehicle for a customer and had to purchase this part from another dealer for almost three times the price. Your company not having a means of providing feedback by telephone is VERY inconvenient.  This issue could have been resolved within a week, not a month.  The inconvenience of having to purchase the part again from another company and not having been reimbursed prior to that second purchase is aggravating.  I will not purchase from Parts Geek again, even though your prices for OEM parts are outstanding, I can't work with the inability to speak with a customer service representative when potential issues arise.

Lots of runaround for something that is a class action lawsuit in the making (they admitted to compromising multiple clients financial info in an email).

I will never use Vayama, or Kayak again.  I went through Kayak which rerouted me to Vayama to book a ticket from Lima to Cuzco and back.  The fare seemed great, and even though it was non-refundable I went ahead and pulled the trigger, meanwhile passing up on another good fare that was 20 dollars more.  Fast forward 2 days and I got the following email: "Dear Sir / Madam, We recently received your online booking request. Unfortunately, the airline was unable to accept the fare that was offered earlier, therefore, your booking could not be processed. Per our terms and conditions on your Booking Confirmation, air fares and reservations are not guaranteed until tickets are issued. New total fare $ 389.00. If you accept or reject please respond to the email. We apologize for any inconvenience this has caused. We trust to have you informed sufficiently and that our answer meets you expectations. In case of any additional questions feel free to contact us again. Kind regards, Vayama.com" So I guess the advertised price wasn't the actual price they were offering??  I was outraged, but at this point the prices had increased substantially across the board.  So I emailed back and told them fine, but that I wasn't happy about it.  Fast forward yet another day and I received the following email: Dear Sir / Madam, We thank you very much for your e-mail. We recently received your online booking request. Quality control has determined that your booking could not be processed at the fare  that was originally quoted. New total fare $ 464.02usd . If you accept or reject please respond to the email. We apologize for any inconvenience this has caused. We trust to have you informed sufficiently and that our answer meets you expectations. In case of any additional questions feel free to contact us again. Kind regards, Vayama.com Sadiya Razvi. I am astonished that a company that advertises one price, then pulls that offer after booking, and then DOES THE SAME THING AGAIN is able to turn a profit.  I am also disgusted at the incredible poor customer service.  If I had just booked with the other carrier I would have had a confirmed ticket for just 20 dollars more than the original price.  Beware that the fares that they advertise are just apparitions.  They're not real, and you will be nothing but disappointed if you book with Vayama.

We offered to book our elderly family members on the same flight to Canada although 1 member, for health reasons, had saved up to fly Business Class at considerable cost. My husband was unable to book them all online so contacted Expedia directly. The telephone operator booked the Business Class passenger on a different return flight to the others by mistake. When we realised this on the paperwork, Expedia wanted £350 to put it right, even though it was their representative who made the mistake. I have now spent 5 hours making many phone calls and put in a formal complaint to Expedia. They agreed to just charge the Delta airline cost of £200 which the elderly relative reluctantly agreed to pay whilst the complaint was investigated. By this point she was concerned about ensuring she was booked on the correct flight. The mistake was discovered with 2 months still to go before the flight and the representative I spoke to could not answer my question: “how long should we have had to check that the original details were correct?” Initially their answer was maybe 24 hours which I said was ridiculous considering the elderly relative was not online and I needed to post her the flight details to check! Expedia told me it would take 4 weeks to process my complaint and we are now up to 8 weeks with no response. They also charged my credit card with the £200 fee twice along with the discount of £150 which they should have taken off, not added to the bill. This has since been refunded.  Over the hours that I have been kept waiting on the phone, all I could hear was a claxon going off and cheering which suggests to me that all this company is interested in is reaching sales targets. Incredibly unprofessional company and too willing to exploit those they perceive to have so much money that they don’t question these exorbitant charges. We found this particularly disappointing when it is Expedia themselves who made the error. We would never consider using them again for any future journeys.

NEVER use Expedia for any of your travel needs! They screwed up our accommodations for our trip to Bay City for the Fourth of July. My husband is a disabled veteran. We made one reservation with Double Tree and cancelled the request as we needed a bigger room. We then made another reservation with the same hotel but ended up canceling the reservation as we found a better hotel that was able to accommodate our needs for a better price. We were surprised when we were charged two no show fees at the first hotel. We contacted the hotel directly and in their system Expedia made 4 reservations and only two were cancelled. Which was not the case. We then contacted Expedia the customer service representative was not helpful at all. He transferred our call back to the hotel. Then we were transferred again, but this time to the manager of the hotel. The manager understood the situation and is refunding our money. Today we were charged again for the no showed visits. We now have four charges to our account. We’ve talked to the hotel again this morning and will have to wait until the manager is in to see why we were charged again. We’ve talked with our bank and they assured us we will be receiving this money back. But Expedia was not helpful at all. Avoid Expedia for your travel needs! We were not able to enjoy our vacation during this time due to our funds being tampered with. We have two young children who were looking forward to this trip as well. Try explaining the situation to two heartbroken kids. They dropped the ball entirely and blamed the hotel instead holding any accountability for their mistakes. Thanks Expedia for ruining our time off with our family. Very hard to make memories if you don’t have money for your travel plans. Over $600 taken from our account. I will tell EVERY person I know to avoid your company at all costs.

Facebook had the good intention of connecting friends and family seamlessly no matter how far away, however it has become a platform for abuse and extremists. You can't join a single group without having to hear someone's personal views and beliefs shoved down your throat, should you disagree with or have a different view you will receive abusive personal messages and comments left on the page. Obvious facts and scientific evidence is disregarded in favour or personal belief, and people create groups just to start a cult. I've had people claim, science means nothing, and it don't matter if someone is committing fraud as long as it makes people feel better. Avoiding the groups on things you love, interests, hobbies, bands, stars, etc is the way to go. The only thing Facebook is good for is finding friends of family you have lost contact with, (or people you are stalking) but even then you will need to know there full married names and or locations. Being that you have lost contact with these people you probaly won't have this information, making it only good for stalking people you know details of. Which leads me to, if you have an abusive ex, ex friend, or just a stalker who wishes to know your personal life and or give you grief best you struggle with the hundreds of different settings to make your profile invisible to anyone not already on your friends list, again making anyone with good intent trying to find you impossible. Furthermore,  they changed the messaging service so you now have to install another app and risk all your personal information on another platform. No one ever gets banned or punished for there rude, extreme or aggressive abusive messages. You can block people so they cannot abuse you further but this does not stop there extremist views being pushed on and threats being made to others. They also try to force you to upload I.D of yourself personally so they can verify your name, this seems hugely inappropriate and they should just accept they created a platform for trolls and abuse and should shut down there website if they cannot control the problem not police the users like a corrupt government. The only real actual use of Facebook is communicating between friends and family, which you could use a phone for and as such bypass all of the other problems with this service.

Kate my dear this company does not deserve my business.

BEWARE OF FEDEX! If you want your packages delivered on time, or just plain delivered, use USPS or UPS. USPS is my favorite. FedEx delivery problems I have had over the past 40 (!!!!) years: 1. They cannot find my house. There are only 8 houses on my street and my mailbox at the foot of the driveway has the house number on both sides in 5 inch reflective characters. 2. My gate was locked. I do not have a gate, 3. My driveway was inaccessible. My driveway is 150 feet long up a hill. It is paved with a turnaround at the top. UPS and USPS have no trouble driving up to deliver packages. 4. They left the package at my gate. I repeat myself, but I don't have a gate, or a fence either. 5. My dog made them nervous. I do not have a dog. 6. They left large heavy packages at the foot of my driveway. I am a 78 year old, disabled, widow. It is their job to deliver my packages to my front door - not mine! 7. They have placed packages in my mailbox which is illegal unless it is a "Smart Post" delivery - which these were not. 8. They have lost packages. OK, the supplier files a claim and sends me a new item - BUT NOT WHEN I WANTED IT. 9. They left a package clearly marked "Fragile," "Perishible" floating around Memphis for an extra day. i don't know about you, but I get nervous about eating frozen seafood that has defrosted in Memphis. 10. Three packages to be delivered on the same day, all requiring my signature, were placed on three different trucks. Two arrived, the third did not. Apparently FedEx does not have the ability to sort packages by zip code, and place them on the same trucks. 11. They were unable to contact the driver to check about a delivery. Yes, this WAS in 2017. Cell phones anyone? They need to set up some sort of communication process. 13. FedEx outsources much of their delivery in San Antonio. This is about as successful as government outsourcing. I could go on, but I am tired. The package that was suppose to arrive yesterday by 5:40 PM came at 11:18 PM. Unfortunately, at the suggestion of a FedEx supervisor, I gave up and went to sleep at 10:30. Since the package required a signature, it was not left at my door. Maybe tomorrow . . . Since I have filed multiple complaints about all of these problems with FedEx management, one would think that any package with my name and address would trigger flashing red lights and alarms, Well, maybe they do. . . A warning to FedEx. With the advent of more on-line shopping, people will be depending on shipping companies that care about customer service. FedEx used to be the gold standard, but no more. You are not too big to fail, ask JC Penny, Sears, etc.

I have had repeated bad experiences with FedEx trying to purchase the same item from Walmart 3 times in the past month.  The first time, I received a notification of an exception by FedEx.  I called and was told the package was found to be damaged in Ocala, FL (I  live in the Tampa, FL area) and they told me to call Walmart.  Walmart immediately placed a replacement order for me.  The second one made it to Parrish, FL and I checked when I saw it going back to the Panhandle area of FL and was told by FedEx that package was damaged in route and was being returned to the sender.  I then called Walmart and they suggested that I would have to place a new order which I did.  It was supposed to arrive on the 26th.  I tracked it to be sitting in TN from early on the 25th and no contact by them.  When I called the first time they said it was delayed as they were snowed in.  I called back on the 27, seeing that it had not moved and was told they would put a trace on it and I would hear back within 48 hours.  72 hours later, no word from them and as it is now a Sunday, when I tried to call they are closed.  Surprise, Surprise.  This is simply an unacceptable way to do business in my  opinion and I am accordingly going to make another purchase now through Walmart.  My guess is that FedEx keeps having to pay for the damaged shipments and I am sure I am not the only one.  Perhaps with all these losses we will get lucky and they will be forced out of business (not likely) and Walmart will wake up and start using a more qualified shipper. If I could give FedEx a minus star rating I would!!!!

For transferring money, perhaps paypal is okay. However, for any sort of online purchases, the seller can scam you, and get paypal to side with them 100% of the time. Here is how it works (or rather not work in PayPal's case). The seller send a fake package (like an empty envelope) with tracking number to somewhere in buyer's city. The fake package will not have buyer's address so it will never be delivered. The tracking will show as delivered, and at this point if the buyer opens a "item not received" dispute with PayPal, PayPal will automatically side with the seller. PayPal official policy is this: as long as the seller provides a tracking number that shows something has been delivered to the buyer's city, PayPal will rule in favor of the seller pretty much 100% of the time. evidance from Canada Post will be ignored. At this point, only option left is typically to file a credit card charge back. Just want everyone to be aware of this.

I needed a place to stay for four months while in New York. I considered getting a sublet, or signing a lease, but it just seemed inconvenient when i couldn't view apartments in person and the time frame was not amenable to a lease. So, I started sending out messages to AirBnB hosts. I was very clear that I would be staying for four months and was a student doing an internship. I was also very clear that I wanted a place that would allow my fiancé to visit once a month. I finally found what i thought was a winner. $850/month for a room in a safe neighborhood that looked clean. When I got there, the owner did not speak english, which i was okay with, but she seemed surprised when I said I was staying for 4 months. Turns out she isn't the owner, but the mother of the owner who lives in the apartment, and just passes on messages from her daughter. Things were okay at first, the living room was not usable as it was filled with boxes and suitcases filled with god-knows-what. The woman, who was the mother, began staying up in the living room at all hours, listening to LOUD spanish tv on her computer. She would sit there and watch me cook, it was extremely uncomfortable. On top of all this, when my fiancé came to visit, she tells me I owe her $25 every night he visits. This was not what I had agreed on via messages through AirBnB. I start getting messages from the daughter that I owe her $89 and have repeatedly broken the house rules that there be no visitors. I'm shocked considering the message I have from her that says my fiancé would be okay to stay for two days once a month for free! I repeatedly reference the message and tell her I won't pay. After that neither of them say anything to me, but the mother comes into the apartment with another woman and two small children who are SCREAMING! The children spend the night over the weekend, and are running all over the apartment early in the morning. I had no notice this would happen, as the add on AirBnB says children are not allowed in the apartment. AirBnB was no help at all during this process, and they basically stated they have no control over the renters or additional fees. I work at a law firm as an intern, and have to sleep during the week. I'm not loud and I clean up after myself. But I HATED staying here! These people made it very uncomfortable, and they are just out to make a buck!

This is beyond unacceptable. I placed an order for contacts 4 days ago. It is still in the prescription verification page. I tried contacting them through their website and got a message saying they will get back to me within 24 hours. That time came and went without any information on their part. So I called them and talked to a customer service representative named Robin. Robin told me they would try again to verify my prescription and that the place that has my script hasn't gotten back to them. So that means they tried verifying my script and my order was just going to sit there until the place got back to them. I mentioned that the shipping stated I'd get my order in 5-7 buisness day. He said that happens after the order gets processed, and technically my order wasn't processed. Their website says "Contact Lenses Orders placed before 2:00pm EST will be processed that same business day. Instock contact lens orders ship out within 1 - 2 business days. " They are not being truthful on their website. It has been FOUR days. However, that is a fight I do not wish to partake in. Yet They had no trouble collecting my money for my order. That was processed instantly. I know that it is illegal to sell contacts in America without a script. But the law states that if the place does not get back to you within eight hours you can ship the contacts. I explained to the customer service representative Robin that I am on my last pair of contacts and that I need my order. The order should have been shipped at the latest yesterday. Then I asked the customer service representative what happens if the store doesn't get back to them, to which he replied that there were going to be options to consider. I asked him what the options were, and he said "he can't talk about them". I really do not know how you guys are getting away with operating a company with false claims on your website, and lying to your customers. I know I'm being really negative, but to me this is beyond unacceptable, which is why you are getting the 1 star. I wish negative stars were allowed.

We contacted the shuttle at 8:15 pm for pickup from the airport.   The person on the phone said the shuttle would be there to pick us up in 30 minutes.  At 9:00 pm, (giving the driver 15 extra minutes for traffic) we called back.   They assured us that the driver was a few minutes away.   The driver arrived at 10:15 pm.   Two hours after we called!   Then, on the day we were supposed to get the shuttle back to the airport, and AFTER we paid an Uber driver to take us to the location where we were meeting the shuttle, the shuttle company called and said they didn’t have anyone available to pick us up and we would have to find another way to the airport.

I have purchased from Amazon many time over the past year and their customer service, deals and especially the delivery service have gotten worse. I made a decent sized purchase of which their choice in courier service left on my front doorstep for the world to see. I came home hours later to having nothing there and me out of pocket for Christmas. The delivery policy is to leave the products in a safe location, I was totally unaware that a safe location to Intelcom, FedEx and Purolator is a front step in plane view of the street and that Amazon is ok with this service.

I responded to an advertised unit on SpareFoot -- 5' x 10' at the rate of $79.50 per month. The storage facility called me within an hour only to tell me they had no available 5' x 10' units, they were all rented. They also told me the monthly rate was $82 per month. I would not recommend using SpareFoot.

After we placed our order, Phone Power ran into difficulties porting our existing phone number because our current service is provided though a PBX located in the condo complex in which we live.  As a result, we do not receive an individual phone bill with our name on it.  A bulk bill is sent to our condo management company which redistributes the costs to individual co-owners via our monthly condo fees. At one point, Phone Power felt that we had provided sufficient information to port our existing phone number, so they accepted our order and shipped the VoIP modem to us.  However, after they had shipped the hardware, their telephone service provider refused to execute the order because we could not produce an invoice with the telephone number and our name and address on it.  Therefore, through no fault of our own, we had to cancel the order.  When we received the VoIP modem, I immediately returned it to Phone Power.   Since they shipped it before ensuring that their service provider had accepted the order, I requested that they reimburse me for the $17.57 that it cost me to return the hardware.  They refused. So, we were pleased with the people with whom we were dealing while trying to process the order, but were very displeased with the attitude of their Customer Service group regarding reimbursing me for the shipping charges to return the hardware that they never should have sent us in the first place.

I don't want to be a truck driver, but guess how many "recommendations" show up in my in-box for OTR/CDL Drivers? So far, every company with whom I've applied has been extremely slow to respond and slow to remove job postings that are no longer open. The few responses I've received for my resume' have been scams or other job sites. As a job-seeker, the market is pretty good, but the very impersonal, tedious methodology for applying is awful.  I've received turn-down notices from jobs nearly 3 months after applying, and the job itself was barely worth applying for in the first place. I feel it's pretty stupid to have to submit a resume' for a delivery job that pays just above minimum wage... I mean really???  And, on top of that, the HR personnel seem to be very apathetic.  Should a company that is reliant on low-skill level, high turnover manpower not have a more efficient screening process? As a job site, CareerBuilder may be the least of the evils, but it's still evil never-the-less.  Modern-day job seeking is very impersonal and extremely frustrating, and sites like CareerBuilder seem to only exacerbate the frustration!

If I were only rating customer service I would give a 4 or 5 star. They took care of my order issue immediately. However the majority of this rating is regarding the products. I purchased andro 1, 4, and andro EPI. I also purchased anabolic matrix but haven't used it yet. There was a lot of talk in the descriptions of these products that really made them look great. I'm about half way through them right now and have seen ZERO positive effects. No muscle gain,  no weight gain, no strength gain, nothing. All these do is give you severe heart burn. And I mean severe. I have to take them with an over the counter acid reducer I get from Costco. This review is not final as I still have half the bottle to go. But I would have hoped to see something. If somehow all the changes take place during the end of the cycle then I'll repost. But as of now, I work out for an hour 6 days a week. 5 of those are weight training, 1 is cardio and would think something spoken as highly as these products are on the website I would have had some increase somewhere. I don't even have the heightened libido spoken of as a natural side effect from these. If it wasn't for the heart burn I'd say these were sugar capsules.

although it seems wizz never reply to comments on here,I will still waste my time writing this review. I've flew with wizz a few times and although I think it's the Romanian way to be rude and not say please/thank you as a natural courtesy I would of assumed customer service training would of knocked that out of them. a recent flight from Liverpool to Cluj and the head stewardess who's name was Roxanne or Roxanna if I had spoke Romanian or she had spoke better English she would of got a mouthful from me but the language barrier would of proved difficult for me to ask her not to speak to me like I was a school child who had been naughty and she was having a bad day. we were waiting for take off which was delayed (the usual with wizz) i was on the second row, seat belt sign was not on, there was a row of 3 empty seats behind so I half stood up to get the Male flight attendants attention so ask if I could swap seats, for her to in an annoyed tone shout at me and say "SIT DOWN, I am about to do the safety information"  again..... the fasten seatbelt sign was not on. I get bad restless legs so often spend a good portion of flights standing up by the toilets. she asked me if i was waiting for the toilet when i said no i got told VERY rudely "THEN GO SIT IN UR SEAT IN THE CABIN"   I have never been told this,so far this year I have flew 3 times, so 6 flights and never been told I have to go sit down. her fake smile the whole flight was uncomfortable, u could tell she didnt want to be in work, she was short with a passenger 2 seats behind because his window blind was down. I get it safety but she was very rude to him also. of course when the captain came out to use the toilet and stretch his legs she was like a different person, smiling and flirting with him. unfortunately I fly back home with wizz tomorrow and I am hoping she is not one of the crew.

I had purchased 3 tickets through Vayama.  I was sent to the website from Kayak.  I thought the transaction in general was concerning.  It didn't ask for any information besides our names and only my address.  After I submitted my request I looked up reviews on Vayama in which they were all horror experiences.  I received a confirmation email immediately and a few hours later received my E-tickets.  I looked at my bank statement and saw pending charges for my tickets and a separate one for the insurance.  I checked back 5 days later.  The pending charge for my ticket disappeared but the charge for the insurance went through.  I called Vayama.  I was told that the money was taken out of my account but they were waiting for verification from my bank.  I called my bank (in which I've never had any issues with) they said that the money was pending to come out of my account but Vayama took to long to have the charges go through so the payment was dropped and no future payments were scheduled.  I called Vayama back.  Vayama said that the payment had been delayed and it wouldn't process for at least another 2-3 days.  I continued to read reviews of people having issues.  Out of fear of losing my tickets last minute/not getting my money back/not be able to on a trip with my child I decided to cancel the ticket.  When I called I explained that I had not been charged for my ticket.  The woman continued to tell me that I did even though I explained that I had been in contact with my bank. I actually said "how can I have paid for these tickets when my bank has no proof of this charge" she said thats how it works and it will show up in my bank statement in 10-15 days. So I said I wanted to cancel my ticket. They told me it was $400 dollars to cancel my flight even thought I had purchased insurance.  They gave me another number to call in which I haven't done yet.  I don't understand how Im being charged for a $400 to cancel a ticket I never even paid for.   Being a single mom and having saved up for literally YEARS for this tickets overseas to visit family has me beyond frustrated/upset/angry. I've talked to Vayama 3 different times today and every time have been told something different. I don't understand why it the money would be pending out my account.. disappear.. then come back and take 10-15 days to process.  I've had my fair share of flights and I've never bought a ticket that took 10-15 days to process.  As of right now I have the "tickets" in which I never paid for. So I'm just waiting for them to be swiped away from me.

If I could leave less than 1 star I would! This has been the WORST car buying experience of my life. When I purchased the first vehicle I was told the day prior that my delivery would be delayed 1 week, then they stated they could get it to me later that week but to keep from taking another day off work they. had me change my delivery to my work address, upon changing the contract my finance terms changed dramatically for the worse. Then the vehicle had what was clearly cigarette burns all over the two front seats of the car and up by the visor, really with this intense inspection they supposedly put their vehicles through?! After finding another vehicle all was set for yet another delivery at 9 am. At 8:20 am of delivery date the driver called to let me know the freight truck broke down and he would drive the vehicle to me and arrive in 20 minutes. At 9 am he again called to tell me the 3 year old Nissan Altima was making terrible noises and he was taking it to a mechanic but he suspected it was transmission issues. I then cancelled that car and I am now on car #3. Once I completed this purchase the terms of my financing changed again and they said to get back to my originally quoted down payment of $500 I had to purchase the Carvana Care Plan and extend my monthly payments by 3 months and increase my payments by $14 dollars. Real shady business! Trying to deal with customer service you wait on hold for minutes, then wait for your call to be return for another extended period of time. Then every customer service rep is clueless and does nothing to help. How they have an A+ BBB rating is beyond me! I wouldn't recommend Carvana to my worst enemy. I would rather sit in a car dealership and deal with that slime all day then deal with Carvana.

The issue that I was trying to get resolved was simple and was my mistake (though I think one that was easy to make). I ordered a Mac version of software rather than a Windows version. I realized my mistake before downloading and asked to swap for the Windows version. The answer was an absolute no, that there were no returns on software. Ordered a bag, told to expect delivery within 5-12 days of manufacture. It arrived 19 days after dispatch so, of course, more than 12 days after manufacture, too late for the intended gift and was not of the type ordered. When I enquired (after 12 days waiting) where the bag was I was told "12 WORKING days" meaning Mon-Fri - this limitation was not apparent at the time of ordering. In any event it took more than 12 working days to arrive. Beware the "100% satisfied" guarantee. Again more apparent than actual and about as reliable as a statement by Donald Trump - return postage costs (borne by the customer) render this guarantee worthless unless the item is above about £20. Avoid Zazzle like the plague unless you want to be deceived and disappointed.

I received an email from Rowan, the company's founder, saying I won $50 in wine from joining a Cooking Light contest. So here's where they're sneaky: 1. The email title said I won $50 in wine, but the gift card they gave me was only for $40. 2. You can't buy anything for $40 from the website. If you're not an 'Angel', someone who has invested in the company to help winemakers, then you have to pay regular price for a bottle. The cheapest bottle they had when I checked the website about 3 weeks ago and again today is $9.99, and in order to checkout you have to buy at least 6 bottles to complete a case. That's ($9.99 x 6) + (S&H $9.99) = $69.93. This means you have to spend an extra $30 to use your free wine card. Sneaky. 3. I didn't win anything if I have to spend money on it. They said I won a FREE $50 wine card. Won? HA!
