So I run this little website for Ireland's largest angling club. All goes well for some years and I'm really happy with the system despite its quirkiness. Then for no reason I can understand the site starts to gobble up bandwidth - so much so that I repeatedly exceed the bandwidth allocation and Webs repeatedly suspend the site - actually take it down. So I talk to customer service via email and their is no explanation, no offer of any practical help. The only solution they offer is to upgrade my account - effectively buy more bandwidth. It seems I have no option so I upgrade and all this achieves is a slightly longer interval before the increased bandwidth is exceeded and the site is suspended. Then some weeks later I get a message from a Webs telling me in in accessible techno speak that many sites such as mine are experiencing similar problems. Apparently it is all about systems that piggy back on your site to boost the traffic on another site making that site appear more popular than it actually is. In the same message I'm told if I have such a problem then I should contact Webs customer services - but what would be the point? My solution - I'm running down the Website while at the same time migrating the content to Facebook. It is much less hassle, costs nothing and the real bonus is that I never again have to deal with Webs' deceitful customer service who sell me additional bandwidth when they know it will not resolve my problems and offer nothing in the way of practical help.

I worked with Michael Smith at Health Plan One at Medicare Solutions.  When I talked with him about finding a cheaper plan he said that he could find a plan.  I gave him a list of my medications, and he thought a Humana Advantage plan would for me.  It also covered dental, hearing and optical for a cost lower than my present supplement Cost program.I gave him the name of my Primary clinic -- North Clinic.  He told me that it was in network.  He also told me that if I was not satisfied, I could revert to my old Medica Cost Plan if I was dissatisfied. Because I am a nurse who has helped patients get prior auths. I questioned him about this.  He reaffirmed his statement.  I then agreed to register for the plan with Humana. I asked that it start on 8/1/2018 because I wanted to have my card before I started.   After I completed on online register, I searched for my clinic, and could not find it.  North Memorial Clinic was in network, but this clinic was different than my clinic -- North Clinic.  I called Humana and spoke with a customer service rep,  and she told me that I was right .I called Michael back to discontinue this change as I did not want to change clinics after nearly 30 years with my Primary.  He told me to call Humana.  The person I talked to at Humana told me I could discontinue my policy effective 8/1/18, but that I would need to talk to my current carrier. I also discovered that the policy was to go in force 7/1, not 8/1.  I called Medica to return to my policy, was told I could not return to it as it was a Medicare Cost Plan, which was to be discontinued and they could not write those policies any further.  I told her what Michael told me about being able to revert to my previous Insurer (Medica).  The representative at Medica said there no such option.  I called Michael back again; He told me that it was Medicare 12G rule.  I again called Medica back with this information, and was told they had never heard of this.  I then called Medicare, and spoke with a representative about this, and she said she had never heard of this before, and she had been in her position for 5 years, and she checked with her supervisor who also had never heard of it.  The Medicare Rep. then told me she was going to write a complaint of this broker for Marketing misrepresentation.  She also aided me to get my Medica Plan back. I also searched the Medicare manual for 12G., and found that Most regulations have a 12G as a sub rule of the General rule. When I did a search, using various queries I was repeatedly was redirected to the Home Care regs., I have also placed a call to the Minnesota state regulator in the Dept. Of Commerce.  I have spent more than 10 hours on this, and I'm still not sure if I will have a policy other than Humana on 8/1,I have had to cancel my appt with my Primary, and with my therapist and Psychiatrist.  I have had to cancel Physical Therapy as well.  I know that the Hospital near me is in network, so if I have a medical emergency, I will go there. This not okay!

They are scammers. They book you at nice low rate (however, not fully disclosing details of your flight, you can only see name of the airline), take your CC and then send you request to call. When you call, they tell you that only 2 out of 3 sits are available at that rate (clearly seeing that I am flying with two kids) and then... oh magic! they did something so now 3 seats are available at $90 more per ticket. When I said that  I am checking right now directly with the airline and rates are lover than you are offering me now and seats are available, they say that's not true, there are no seats at that rate, airlines just did not update it. And then - oh, another magic - they can lover their offer to only additional $50.00 per ticket. At that point it is clearly a scam. Asked them cancel transaction, do not charge anything, I do not agree with this scam. Now I have to watch my CC, making sure there are no unauthorized charges. A minute later I went directly to Lufthansa website and purchased three tickets (that were available by the way with only 30% seats taken) at very affordable rate.  Dear Justairticket, no need to copy-paste your standard reply, if you just stop scamming people that would be nice!

You think Amazon.com has a good service until your account got locked out for no reason.  I cannot login to my account since December, 2018.  I received NO communication from Amazon.  I made more than 20 phone calls to customer service who cannot provide any reason for the account suspension.  The so called "specialists" have no phone you can call, they do not read your email, they simply do not care.  The only hope to get you gift card money back and your ebook back is to initiate a lawsuit, At DMV, Social Security and INS you just need to wait.  At Amazon, they do not tell you anything about your account.  You do not know how long you have to wait to get your money, ebook and account back. If you are a seller who got suspended for no reason, Amazon will keep your money as long as they like and your inventory at the "Fulfilled By Amazon" (FBA) warehouses until someday someone decides to get ride of it.  The only hope to get your money and inventory back is to bring Amazon to the court, if you still have sufficient financial resources left to hire a lawyer. AVOID Amazon if you could  !!!!

From the point of calling to place the order to the point of install. On the phone I was asked if I wanted a credit protection. I said no two times. when done I was transfer to the automated portion of the call and told that in three month I would be bill for the credit protection. During the install I was told the company no longer supply's told for the tech to pull cabling though walls. The choice I was given was to upgrade for a fee to the hopper system. Later I was told it could be done but for a fee of $100 per wall. When the cabling was ran. It was placed on the outside wall in a closet. The wire being drill though to the bedroom. To make the connection to the hopper. During the install a person arrived and claimed to be the installers manager. He took pictures of my tv. With no explanation of why. He also went though the house while the installer explained the operation of the hopper. It made me  feel very uncomfortable to the point of calling dish tv. When I called They were not able to tell me if the manager actually works for dish. The man claiming to be the manager did offer to sell me part to install the cabling in the wall myself. Also offer to hang the tv for me at a cost. Before leaving the manager asked me to give the installer nine on the  Survey that would follow the install. It felt less like asking and more like telling. From what I've witnessed dish tv no longer does installs. They should tell customers from the start. That they will need to buy the hopper upgrade during the sales. And if it's a real practice to send people to check up on installers work. The customer should be advise that there is a possibility of this kind of process. I'm still wondering if that person actually works for dish tv. And worrying that we may be rob in the near future. I have no complaints with the systems function at this time.

Ordered a package from Philips in the Netherlands. The parcel reached Cumbernauld in central Scotland in a day and a half. Over 6 days later it is still 'in transit' with no details whatsoever beyond Cumbernauld. What is the point in a tracking service that doesn't provide tracking or is the parcel just being shuffled around the warehouse while someone works out what to do next? Since I live around 60 miles away, I hadn't expected the part of the journey within Scotland to take over 4 times as long (and counting) as that from mainland Europe. UPS are far from the cheapest delivery service so what exactly differentiates them from their less expensive competitors.

This is a review of the overall corporation and their online business. I always choose arrangements that are processed & delivered by local florists in their network.  I don't want flowers in a box that have been in the back of an hot / unrefrigerated UPS truck for 12 hours.  So I ordered an arrangement that would be in a basket that was to be delivered by a local florist (my mom is elderly, and I don't want her fumbling with a glass vase). I've used 1800Flowers a few times in the past, but they really screwed-up my Mothers Day shipment.  They called the morning the arrangement was supposed to arrive to tell me "sorry, but the florist has run out of flowers".  That's like saying McDonald's has run out of hamburgers.  It's FRIDAY morning, 2 days before Mothers Day -- are you serious?!?!?!? Someone in customer support calls me that I can barely hear.  She tries to get me to agree to some boxed flowers shipped by a ground courier.  No vase, no basket, just crushed, over-heated flowers in a box.  She tells me she needs to check on options and will call me back.  This cycle is repeated several times. I finally call a local florist (which is what I should have done from the start), and they were able to fulfill my order ASAP. 1800Flowers was supposed to call me back in 15 minutes.  1 hour later, still no call.  I had to call the customer service 800#.  I got a different person who told me that the florist is not "out of flowers", but they are overloaded with orders so they can't honor all the orders that they accepted.  I canceled the order, and will never use them again. Stick with local companies.  You may pay a little more, but who needs this drama & aggravation.  Who knows how many others are dealing with the same problem.

I bought a ticket to see Joan Jett in Tucson, Arizona on September 2nd, 2018. The show was canceled. I know it was canceled because I was there. I waited in line for over an hour in a lightening storm before it was canceled. It was not postponed, it was canceled. I called customer service and was told the show was completed, not canceled. I asked how they verified that, and no answer was given. After asking to speak to someone who attended the show, I was informed that I would get a call back from "their team of experts." Again, I was there, so you may be able to lie to other customers, but I have video footage, friends with plenty of Instagram photos, and not to mention a credit union who does not take kindly to fraud. Good luck weasling out of this one StubHub. Your terms of service state a full refund if a show is canceled...I bet you won't win an argument with my bank when it comes to false claims. *I see your reply StubHub, but I already gave your “team of experts” that information when I called yesterday. I’ll wait for them to call me back since they assured me I would be hearing from someone in a timely manner.  Also, I like how you replied to a post that I can’t reply back to openly, clever!

Incredibly inept logistics and service teams are doubled down with return/refund policies that are downright criminal.  Before you order, please understand there is a 30%!!! return fee for cancelling an order after 48 hours, one of the most obscene consumer robbery schemes I've ever seen. I ordered an in-stock item that said "ships within 24 hours" and got an email the next day that it had shipped....to another facility 10 miles down the road in California.  Where it sat for 8 days without moving. During this time, I placed 3 different phone calls to ask what was happening with my delivery and why it hadn't moved.  Each time I was told I would get a call back with info, and never did. After the shipment finally arrived in my city, more than 2 weeks after I ordered it, I had to then coordinate with the local delivery service, as I had purchased the "white glove delivery".  They informed me that it would be another 11 days before they could bring the order out to my house. Working again with the service reps, I was told that my options were to wait basically another 2 weeks, drive to a secured shipping facility with my own truck and pick up the order (they refused to pay for the rental truck), or cancel my order and eat 30% of the order cost. At every step, I was made to feel like I was the unreasonable one for not understanding that they have the right to tell me something has "shipped" when it is really sitting in a warehouse for 8 days and hasn't left originating city yet.  And made to feel unreasonable for being upset that once my order made it here and was sitting in a local facility just a few miles away, I would have to wait another 2 weeks, when this easily could have been scheduled while the package was (finally) in transit if there was any kind of coordination with the logistics team or anyone who cared about servicing customers. Definitely my last ever purchase from this company

I scheduled my service with Handy via a purchase from Wayfair.  I work from home and was eagerly awaiting the technician to arrive.  When he was 15 minutes late, I received a text from him, confirming my appointment.  I responded via text immediately, but he did not get my message because the only way they communicate is via the Handy App.  Once I installed that and responded, I was told the technician had been to my house and was no longer in the area.  I could reschedule, but the soonest appointment was four days from now.  I replied explaining that I was here all day.  If the technician had called or emailed, he would have gotten an immediate response from me.  If he had knocked on my door or rung the bell, my dog would have heard it if I missed it for some reason.  The response from Handy actually said "no worries - we can just reschedule".  So much for 100% satisfaction guarantee (because that is only if you book directly with Handy). Do not recommend doing business with this company.

The basic language learning is good.  However, what doesn't work well is the support exercises. For instance, we should be able to play language games with other online learners.  However, each time I have tried to pair up with someone else, no one else has been available.  I have done this 20--30 times, at least.  Consequently, the classes, that are 25 minutes in length, becomes the only time a student has to actually speak the language to another person.  That is not enough time.  Something needs to be done about actually using and speaking the language regularly.  Otherwise, the Rosetta Stone system is not much further above a phone App.

Monday comes around, still listed as "Processing".  Try to call Pinkbasis to find out what's going on, nothing but busy signals on both phone lines , can't even be put on hold. Received hinges without screws. Afterwards learned that screws had to be ordered separately. Seriously! How many people order 10 hinges with a nickel finish have the screws to install them? That would be, NONE! If they have to be ordered separately then your system should query the buyer whether or not they need screws before the order is completed to eliminate job delays.

I've used Uship for the last 2 months to ship 5 separate LTL shipments. 3 of those shipments were lost for over 1 week. 1 of those shipments was never picked up by the carrier. After discovering their carelessness, I most recently selected a guaranteed 3 day delivery service, which also lead to my last pallet being lost! Uship offered no assistance and later increased my invoice to include additional fuel costs, even though I drove to freight center that it was eventually located in, to pick the pallet up myself. In my experience, purchasing additional services will not "guarantee" anything, and they will take advantage of their customers and void their "guarantees". Under no circumstances would I ever recommend this company to anyone who ships freight. Thought their booking process may be easy and streamlined, they do not care about your shipments. The issues I have experienced with Uship are not unique, apparently this happens frequently.

Firefly took our money for a car rental online booking (through Ryanair).  However when we arrived at Perugia airport Firefly were no longer operating from that airport - SOMETHING THEY SURELY KNEW AT THE TIME OF BOOKING!! At no point before our arrival were we notified of this. So we were stranded with no car.  Has anyone ever tried to contact these people - absolute nightmare - and Ryanair didn't want to know! We had no choice but to take an alternative car from another company which cost us over £500 (for a week) on top of what we had already paid Firefly. We have had a constant battle trying to contact someone for the full refund, only to be continually fobbed off with a part refund meaning we are still around £270 out of pocket.  It is impossible to take them through the small claims court as they don't appear to have a full registered address anywhere?!! Now seeking legal advice. Will never book with them again - AVOID AT ALL COST!

In the end, it took a supervisor to intervene and assist me with the process.  He, too, had a thick foreign accent, but I could understand his words alot clearer.  The trip itself was absolutely perfect----the flight to and from, the hotel and the rental car. I will use Travelocity again, but I will try to stick to a plan that is completed online and avoids talking to anyone on the phone.

If I could give 0 stars I would. I was charged 32.50 pounds (about $60AUD) to check-in at the airport. I missed online check-in by 40min (3hr before the original departure) - even though the flight was already delayed for another 2 hours. The most unbelievable part was when I suggested that in the future, they consider sending reminder emails to customers to check-in online - what I thought was a fair, reasonable and standard feedback - and the airline staff started abusing me! It was weirdly aggressive and totally uncalled for. As a solo female traveller who dislikes confrontation... I will never fly with this airline again. The 2hr delay which meant I arrived at the destination way past midnight and missed all my connections. Not to mention all the extra expenses incurred due to their hidden fees and unexplained delay. On top of being abused by airline staff!! AVOID at all costs.

We had some negative experience about a property and host arrangements. There seems to be no way to report our concern to airbnb. The nominated host was not present, the family member in charge was drunk at 9am. The host apologised for not being home and offered to refund one night. I just think the situation is known by the host and do not want any younger guests to be at risk. Why cant we report this to airbnb?

I filled out 10 surveys but was only rewarded points for taking one of them. The other nine: the site said a survey was filled to capacity AFTER I submitted it, and they'd reward me two cents as compensation. I'd fill out a survey for 15 minutes because the site asked for thoughtful responses then I'd only get 2 cents. Not worth it. Also, sometimes the site randomly redirects you to another survey.

I just started with Amazon Prime.  In order to get a quick item to my teenaged nieces and nephews I decided to order gift cards because Amazon promotes their gift cards saying 1 day delivery.  I wanted to give them an item to open so I chose the ones that come in a tin.  I ordered on the 21st.  as of the 24th they were not delivered and then I discover, were not even shipped out until the 23!  I never would have  ordered Amazon gift cards if I thought they may not arrive on time or that they would not ship.  I received no email spoiler alerts, nothing.  The tracking says now they are expected to arrive on the 26th!   Great.   VISA CARDS by mail may have arrived late also, but, my nieces and nephews could use that card anywhere-mall, gas station, restaurant.  I'm never ordering an Amazon gift card again. No value whatsoever, only limited and inconvenient.  I don't trust Amazon's shipping claims either.  I would allow for a week at least, to be safe. If you have to order an Amazon gift card, do it electronically.  At least there is an email record and they can't be lost.
The new billing/shipping system is cumbersome and poorly designed. The old system was much easier to work with. I don't like that a previous order's info shows when I'm placing a new order.

Ordered infinity pro for ps4 ok Christmas of 2017 when I got the controller about a week later it had multiple malfunctions including trigger stopper buttons popping out randomly, the R2 trigger completely didn’t work, and the trigger hairs that I payed extra for didn’t work on the R2 trigger, the right scuff paddle didn’t work at all. On top of all this the controller purchase does not include a charging cord as you would expect any controller that cost 150+$ to have. This leads me to filling out the repair return form for the newly opened controller that I’ve had less than 24 hrs. I ship out the controller and wait over 4 weeks before hearing anything besides an email that they received the controller. I called on February 22 to obtain the information that my controller is being shipped back out to me. Considering I’ve not gotten to use the controller and it’s end of February And the order was placed before January I would say this is ridiculous. On top of all this every time I have called Custmomer support they where short, rude and reluctant to helping me with my issues that I should not be dealing with in the first place because of there faulty product.

I called on a Saturday after calling several tire retailers and received a quote. It was the lowest price I received so ordered a tire for delivery on Monday. When I arrived at the local store they said that the price I was quoted was wrong and that I would owe almost $100 more. After negotiating for a bit since this was apparently a "system error" I got the price down and closer to the original quote. I also had to wait over an hour longer than they told me it would take. Definitely feel like this was a bait and switch.

My order consisted of some integrated circuits. They were packaged in a ziplock bag with no protection, they were received with the pins bent and broken. The next item that I received was obviously a returned item with missing parts.

My problem is not with the service we received. We ordered a case of thick sliced bacon steaks and they came promptly and packaged well. We had purchased some previously at a grocery store in another city and fell in love with them. Not being able to find them locally, we decided to order them from the source. My disappointment is that the majority of the packages are mostly fat. There were about 4 that have a decent amount of lean. In the future we will have to wait until we find it in a store and pick out our own packages.

I to ran into problems with not paying taxes. I heard the commercial. Got the estimate and paid my part. Optima tax never did anything for me. I kept getting the run around and being told I never sent paperwork in or had to repeat. Every time someone called it was new. After awhile it came time to file taxes for the current year. I went to my local tax preparer and had it done and had all my previous problems solved. For a much considerably LOWER PAYMENT. And one reason they have such good reviews is if you complain they will give you a very small refund in exchange for amending your reviews. Granted they probable help a few people, but probably majority of people can have it done face to face with local preparer and for much cheaper

Was ready to make  a purchase Put item in my cart Didn't  want to enter Card information  since I was at work When I got home I went online to check and item was 10 more Same  thing happened next day Why does your price change  so much in a day so often

same--just fair warning-i have ordered several bikes over internet--no problems--this bike was assembled wrong from factory--my calls to the company were never returned--they finally emailed maybe 7-10 days later--even then when i said great--what do i do about the front wheel being out of true--no reply--they are really good at hyping themselves but the follow through is just not there

Hi, I had made a booking under reservation number 135272294 for a flat in London and made the payment by credit card for GBP 970/- or so on May 8th 2019. A few hours later I received an email from VEEVE, the property manager saying that the flat is unavailable and that my credit card has not been charged. However, my credit card was actually charged a Service Fee of GBP 77/- by HOMEAWAY.COM under Invoice no USHA13C0022957708 and Order no FYTHPCG as per HOMEAWAY invoice dated May 8th, 2019. So the booking was actually never confirmed but I was charged a Service Fee. I was unable to send any email to HOMEAWAY regarding this issue as I did not see any contact email or phone no at HOMEAWAY.COM. I did follow up with VEEVE who claimed that they cannot refund this amount as this charge was made by HOMEAWAY and not VEEVE. I have used HOMEAWAY several times previously and this is the first time something like this has happened and I am extremely disappointed by the lack of contact info at HOMEAWAY and the  indifferent attitude of the property management company. Please arrange to have this amount refunded to my credit card as this this boooking was never confirmed. Rony Thomas Dubai

Storage mart Oakland Mandela parkway Put all my things in in June... come back in October to grab some hiking boots  out of unit and find the locks changed... ask manager why and she says” maybe they thought you hadn’t paid on time”. I inform her that I had been paying on time ... she takes me to my unit and noticed the new locks are red... lets me know that multiple units had been broken into back in August.... I ask her why no one had called me ... she says she thought they did(what?!!). Lock had been cut... unit was a mess with boxes open and things thrown everywhere....they stole a 2000 dollar carbon road bike, an acoustic electric bass guitar, power drill, and my bong (whyyyyy?). I fill out claim and complete police report same day and they tell me should be 6 weeks before I can get my money(unit was insured for up to 3000). It is now Jan 11 and I haven’t received a penny... have called multiple times since then to check on status and always get the run around ... half the time they make it sound like I don’t even exist in their system... now I have to pursue some sort of legal action. Do yourself a favor and use Public Storage. Ps this building layout is like a spider web and moving things in and out is a pain in the butt
Once you order parts from them... They harass w emails that you cannot unsubscribe from.  Will never order from them again.

I ordered a shirt from this site and received one completely different. The material is a very thin polyester, the design cuts off at the top of the shoulders in a triangle pattern . I ordered a small and this fits my dad. The pattern on the site was vibrant, this one is dull and putrid. I hope I can return it because I paid US dollars. Came out to 65$ for a cheap shirt.

I ordered memory and a router. The memory portion of the order was canceled AFTER they shipped the second item I ordered and TigerDirect still charged me $8 tax and full shipping on the $26.00 router. A incredibly nasty rep HUNG UP on me when I called in to inquire about a credit for the difference. I've never heard of a company only partially cancelling an order. Generally if something is wrong with the order, they notify you before any part of it ships, or if it ships, they honor the mistake. The TigerDirect rep literally told me "it's not our fault we carry many items and mistakes happen." If its not their fault, it's MY fault then? If I had recorded the conversation, it would have gone viral faster than the infamous Comcast cancelation request from July 2014. I have to open a case with American Express for fraud. TigerDirect...hasn't changed in 20 years. Still the same shady company. It's pretty obvious this price "mistake" was intentional when considering they didn't "discover" is for four days, plenty of time to ship the "filler" items.

I made a reservation for an outdoor parking space for my RV and was very pleased that I was able to do so online. I got everything ready and went to the Cube Smart location that I had booked. When I got there, I found that there was no space. The lady in the office was very apologetic and even somewhat embarrassed that the reservation had been accepted  because all of the parking spaces had been previously booked. She was able to tell me that another location had spaces available, but it was quite a distance from where I live. Thus far, I have been unable to secure a parking space in the immediate area. How would you feel?

Limited store locations, had to travel 1 hour each way to find out store has limited sizes and did not have what I was looking for. $100 for socks and underwear?  Unacceptable. Wake up. You got rid of Waterbury, bad move.

When you order from zazzle.co.uk, they will ship the order from USA using UPS. UPS might bill you for taxes + quite an amount for their 'service'. So if you thought zazzle.co.uk  is a EU company, you are wrong and you could have to pay 50% extra for your order. I have asked Zazzle to inform about that on their website, but until now they haven't, so a warning from here. I am disappointed about orders from Zazzle. I placed two orders for Christmas gifts. One has not arrived. The other was delivered without any print, meaning it is not a special gift, but something you can just buy downtown at a considerable lower price. I got a refund for this order but it is irritating that you do not receive what you order.

I suggest for them to be specific on their minimum requirements before future clients apply and send bank statements. I was told to email bank statements , which took a very long time, to then receive an email from a rep stating that their minimum requirement is $8500 a month in deposits. I was only requesting a $5000 loan as a start up. Just a waist of time. The website should be update it and state the minimum requirements, unless they are basing this client by client, which is not ethical.
Simply dresses was prompt with their delivery. The quality of the dress was terrible. We overpaid for a CHEAP dress!!! Gems were falling off every second. What a waste of money.

The dress shipped within the correct time frame.  The sizing is off.  We ordered a size too big and the sleeves were too tight and the dress was way too short.  Returned it the next day to find out I have to wait 1-2 weeks for a refund !! Ridiculous since I live in the same state as the warehouse!! Never again will I order from Prom Girl!

i wanted to surprise my wife with roses. They called her at work to make sure she would be there to accept the flower delivery.....she called me to see if I was sending her flowers...thanks alot 1800flowers.

The Sixity website had the wrong part number on their listing and thus I received the wrong part.  Customer Service is also impossible to get a hold of both via phone and email.  I had to pay return shipping and the 15% restocking fee. I will order the part locally from the dealership next time.

Didn't get the e-gift card in 24 hours.  The email said they needed to verify my account.  I clicked the link, but then it said you needed to call me.  I was traveling and never got a call.  I also never got to spend the money on the card on my travel home, like I wanted to.  The card came in after a couple of days -- much longer than I expected.

Do not pay for expedited shipping! I placed 2 orders Wednesday night. I ordered the first one expedited shipping for an extra $9.95. I ordered the second one regular mail. The regular mail arrived Saturday. The expedited 2 day didn't arrive until Monday! The company refuses to see how ludicrous this is and refund the the extra $9,95 I paid for nothing. They have lost a customer! This is actually deceptive trade practices as they are charging for a service that, not only do you not receive, but had you not chosen, you receive your package faster! After numerous emails today, it is blatantly apparent that they just plain do not care. Shop where they appreciate your business (NOT HERE!)

I live in New Jersey but hit a pothole in New York state and severely damaged my car it was not drivable. The insurance agent I dealt with gave me extremely wrong information. She told me that no one in New York state was an authorized MJM repair shop and I would have to pay personally the difference between their price and what njm allowed for the repair.  She further told me that if I didn't want to expose myself to Lang out cash to repair my car besides my deductible that I could personally pay the $900 towing fee to have the car towed to New Jersey to an njm approved repair shop.   I thought this was the most ludicrous option in the world and had to get her supervisor involved.  It took one week to get an njm approved appraiser to look at the car before they could begin work. I was stressed out to have my car for over a week in New York state enough that I didn't have to deal with this nonsense and uninformed agent. this is the second time I got an agent that was not knowledgeable and gave me wrong information. I thought in njm was a premier insurance company and I have all my insurance with them. I'm beginning to rethink that

After paying for a room last minute I didn't expect the best room in the hotel but I did pay more for what I expected to be a nicer room. Alas no, hidden at the back of the hotel our room was small and smelled of blocked drains. The service at the desk was good and the rooftop bar pleasant if a touch dear. The breakfast however, was served in a room whose atmosphere harked to what can only be described as Butlins Bognor Regis, the modern past its best version not the classic 1960's vision. The food was very limited as was the crockery, the only available item being soggy toast on a saucer from the drinks table. When some more croissants were bought out there was a scrum at the table and two seconds later no food left at all. Very disappointed would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Worse experience ever! They put the wrong size of tires on my car, when I go back to change them they try to put another brand of tires that were of less quality than the ones I had gotten in the first place for the same price of the higher brand I had asked for. The manager tried to argue with me that they were the same quality and price, after I had done my research. When they took off the first set of tires they had put on, they claimed that my wheel studs were broken. What I don't understand is why did they not tell me the studs where broken the first time they put the tires on that same day, the manager argued that we had broken them. It was the worse experience ever, I live 2 hours away, my brother had to drive my mom back home 2 hours, so she could make it to work, I had to stay in Bellflower, CA until the next day because they did not have the tires for my car and had to order them, I tried canceling my order and go to another tire shop but was unable too because they had broken my wheel studs and I was not able to drive my car. We were in the Los Angeles area visiting my grandma,  we were not able to see because of their horrible service. They new wheel studs for free, but did not receive any discount for the inconvenience and the unnecessary money we had to spend taking my mom back home. I paid $700 for the greatest headache. THANK YOU American Tire Depot for your horrible service!

We booked tickets a while ago and everything went good. We received an e-mail with all the information we needed. But yesterday we received an e-mail that our airline got cancelled, the route we reserved was no longer valid. We needed to contact the flight agency ourselves and search for a new airline. I always thought that this was the job of the company where you book your flight with. But ok, we tried to arrange it ourselves... When I tried to call to Bravofly (Belgium) I was very disappointed to hear that they could only speak French. Belgium is a bilingual country, so it would be nice if they would speak English at least! Then I called to Bravofly of the Netherlands. I did not receive any help. The only message i got was that we really have to arrange everything by ourselves... Today we tried to call the flight agency of the cancelled airline. We lost almost 3 hours calling to different countries. You can imagine the cost... They informed us that they cannot arrange another flight! They told us that Bravofly should make contact with another agency and look for another flight. We hope the people of Bravofly will do their job now and try to arrange something for us. We are very disappointed in the help we received so far, we hope this message will stimulate Bravofly to do their job and help us. Maybe then we can give you a more positive rating. I think you might need it, considering the average rating... Hope to hear from you soon! Update: after sending e-mails and again calling to Bravofly, we're still stuck in the same situation! Bravofly isn't able to find us a new airline from Shanghai  to Amsterdam. Nevertheless, a little search on the internet showed me that there are a lot of alternative airlines. But no... Bravofly says that if the flight of China Eastern Airlines changes from hours, that China eastern airlines should offer a different airline. Of course there is no different airline and Bravofly isn't even willing to look for one from another agency like KLM. I thought we booked a whole package with Bravofly and I think they should make sure that there is a connection provided between the different flights. If they are not willing to do that, then they shouldn’t sell people those kind of deals. Next to that I think it's just outrageous  that people need to search for a new connection for themselves, isn't that what we pay you for? UPDATE: Hello Bravofly, It’s seems impossible that Bravofly will be able to do anything for our trip. So the only option we’ve got is to ask for our money back. But first I would like to know how this works, how much of our money we will actually get back (because I’ve already read that most of the time people don’t see allot of their money back with Bravofly). Of course I don’t only want to cancel the airline from Shanghai to Amsterdam (the one that has changed), but we have to cancel the whole deal. We won’t fly to Bali if Bravofly can’t arrange to get us back to Amsterdam. So we want to cancel the whole reservation and get the money back of this whole reservation. I hope Bravofly doesn’t pay himself out first with my money, since Bravofly didn’t do any good work for me. After all this drama, all the calling, all the misery Bravofly had put us true, it would almost be fair to get a compensation! I hope this time I will get an acceptable answerl. That would be a nice change after all effort I’ve been through… Booking a trip with Bravofly was the worst idea ever…  I really hope we will be compensated for this failure of Bravofly. It would be the only reasonable thing to do. Thank you for doing your job. You will be hearing from us.

I have used UpWork for around two years and have spent $10,000s in transactions. To cut a long story short, the account is deactivated and closed - final decision. They mention discussing alternative payment methods since they don't want users leaving the platform. And yes, many people I have hired ask if they can do this, yet I have not done so and my regular milestones support this. They aren't interested. Thus, they've lost me as a customer and have left those I hired unhappy. The outcome? Those I hired are leaving the platform - the very thing UpWork was so paranoid about in the first place. Good move UpWork - your policy must be news to the ears of alternatives such as Freelancer and PeoplePerHour who are welcoming those affected. As a final note, UpWork has been offline for huge amounts of time over the last 4 months, at times been offline for up to 6 hours. Poor and unacceptable service all around. AVOID UPWORK.

Coinbase has some of the worst customer service out there. For a major online digital wallet and digital currency trading forum, they really have terrible website design, security, and support. The website will offer you log-in options such as "keep me signed in on this computer," or "don't ask me for a verification code on this device for 30 days." Clicking the box for these items will make no difference---you will not stay signed in, and you will be asked for a verification code.  Under account settings, I have the option to "turn off 2-step verification." I keep this set on "off."  Regardless, I have to take 3 or more steps to verify my account every single time I log in.  This includes receiving text messages, emails, uploading photo ID's every time I log in, and taking selfies of my face via webcam every time I log in.  Usually the selfie's fail the verification process, so it takes me about 3 attempts to log in, upload IDs, receive text messages, and take selfie's every single time I want to log in. In attempting to resolve the issue, Coinbase help/support will give you bots until you want to croak. When you finally get a response from a real person, they will ask you stupid questions like whether the ID is valid or whether your phone company is blocking text messages.  They will not get to the bottom of the issue which is faulty, insecure website design.  The help/support team has no idea what they are doing, and the minute you stop responding to them you get an automated message saying "the issue has been resolved, case closed."  It's just stupid.  Unfortunately, Coinbase has a bit of a monopoly as some traders will only send bitcoin to a coinbase account, so if I want to collect digital currency that is owed to me, I have to use the terrible website.

So far two tows, three mechanic visits in four months.  BUYER BEWARE. I am still being called to make a payment on this lemon they sold me.

While UPS is amazing where I live, FedEx has been completely unreliable.  Tracking info is never right, many of my packages are never delivered and a good number just get stolen or misdelivered.  At times, I can be home all day when something is due to be delivered by FedEx and I wait all day.  FedEx never comes (I confirm with my outdoor camera recordings), but magically, tracking info gets updates either to say that I was not home when delivery was attempted or that it was delivered when nothing has been.  When I call FedEx to escalate the issues and tell them that my packages did not make it to me, they "investigate" for weeks and then call me to say that I need to contact the merchant as "they have policies in place to deal with these types of situations and FedEx cannot do anything else to help me with my not delivered package!!!!!".  So what is the point of their investigation?  The absolute worst delivery company possible.  I am now at a point where I will not order something online if it is being shipped by FedEx.

I gave 1 star because I can't give them zero or negative star. Here is what I have experienced with UPS. 1. I have a parcel and  I rescheduled a delivery on Thursday, 30 Nov 2017. 2. At 15:00 on 30 Nov 17, I received an email saying the receiver was not available, that messaged come in at 14:34. But my husband was at home the whole time on that day and he didn't hear any doorbell ring from UPS. After that, he checked our mail box, no card was left in the mail box. At this point, I really doubt that if the UPS driver even come to deliver on that date. 3. So both my husband and myself made a few calls on Thursday and complained to the UPS call center. They promised that they will contact Depo and and get back to us asap. I also asked to speak to a supervisor but then the person who I talked just put me on hold and waited the call to end automatically. 4. On Friday, 1 Dec 17, my husband followed up with the UPS call center a couple of times again. They promised the delivery would be made today as the driver will deliver until 21:00 today. In the meanwhile, we still haven't revived any call from the Depo. 5. At 20:30, I still haven't got my package so I tracked my package again and here is what I see: "The delivery change was completed. / Your delivery has been rescheduled for the next business day." None of us requested a reschedule; we even specifically ask for them to delivery today and this happened. 6. At this point, I know for a fact that I will never receive my parcel. 7.This is not the first time issues happened with UPS shipment, it happened almost every single time. I scheduled delivery with them, they never show up and just leave me a messaging saying no one was home. 8. My husband and I have made complaints numerous times with UPS but yield no results. They seems simply do not care about their company reputation or customer satisfactions. 9. From now one, if a online shopping website says their courier is with UPS, I WILL NOT buy from them.

I chose to use bookrenter.com to give a smaller company than amazon a chance--it was a huge mistake and not only will I never use them again, I will tell all of my friends and classmates not to use them either. They deserve zero stars. The book came almost a week late, it shipped half the distance by UPS and the second half by the USPS, and somewhere in between it got lost. No matter who I contacted no one would take any initiative in resolving the issue, the absence of the book was beginning to affect my grade, and the best bookrenter could do was issue me a refund--no overnight shipping to rush me a different text. Even though the company is based in CA and I'm in NV, the book shipped from TN, which may have been part of the issue. The title which I ordered from their website is "Bundle: Worlds of Music: An Introduction to the Music of the World's Peoples, Shorter Version, 3rd + 3 Audio CD's" and there are other options on their and their competitors' websites that do not include the 3 Audio CD's in the title--that is why I chose to order this selection. When the book came, not only are the front cover, back cover, and spine barely hanging on by a thread and the pages filthy-black as though it has been in the hands of a mechanic at work, it did not come with the CD's. When I contacted the company their excuse was that they legally have to include "+ 3 Audio CD's" in the title. I highly doubt this as this is not what the title of this book is printed as either on the cover page or in the Library of Congress catalog. Since both their own and their competitors' websites included the same book as an option Without the CD's, it made sense that this would be included. As a final note, when I ordered my book part of the selling point was that it included free shipping, but the book arrived without a return label so now I must pay for the return shipping myself--the second time this company used false advertising. When I tried contacting customer service with the issues I was having, first online with chat because it was incredibly difficult to find a phone number, and the second time by phone after I was able to dig up the number, the person who helped me was incompetent and unhelpful. The first person was obviously helping multiple people at once and confused my order with another person's. The second person kept having to repeat every sentence I said at least two to three times before moving forward after a very long pause. None of my issues were resolved by the company and no compensatory credits were offered. I would Never recommend using this company or their services to other.
Unable to load documents. Charged £25 when asked for free trial! Awful experience
I was charged 75 dollars just to change a first name on a ticket.  I find this amount exceeds what it requires to make a simple change.  I will not use this site again.

I have had a paypal account for years and never really read the terms and conditions, but out of sheer boredom I read the update they sent last week. Basically they state that they have the right to provide your details to credit referencing agencies (about half a dozen), but more importantly they also state that they have the right, with no opt out option, to provide you details to a number of marketing companies.   This is a clear invasion of privacy I immediately cancelled my account as I have no wish to have my personal details passed to people at the whim of paypal.   More importantly it is bad enough having to pay huge commission to ebay, but with Paypal then taking a subsequent cut the whole process is close to usury

Absolutely disgusting. I ordered a suitcase from Samsonite (their official site). Zero notifications that it was going to be delivered by UPS. Then I received two notes of missed deliveries throughout the week (while I was at work), the one on Thursday saying that I had to pick it up from our local access point. I also got an email from Samsonite saying that it's there and ready to pick it up. I'm heavily pregnant and it's impossible for me to carry stuff alone. My husband and I changed our weekend plans to go pick it up this morning. Surprise, surprise, IT'S NOT THERE. We've lost the entire morning trying to track it through their website, which is completely useless. After absolute ages, I managed to speak to a human person on the phone. Their customer service is EXTREMELY RUDE and told me that apparently it was going to be now delivered to our home address on Monday. Again zero notifications about this, and she was not even able to send me an email confirming this. I seriously can't understand how UPS is still on business and other companies still use them. This is not the first time I had such a horrible experience with them. AVOID THEM AT ALL COSTS.

My wife has been using Expedia for both personal and business travel for a long time so much so that she is an “elite member” and gets extra perks such as better customer service. On her bucket list has been Turks and Caicos so she booked a week vacation there in what turned out to be one of the most colossal disappointments by Expedia.  First off they had misrepresented the hotel and then wouldn’t even let us cancel even before we moved into our room. After spending hours on the phone and getting cutoff and having to call back and wait to talk to someone, their solution was to let us stay at the place we wanted to leave in an upgraded room that we had to pay extra for. We didn’t want an upgrade or anything free, we just wanted to cancel and salvage our vacation. Even though my wife spends tens of thousands of dollars with Expedia each year, they did nothing for us. If that is how they treat her then I can only imagine how they treat average customers thinking about using Expedia for the first time. We are done with Expedia.

My daughter lives in Venice, California and contracted with WAG to walk her 9 pound mixed breed on Saturday night February 11 while she was at a business related event . The three year old spayed female is in a first floor apartment in a home with a regular and screened in door plus a gated yard. The WAG walker claims the dog ran from the apartment and burrowed under the fence and ran away. This is uncharacteristic behavior for this animal. WAG did not assist in the search and recovery and did not even post a picture provided on their local website to assist in finding the dog. The dog was recovered sixteen hours later and was treated and released from a vetinary hospital. Over the years, I've had my share of packages shipped to me through FedEx. And let me say, I could not trust a carrier less. Consistently poor service and consistently late packages are their speciality. The breaking point, however, was my last package, which took them until the day it was to be delivered for it to even make its initial departure scan. They waited until THE DAY I WAS EXPECTING MY PACKAGE to even freaking SHIP my package; a whole week after the company I ordered from sent it out. It took them an additional week to get from California to Michigan before they finally just tossed it off to the USPS, who took ANOTHER week to get my package to me. Two whole weeks after when I needed them. Had to wear tennis shoes to my cousin's wedding because FedEx is too stupid to give me my freaking dress shoes.

Ok the thing is we first bought Vivint camera after being told everything should work without paying any extra monthly service fee to Vivint, by a salesman at Bestbuy. Then it turned out that was totally a lie. (The guy has since disappeared from Bestbuy, which was due to termination of collaboration between Vivint and Bestbuy, as I was told by Vivint yesterday. )We had to pay$ 19.99 to have the system working. Fair to say we were tricked into the program? Then we kept on losing the cameras. Most recently, we lost one camera out of totally three, which prompted me to call Vivint customer care. That call before another two totally costed me about one hour or a little less. The result was Two cameras were lost after the Vivint guy rebooted the system. Then I was told a technician has to be sent in to solve the problem. I was left with two options, pay $199 for the tech visit or upgrading to higher service for a free tech visit?By leveraging the co-pay for an upgrade to a service contract of higher  monthly fee ($19.99 to $39.99), do you think I will recommend Vivint to any others after all this “Vivint”experience ? The tech sent to solve the problem was great. He solved the problem simply by resetting both the camera and the adaptor. Why did not the customer guy telll me this during those lengthy calls? Are these technical secrets that Vivint wants to keep from the customer care people?

I just had the same experience as the other reviewers.  Tonwe had two orders tonight. Both were over an hour late. I called the restaurants when it was close to our original window for delivery and one order said it was "out for delivery " and the other one said it was being prepared. Both restsurants confirmed that the food had been ready for the driver for quite some time but no one had shown up!  I ordered over a month ago and my order was over an hour late as well.  When i called that time, they said that my order was set for pickup, but i had the confirmation that it was scheduled for delivery.  It seems GrubHub changes the delivery window and the order from delivery to pickup whenever it suits them wlthout notification. They also make it difficult to reaxh them if therr are issues. I had to Google to find their customer service link, which only allows chat.  The first operator asked me for my info to look up my case and then never came back and ended the chat!  The second rep went away for a long tome then told me they would not refund my order. My food was cold and soggy and it was so late, we were too tired to eat.  They said they would give me a 20% discount on my next order but then completely reset the window so i couldn't see my chat transcript.  Of course, no 20% coupon was ever issued, but doesn't matter.  I will NEVER use them again.  The firdt two times i used them was okay, but it has been downhill ever since. Also, as if it isn't absolutely ridiculous enough thst these places charge a fee and then expect you to also tip on top of it,  but their choices to tip as "suggestions" start at 20%!  This is not a nice sit-down dinner. Thede are fly-by drivers who are always late and often get lost, as what happened on one of my orders. On top of it, they want you to tip ahead of time before you can see how bad their service is.  Dont tip ahead! Use cash if you have to. Most of the time it doesn't even warrant 10%!  At least UBER EATS lets you tip up to an hour after delivery.   However, good luck with getting in touch much less results with their customer service as well...but they are not nearly as horrible as GrubHub.  I'm so frustrated with GrubHub and their disregard for customer service, and its such a ripoff. They don't refund and it is the same as a scam. I'm going to report them to the BBB and also the state and  county consumer affairs, ans  encourage others to do so as well, given the number of so many negative reviews!  Their service is truly predatory in nature. There is no interest in customer service...only costumers' money!

I am an eBay seller and have used PayPal for 10 years. It used to be ok when owned by eBay but since they went independent they are awful for sellers. First of all can anyone explain to me Why I get charged a £14 fee when a buyer says that they did not authorise a transaction? I realise it is a card fee, but as the seller it is nothing to do with me when they say that they haven't made this purchase. Surely PayPal should foot that bill? Also - in this case, just so you actually know how many people abuse their buyer protection which leaves us sellers out of pocket - this buyer bought an item from me on eBay and paid by PayPal. I sent the item. She LEFT FEEDBACK saying she had the item and was happy. A month later she opens a case with PayPal saying she didn't authorise the transaction. I sell items for £3 and it is not worth getting tracked postage so I didn't even contest this and agreed to refund her everything, putting me out of pocket. I didn't even fight and now they send me an email saying I am being charged £14 on top for this! I could understand if she said she had never received the item and I couldn't prove she had but when it was over an unauthorised transaction which she said SHE DID then that's absolutely ridiculous. Why aren't they supporting sellers more and using common sense?? Also, i would appreciate it if PayPal actually read and understood my customer service emails before they replied as I've emailed PayPal in the past and I DO NOT WANT AN AUTOMATED EMAIL that doesn't actually answer my question again. Considering it's the sellers/receivers that actually pay money to PayPal, you'd think they'd be more supportive. But they have the monopoly and don't care.

I used Airbnb for the first time a week again and I will NEVER use them again. The Studio we rented was totally misrepresented. When we arrived at the rental we discovered the building was a construction site. The hallways and stairwells were being decorated and the floors tiled. There was dust everywhere, building materials on the landings and stairwells, doors held open with fire extinguishers, bags of rubbish left in the halls.  There were workmen coming and going, and they were grouting the hall outside the rental while we were there. The Studio rental was also directly above a nightclub. The host gave no indication of the nightclub in the description and at no point contacted me beforehand to let me know about or apologise for the building work. In addition while were these the keypad system to enter the building stopped working. We were in fact locked out of the rental on our first evening. It was late and only by the sheer luck of another resident turning up with a key were we able to re-enter the building and get back to our belongings. I emailed and left a voicemail for the host the following morning about this issue and to date he has still not had the decency to contact me.  Fortunately the estate agent next door that managed flats in the building were able to get us a key, however this took over an hour of our time, during which we could not leave for fear of not being able to re-enter. As soon as I returned I logged an issue with the Resolution centre. Again the host has not had the decency to respond to me. I have now forwarded my issue to Airbnb directly, and despite a standard response saying I would be contacted within 24 hours, I have not had any communication from them. Previously I have used Booking.com and Hotels.com for both personal and work and I will be staying with them from now on. They are both excellent services that Airbnb could learn a lot from.  I travel a lot and book a lot of accommodation for work both UK and overseas and this has been one of the worst experiences.
Terrible.   My upload and download speeds are really bad.   I have been stood up twice by scheduled technicians.  I would absolutely never use this service again.

We travelled from Schipol to Innsbruck on Monday 13 February, the day the airport decided to ground all flights for the day. We waited from 9:30am until 6:10pm before the flight took off. When the flight finally took off the airline decided it would be a good idea to go via Eindhoven. So even though we were very late, this meant we were even later. We missed half a day's skiing and the evening meal at the hotel. Not only did we not receive an apology but I was also charged an extra 60 euros on the return jouney for an overweight bag.

I'm so beyond frustrated with the lack of any kind of customer service with sprint. I've been with sprint since 2011. Never had to deal with customer service so I was oblivious to how horrible they treat loyal customers. I use my phone's till they die. Which finally happened to my iPhone 5. Went to the sprint store close to me to purchase a new iPhone. In the process, I was sold a new plan  that would save me some money. I decided on the iPhone 8 and a 60 dollar unlimited plan. I was told I would have a credit towards the lease as I'd been a loyal customer for 8 years. I thought it sounded good. Got the phone set up and left. Flash forward to my first bill and it was not right. Was over charged and didn't know why. I went back to the store and spoke with another employee and asked him to explain my bill and he couldn't. He also said they hadn't changed my plan like they should have so I was still being billed for the previous plan. I asked him to adjust my bill as it was it was their fault, not mine. He told me he couldn't do that and I'd have to call customer care. Don't know why they call it that. They should call it. "customer abuse line" there is no caring that goes on. I called and spoke to a rep with s heavy accent and was told why my bill was so much and even though it made no sense to me. And they wouldn't adjust. I decided then and there j was going to pay off this devise and go else where for cell plan. I went to the store and asked then if I could pay off the phone and my final bill to go else where. He said, "yes,I could pay off the phone and call customer care once again and they would unlock my phone. I paid over 600 dollars and went to call to have my phone unlocked. Spoke to another rep who said she would out in a ticket and it would take 24-48 hours to unlock the phone. I wait a couple days and went to sign up with metro PC's. They tried to switch Sim card and I was told my phone wasn't unlocked yet. I thought it may be  couple more days but called to verify once again was told I hadn't waited long enough and by the following Tuesday the phone would be unlocked and ready. I didn't want to wait to switch so I went ahead and ported my number with metro and my plan came with a free Android phone. I could that phone for a few days and they update Sim card once phone was unlocked. I waited past the time the time they told me to make sure to was unlocked. Went back to metro to have them changed the Sim card. When they tried, it still wasn't unlocked. I called cs again in the store and spoke to yet another rep. She proceeded to tell me my phone wasn't going ever be unlocked as it's sprints policy that you have to have your phone active for 50 days before you can have it unlocked. Even if you pay it off. I was beyond  frustrated I asked what reason could they possible have to keep my phone locked. If already changed carriers and I owed nothing to sprint. Was told that was their policy and nothing could be done. The only thing she suggested was for me to have them active my iPhone with sprint again and give me a new number and wait out the remaining 50 days. I told her she was nuts and I didn't want to have to pay for 2 phone plans for the next 20 days. She said,that's all she could do for me. She would call me later to find out if I wanted to move ahead with reactivation.  I tried to explain that I had spoken to 3 different people before and not one informed me of this ridiculous policy. Infact told me they were going to unlock the phone. Had I not called, I would still be waiting for my phone to be unlocked. I called back today to try and get someone else and see what if anything could be done. Spoke with yet another rep, she said "looks like all I have to do is out in a ticket for the unlocking and it will take 2  days and my phone will be unlocked. I asked her why the supervisor for the other night said she had put in a ticket and it was denied. That is if she were to simply repeat the process of putting in ticket for un locking, why would they change and do it for her and not the supervisor. She just kept repeating she was going to put the ticket in and it would work. I knew this was wrong and told her I didn't want to kept going through this. I'd already wasted hours repeating myself and not being understood. I asked or should I say begged to be passed on to her supervisor so I could make sure it would really be done. She didn't was to do no it, tried hard to have me just try her way and see what happens.  I knew better and wanted no part of that plan. I did finally speak to a supervisor and she said" oh, I just need to escalate this and tell them to unlocked it". That I didn't owe them anything and they should unlock the phone in 6-48 hours. I said I tried the night before to argue the same thing to the other supervisor and she was not having it. Told me that was all she could offer and no way around policy. We placed an order in November, 2017, for blood red grapefruit and honeybelles.  At the time, a 15% discount was advertised for purchases, and when we went to the check out page, our MERCHANDISE total was a little less than $90.00, but when the shipping charge was applied, the cost was in the next category: $34.99, instead of $24.99.  I checked the shipping costs page on the website and the page clearly said that shipping was based on the "total cost of merchandise."  We could not get the page to change the cost, so we placed the order, then called Customer Service to review the purchase, and the apparent incorrect cost for shipping.  Then the fun began. The first person I talked to tried to be helpful, but was caught and could say no more than that the posted shipping costs were what they were.  Yes, the costs were based on the total cost of merchandise purchased, but shipping costs were based on the total retail price of the order, regardless of any sale prices.  I pointed out that neither the order page nor the shipping FAQ page said that; both said shipping was based on the total cost of "the merchandise."  She admitted that she could go no further than her explanation, and offered to transfer my call to 'my supervisor' if I was unsatisfied with her explanation. I was placed on hold, then disconnected.  I called back, explained what had happened to a new representative, and was placed on hold to await a supervisor.  When I explained the issue to the supervisor I was again told what the policy was: it was based on the total price of the merchandise ordered.  When I reminded her that the total price of "the merchandise ordered" qualified for a lower shipping charge, she countered by saying it was based on the retail price of the merchandise, not the purchase price paid.  I again pointed out that the website DID NOT SAY THAT at any point, nor was it mentioned on the shipping policy page.  The next tactic she tried was to say that the shipping charge was based on the weight of the merchandise ordered, not the purchase price.  I responded that the website did not say that, either.  Then she said that was something that "the computer people would have to deal with, but the policy was the policy," and could not be changed.  I said it was misleading to say one thing and mean another, especially when there was no information on the website it indicate what she was telling me.  That's when she said, "the policy was the policy" and she would not make any changes.  I responded that this would be the last order I placed with Hale.  She said she was sorry to hear that, "but if that is the way you feel, then I have nothing more to say." I would point out in closing that Orange Ring, based in Orlando, also features sale prices on its merchandise.  The difference is that Orange Ring posts its shipping prices on the order page, right next to the items offered for sale.  I know immediately that if I order three trays of Indian River grapefruit what the shipping cost will be--it is posted right next to the purchase price.  Hale claims to base its shipping costs on the TOTAL COST OF MERCHANDISE, and does not post the cost until the end of the order process, where the shipping cost MAY OR MAY NOT reflect the total cost of merchandise ordered.  This is a deceptive business practice, and we will not place an order with Hale Groves again.  I am aware that in the grand scheme of things, a single order may not be a big deal to the company, but it is to the affected customer.  I am only sorry that the stated policy for shipping costs is both deceptive and inflexible.  The company could do better.

Last spring I rented from you a textbook. You got it and I originally had no problems with it. It was slightly damaged, but I didn’t originally see any problem with it. At the end of the semester I waited for information on how to return the book, but I never received anything. I then saw a charge on my card that I had bought the book for $227 or so. I was very frustrated at the fact that I had just “bought” this book because of this company’s incompetence. Fast forward to a few weeks ago. I see this book and decide to see if i can sell it. I look and see that you guys buy back books. The book wasn’t in the greatest shape, but I figure since you guys sent it to me like this and it shouldn’t be an issue. I mail it out, and a week ago I receive it back in the mail and i get an email saying that it wasn’t in good enough shape. This initially made me pretty mad since it had come in the same shape as I had received it back. However, this wasn’t the end of the story. I then take it out  of the package and try to sell it to the bookstore on campus. They go to inspect the book and the binding was ripped off the pages of the book. Not only do I now own a book I didn’t want to have, but now I can’t sell this book. I have looked into re-binding, but the cost isn’t what it needs to be to make it worth my time. So in short, I will never consider your business again, and will make it known to anyone that i know that uses textbook renting to use your services.

I bought something from their website for the first time. When I received it in the mail, half of what I ordered was not included. I emailed them and they said that it was not included, even though the add clearly stated that it did. I would have chosen no star but that option is not available.

As a first time buyer, the process was painful.  It took three e mails and multiple calls to get the order approved.  It is obvious that they need to invest in a better call center.   The agents are not even friendly.

Loved the support it would give BUT I walked around and jumped up and down to test it and the cinch to tighten at the shoulders was already irritating my skin. I can’t imagine trying to run with that irritating me the whole time. Also the front is very unflattering under shirts and tanks. Many lines and the zipper covers add to the bulk (unnecessary in my opinion). I like wearing light/shear tanks when I workout and this bra front is bumps and lines galore. Would not recommend if you like tight tops over the bra. This bra would be great if the front was flat (still with zipper) and they had tighteners for the shoulder in the back.

Terrible fit and had no idea until after I paid I couldn't return it. There should be more prominent letters on the page or on the checkout page! Boo, won't buy from here anymore! Don't like a no return policy when there's many competitors that will let you return anything.

I bought a sample pack that was disappointingly repetitive and simple. It came with a ton of samples, but unfortunately, many of them were so similar that it seemed like they were almost duplicates. The sample pack didn't have a downloadable demo pack, which would have given me a better idea of the contents of the package. I requested a partial refund, understanding that a full refund would be unlikely since I had already downloaded the product. Customer service did not issue a refund, but instead gave me a coupon for a future purchase. They also said that they hadn't received any other complaints about the product, as if to invalidate my complaint. I didn't appreciate that. I've had other issues in the past with the demo track not being an accurate representation of the sample pack. Customer service is always unsympathetic when asked to refund based on an inaccurate product description. I wish there were a way to listen to the entire contents of a package before committing to buy. This is a problem I have quite often with Loopmasters.

I have not received  my perfume.  I got a email saying there sending it back to shipper.  I have been waiting since 12/30 for it and it's 1/13. They got my money but I don't have my perfume.

Product had major defect.  After 5 days I am still awaiting return authorization.  Reordered a replacement and was charged $25.00 more than the original.  Awaiting a credit for the overcharge. After my irate explanation and recount of. All activities I was told it would be resolved.  It is now 6:00pm and no follow up call and no delivery of my product!

We ordered from HR because the reviews were so favorable.  We thought the items looked lovely and the prices were great.  One of our items arrived quickly but it had a defect.  I was told to send it back, pay the shipping and we would be reimbursed.  It has not yet been refunded and now the company is saying they will not pay for the return shipping. The second item arrived a week later, it was great. The third item arrived but was clearly a returned item...fine. The fourth item has still not arrived.  I have called.  I have emailed.  I have called again.  Emailed again.  HR asked me to document and send back the damaged item.  I have not received a replacement part or any update.  We still have not received our fourth item.  While Customer Service is very nice on the phone they are not able to answer many questions such as "where is my order?" or "when will it arrive"? They expect the customer to do the follow thru, such as send it back and then call in and then submit for the return shipping cost.  This is becoming a real chore to deal with and I would not recommend using HR in the future. We have another bathroom to remodel and will shop elsewhere given our experiences. It has been the most difficult experiences in online shopping we have ever encountered.  We still do not have all the pieces from our oder and I am giving up and moving on with another vendor.

Ordered the product. Heard nothing for two weeks. Called and was told they would have some in another week. Heard nothing again. Called again and was told they would have some in September. Loss of revenue stream due to poor inventory management and bad customer service.

I called to make a revision on a round trip flight. Something simple, just extending the date of my return, which was listed as the same price online. First the rep told me that the flight wasn’t available... even though I was looking at the flight on their website and had the option to purchase directly. Then, she said the flight suddenly was available, but I would have to pay over $200 to change it... even though I booked less than an hour before and both return dates were the same price online. There wasn’t even an exact price, just “$100 admin fee, between $50-$80 extra, and an additional fee from the airline which we don’t know.” No other solutions offered. When I asked to be transferred to another rep, she refused. I asked multiple times and finally she hung up on me. I called back later and after being on hold for 45 min, someone answered. I said that I had called earlier, that was it, and they promptly put me on mute and then hung up.
