I booked a carpet cleaning appointment this past Friday for a 12-2p slot. Today, April 1st, and 1:30p I received a call letting me know I needed to reschedule for next Monday as the cleaner no longer worked with the company. This was after I had 3 full days to request off work, move furniture out of place and place my dog into a $30 a day day-care. The offer of a $25 credit was laughable after what I have gone through to prepare for this service that was scheduled well in advance. Especially after receiving multiple confirmation texts, including this morning. This is unacceptable and I hope you look into confirming your workers more so in advance. You will certainly not be getting good reviews or business from myself or any of my friends, family or coworkers. Please be considerate to future customers.

Don't buy this. Buried in the terms of service is an auto renew feature that they automatically recharge your credit card annually. They don't let you know they are about to charge again and when I noticed it on my credit card statement a couple of days later - they said sorry you have to pay for the entire year. Great business to be in. There are plenty of reputable providers of this type of service. Go there and save yourself grief. They have offered to look into this on 11/16 as they say the account is locked until then- not quite ASAP but we'll see and I'll post an update if they refund.
Biggest scam  out there. The customer help people are the most unhelpful people I  have ever dealt with. There is no way to correct or refund fraudulent charges and they don’t care!

Pricing was inaccurate- I reserved online and when getting  There had to pay $320 bc they overbooked the units. I booked a week and a half in advance. Then the employee has been nothing but rude and very a bit disrespectful

I have used Ebay probably as much as the average since 2003. The website has never been that user friendly but primarily as a seller now it is very complex and time consuming. Buying, it seems has become very straightforward with exception of trawling through endless listings exactly the same from same buyer, I am sure that this helps with inflating the figures forEbay but not for the People Rule policy. There aproach to tackling fake goods is damaging the reputation they have and also that of legitimate sellers. Also, why oh why is creating and using postage policies so damn frustrating. The amount of advertising flooded onto a page in every nook and cranny further obfuscates the experience. I think the owners need to focus less on squeezing the stone and more on customer experience, there are a lot more sites which are easier to use, particularly the swap sites and free sites. In addition, endlessly asking my opinion does not canter good form, especially as you are not offering me anything for it.

I ordered parts for my car ball joints inner tie rods outer tierods and sway bar bushings in a kit when they got to me I only had 1 IT 1 BJ. and sway bar bushings all with no carter pins or c clips when telling customer service about it I've gotten a run around and still have not gotten my parts and I lost my job due to this when I told them I was about to lose my job and reminded them my parts where ordered with plenty of time to fix my car  I got a 48 hours no contact message the day before thanksgiving this is the worse I got no job and no car now because of this and they don't seem to caire
Not happy with the service.

Uber is a total fraud! I was quoted a fare for £34-£48 from Towerhill to Heathrow when I reserved it, but instead I got charged £108! The journey took nearly two hours, 7:20am-9:20am. Plus a cancellation fee of £5 for the previous Uber driver at around 7 and knocked on the wrong door- I did not get a call at my door yet I got charged for their mistake! Their system -the app let you rate/review the driver first and requests a tip then it shows the cost of the fare. I think it probably is ok if you order and and take the ride there and then but not to reserve in advance and to have the cost of fare to your account, they'll charge whatever they want. The driver said he couldn't tell me how much the fare costed when he dropped us off at Heathrow T4 - he must have known how much the fare was but was too embarrassed to tell me. I didn't get a chance to check it until I got home couple hours later. I contacted Uber for a refund and got the usual fob off. Zero for customer service! DO NOT SIGN UP AND HAVE YOUR BANK CARD DETAILS BECAUSE YOU CAN NOT DELETE IT - can not delete an activating payment method! Absolutely ridiculous! I'll have to cancel my card and get a new one if I want to get ride of them! It my personal information yet I can not delete it when I want! Avoid at all cost!!! I contacted my bank but Uber has their own t&c which means you can not challenge the cost of fare no matter however ridiculously over the quoted price. I won't be using Uber on my account again! Good luck to those who book and reserve their trip, you might get the shock as I had!

This is one of the most terrible organizations that I have been able to meet. I decided to buy shoes for the winter, paid for it, did everything right, I had to pay $ 40 for the delivery (I live in Ukraine and here this amount is not small). As a result: there was a parcel to my country for a little more than three weeks and, and the most interesting thing is that the goat did not provide any accompanying documents, I contacted support and called fedex, no one helped me at all, when asked to provide me with the necessary documents they simply ignored it, but how the month went and my order was sent back (since they cannot send it to me without these accompanying documents), and now goat demands that I pay for the delivery again or return the money to me, but with deduction of the return shipment. What if the documents are not provided again?)

I bought Milkbone Trail Mix which they allege is a $9.99 item that they have ON SALE for $4.99 a bag. That same size item sells at Kroger TWO for $5 and at Wal-Mart for $2.88 a bag. A few years back, I purchased a set of sofa’s from The Room Place with warranty of $200+. I was supposed to get an email or a phone call regarding the investigation of my credit. I never received a phone call nor email so I went to pick up my bedroom set. I couldn’t take home my bedroom set until I paid $200 that I supposedly owed. Very disappointed in The Room Place.

I bought an iTunes gift card yesterday for my nephews birthday and unfortunately I have been waiting since yesterday to receive the link sent to my email. Been a small business client for years.2 orders in a row were held up (and we do vital medical electronics) for 1 out of stock product.We clearly clicked off `ship complete,do not backorder`. In each case ,1 part # halted shipping of a multiple item (30-40sku) order,rather than reviewing our order and contacting us they let the paid for orders sit. In each case, they were only released when we called in. (because cust service email wasn`t returned promptly). We asked for and were denied compensation in the form of a discount for next time and they refused. They said `you are already getting free shipping`. Really? this is what everyone gets at $199. One issue like this ok. Back to back issues like this with no accommodation- inexcusable.This is poor customer service.

I bought a Sony smartphone. They delivered a cable with charging from another manufacturer. Ok, I said nothing. Later it turned out that this phone is not intended for the United States, it is for France and therefore I can not update it up to last Android. There is a breakdown of the headphone jack - the microphone does not work well. As a result, the seller has not responded for the fifth day. I have had nothing but problems with the chlorine injection system installed to remove iron from my water.  Within a year and a half, I had 2 injector check valves fail and the tubing in the pump fail requiring replacement.  I finally got tired of it and bought the air injection system which is still not removing all of the iron.  I removed the chlorine injection system, contact tank and carbon filter.  I am done trying to make my water excellent and leaving it "good enough."  I am disappointed in the designed system which was extremely expensive and is now junk.

Signed up in September  and they waited until December to aeration and seed! When I tried to get a service on the weekends I was basically told if that is what I wanted I would have to skip that service. This was the branch manger very rude.

I am not satisfied with knetbooks. Right before the semester ended I had to leave the country on a family emergency and missed my return date so I was charged for the book which was like $250. This is a big hit especially having just made an unexpected trip out the country and just returning to work from maternity leave. Knetbooks refused to refund my money per the rental agreement and said the would refund 50% of the late fee as in store credit which is useless since I no longer plan to do business with them. Not to mention I contacted them as soon as I was able to left and email with no response called them the day later waited on the phone for 38 minutes on hold before I hung up and called again the day after and waited on the phone again after finally being given the option to have my spot in line held and receive a call back when it was my turn only to never have received a call in return.

I didn't receive my order for 2 weeks after placing the order. I tried to contact customer service twice and got ignored each time. Couldn't fullfill online order, 4 of the 12 items ordered were stated as an 'inventory discrepancy'.  Didn't offer any solutions to resolve the problem.  Garbage company.

For years I’ve been dealing with them leaving my parcels at my neighbors’ houses to be rifled through, stolen, and vandalized. They never came to my house. For years I’ve had to call customer service and plead with them to leave my parcels at my door and my door only. Yet, nothing’s changed... until today. Today I waited all day for a very important and expensive parcel. I got a delivery notification between 7 pm and 7:30 pm. I checked outside my door and nothing was there. I decided to look at my neighbors’ houses. Not there. I waited to see if they had sent the delivery notice before actually delivering the parcel, which they do all the time. Then my intuition told me to check my mailbox, which is exactly where they had left the parcel. As far as I know, that’s still illegal. Businesses, stop delivering your products via FedEx.

Do not rent from Airbnb they run credit and background checks and give your information to 3rd parties. We closed our account immediately and wanted to sue them but they only have arbitration. This company will lie and deceive their customers and tell you they don't do that until you start getting emails from these 3rd party company's who now have all your information drivers licence etc. BEWARE OF AIRBNB.

Very good bags but instructions are terrible, hardware is all wrong, the bolts are way to long and there are also not enough. Also the bags I looked at on website showed my bags in video with a built in lock but they did not come with them. Also there are not enough plugs for the holes where throw over brackets go when not used. My hardware kit contained low mount brackets not the one's shown when ordering or instructions on how to adjust these. Instructions tell about other brackets

I would like to emphasise how poor most of the airbandb accommodation is. I have used airbandb many times and every time there is something wrong. People should not rent out their homes/rooms in their home if (a) they are not going to not bother to make an effort with their guest and instead just make them feel as if they are invading their home, (b) not going to bother to clean the room, the bathroom, the hallways - the whole house basically and they don’t provide adequate heating because they feel the house is warm enough or they don’t like it too hot, (c) they are easily irritated by people’s reasonable behaviour (eg getting up early/leaving a light on overnight/using the bathroom at night etc). These are small things but they should be the minimum standard if one is paying for a room. After all, we are paying guests, the hosts are not doing us a favour by allowing us to stay in their home. To top it all off guests are then invited to leave a review and most people leave a polite one, ignoring the problems rather than being honest because it would a personal criticism. You can’t tell someone that their home is dirty! But that’s how I’ve ended up staying in places that were filthy but which had glowing reviews about how clean the place was! I think airbandb should be banned and websites like this should not be allowed to operate. They are dangerous and a waste of money.

Really bad company. I purchased ticket and took a very long time to receive itinerary. They then over charged me. If that is the case I was still charged incorrectly then what they claimed. I have responded to emails but replys are always the same. So it would have been cheaper and easier to pay though a popular airline company. I do not recommend this company to anyone!!!

We had a couple of guys out to fix our sticking front door. They managed to make it open and close better using some shims in the hinges. A different guy came out and basically said there was nothing he could do and that because what the first guys did didn't work, anything new he did would not be covered under that warranty. Great. So now we are stuck with a sticking door that takes all our strength to open and close. Oh, and did I mention I run a home day care and have parents coming and going all day through that door? Yeah, not happy.

I've liked ourbus in general, but on this past ride from NYC to Ithaca the driver drove really fast and a bit erratically, and made me nervous.  I was really tired, but every time I closed my eyes he seemed to swerve around other traffic in such an aggressive and swerve-y way that it woke me right up with an adrenalin shot each time.  By the end of the trip, I saw him yawning, sighing heavily, and squirming around in his seat a bit, which made me wonder if he was wide awake.  The whole thing made me uncomfortable -- and particularly so after the recent bus accident by a rival company on that same route.  I'm not always a huge fan of Greyhound, but I do feel like their drivers drive more responsibly and professionally than the discount buses.  I was hoping Ourbus might be an exception to that.

Would not recommend them at all!!!!!

We were planned to check in today at Anna Maria Island today through Vacasa but Hurricane Dorian is headed this way to the entire state of Florida.  There is a state of emergency declared for the entire state of Florida and they won’t let us move our dates or get a refund. That’s horrible service putting people in danger with the possibility of transportation/traffic delays on the roads, possible gas shortages, water shortages, and more. The response was we should go and see what happens.  Which would mean we would drive all the way there to have to turnaround and drive back.  We were told if they need to evacuate they would email us.  That shows the lack of urgency from the company on the situation.  As of now, the hurricane is projected to be a category 3 or 4. Very shocked and disappointed for the lack of empathy for the situation ahead. It doesn’t make any sense.  We will continue to go to Anna Maria Island but never use Vacasa again.

I drove my nearly 79-year-old mother from visiting her goddaughter into downtown Toulouse to return my rental car after five days and encountered bad traffic.  Also, instructions as to what to do with my paperwork were unclear and there was no further information on the top level of the garage where the car was to be parked.  By the time we got Mom and our luggage down in the elevator and to the office, shortly before noon, everyone had checked out for lunch hour and the office was just being locked up.  I don't know for sure, but suspect we were 15 to 20 minutes late.  Because of this, the Toulouse office attempted to charge me more than $200 for an extra day.  This has left a hugely sour taste in my mouth, even though Visa managed to negotiate part of the charge back.  Obviously not one second of grace is accorded by Auto Europe, at least in Toulouse, and no allowance is made for not being able to hand the car back in to a person (and thus be clear on exactly when it was returned) during the sacred dejeuner (lunch break).  I've been a customer of Auto Europe for a long time, half my family is in Europe and I'm back there at least once a year, usually twice and sometimes more, and I usually book my rental car through them.  It hurts (and shocked me, I admit) when what seems an extortionate charge is levied because of a brief delay in returning the car (FULLY fueled and in perfect shape except for normal road dirt), and certainly influences me to think about booking through some other agency (though I doubt they're any better).

I booked a reservation through Travelocity at the Holiday Inn Express Suites, Amarillo, Texas about two months in advance.  Yesterday I found out that I would not be able to use this reservation after all.  I called Travelocity and spoke with someone who sounded as if they were in a foreign country and spoke with a very, very heavy accent.  When I tried to cancel, they told me that all three nights that had been prepaid would be forfeited ($317), even thought the reservation isn't until 3 weeks from now.  When I asked to speak to a supervisor this person would not let me do so.  They referred me instead to Holiday Inn, who they say keeps the forfeited deposit.  I then called Holiday Inn's central reservation line, who referred me to the Holiday Inn Manager in Amarillo and/or Travelocity.  I then spoke with the local Holiday Inn Manager, who referred me to Travelocity.  None would refund the deposit. While I understand a reasonable cancellation fee to cover administrative expenses, charging $317 cancellation fee is anything but reasonable.  I urge all readers to not book any hotel stays through Travelocity or at the Holiday Inn.

If you get paid for dishonesty then FedEx is the company for you! Bought a platform bed for my grandson to sleep on while visiting, they were coming in on the 29th and I ordered it on the 21st. The delivery date was 05/24/19. Day came and went and then the holiday was here. Since I had received no notification that the package was going to be late I had to call them...the package will now be here on the 30th, there was a weather delay and it was now in Johnston, RI and I was guaranteed to be delivered on the 31st.??? The 31st came and went and I was not notified again so at the end of the day I called again and was told it was in Wilmington, CT not Johnston, RI and it will not be delivered till Monday 06/03. The only guarantee you have with this company is you will be lied to and your delivery will be late. A week of my grandson sleeping on the floor...shame on you FedEx!!!!!

After seeing the state of some of the machines for hire and reading  other people experiences we used only the RugDoctor Chemicals in our own Vax machine....which we know works well and is clean! After speaking to a nice lady in customer services they checked the stability of the chemical batch and said it was fine. They also suggested we purchase even more of their products to try and remove the stains left behind. The company have no reaction team to visit households that experience problems. We will show good faith and try the suggested method of removal by following customer care advice. We have been told if this does not cure the problem there is nothing else they can do. I beg to differ and will take this issue further until we get satisfaction either by the offer of specialist cleaner or exchange of carpets!! BEWARE.

Where to start? We traveled over an hour to check out pools and ended up buying one. We financed it, made a down payment and set up a delivery date for 3 days later. (Pool must be delivered before you are put on install list). Two days later they call saying we didn’t sign the right paperwork and they can’t deliver until it’s signed. We take off work, rush down there to sign ONE paper AND only ONE of us had to sign. Seriously, why couldn’t  they just send it with the delivery people?? We  then ask if the pool will fit in a full size truck, they say yes so we decide to save the delivery fee and pick it up  ourself. After 2 hours of loading, I can tell you, no it does not safely fit in a full size truck! 6 weeks later installation guy calls says he will be at my house between noon and 2. I leave work at 11:30. He calls at 11:40 to say he is at the house, I tell him I am on my way, I will be there in 15 min. He didn’t say anything was just a little huffy. I get home, I ask him if the filter can go a certain place, because we already have the proper electrical outlet at that location. He says that’s perfect. His word: perfect. Install goes on, they leave, I have water delivered, go to plug in pump and can’t plug it in, it’s too far from the outlet. Really?!? So gotta have electrician come out, pay $140 for that. The electrician even asked me why they didn’t set the filter 1 more foot closer, I didn’t even know how to respond! 2 days later we get in the pool, only to find a rock, a sharp one at that, poking up through the liner. Now this pool holds 23,000 gallons of water and cost me $1100 for that water. I am now waiting for them to come out and see what they can do about this rock. They will be here   July 27th. Another day to miss work. I really wish I could just go back to June 3rd and stop myself from starting this whole mess. I know they have been in business for quite some time but it sure seems like every contact with them has been a screw up. Update: I was contacted by the store manager and he was very apologetic. He has gone over and above to compensate us by giving us credit for next years chemicals for the pool. Rocky start but we are pleased.

Extremely disappointed with EzStorage.  The company has extremely poor practices which are not in the best interest of consumers. (1) Military service members personal information -  they collect unnecessary personal information from service members (like SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBERS) which the military moved away from as a tracking mechanism for third party, non-DOD entities, in order to protect us from identity theft.  What's even more alarming is that EzStorage will not and does not provide how they safeguard information. Most reputable companies will provide this... EzStorage does not. (2) DO NOT RENT STORAGE UNITS IN THE STORE!! GO ONLINE! PRICES ARE ALMOST $70 -$100 cheaper. You would think that the representatives would tell you that you can save money by reserving online but they do not. Once you are locked into a contract, they will not honor online prices. I was a customer with EZ Storage for well over 4 years and I'm extremely disappointed.

We have been using Hotels.com primarily for bookings in Australia over the last 5 years or so but our recent experience with an overseas booking leaves us frustrated and very angry over their non-existent customer service. We have just returned from Poland and had booked and fully paid in September 2018 for accommodation in Krakow for x4 nights.  We also contacted the hotel just prior to our departure from Australia to advise our arrival details and no problems were advised. Approx. 7-10 days prior to our scheduled arrival we received an email stating that the accommodation provider had cancelled our booking due to "urgent maintenance issues". No alternative accommodation was advised and we were simply told to contact Hotels.com. This was very difficult to do as we were travelling throughout Poland and English is not readily understood. In addition, we had lost our mobile phone and this created significant difficulties for us to be able to ring Hotels.com. That is when our nightmare started and we ended up having to book our own alternative accommodation at significantly increased costs due to the urgent nature of our request. We are now back in Australia and, despite at least 20 emails to and fro from Hotels.com we have still not even received a full refund of our pre-paid booking and we have been told that they will not entertain any other compensation. Their staff do not have English as a first language and they simply do not understand basic English grammar,expression and nuances so communication with them is always difficult. Further, despite their assurances that you are a valuable customer, they do not assign one staff member to assist you and we received emails from different people on almost every occasion. This would not necessarily be a problem except for the fact that whenever we were contacted the staff member had not familiarized themselves with our file. In fact, on one occasion, they actually stated that they could not locate our file. We are going to initiate legal action for their lack of support and failure to provide a service that was fully paid for back in September 2018.

Lugless.com is a straight up scam and you get what you pay for. You are better off paying 3xs as much to ship through UPS or pay the $75 at the airport to take the bag. My experience with Lugless began over a month ago when I moved from DC to CA. I decided to ship 5 bags through lugless, mostly full of my clothes and some sentimental personal items that cannot be replaced (family heirlooms, gifts and handmade cards, etc.). First off, Lugless did not get me the shipping labels in time, so the help desk had to email me copies of them with no directions. I taped all of the labels on the bags (no direction for which label should go with what bag) and no directions for how it will be picked up. Mind you, I paid an extra $118 for the PREMIUM protection and coverage. The "promise" with that premium coverage is lugless tracking and on-demand assistance. Fast forward a week, the day my luggage is to arrive. I hadn't heard a word from this business, even though they are supposed to be tracking my shipment. They wait until the day of to tell me that 3 of the 5 bags haven't had tracking updates in days. Not surprisingly, 1 of 5 bags arrive and the other 4 are missing. I had spent $300 total for this service, and they only delivered 1/5 of their promise. I, personally, had to contact UPS (again, even though I paid this terrible company to be doing this for me). Lugless did not pick up the phone, even though I attempted to call twice during their business hours. I personally had to request UPS open an investigation, at which point, UPS told me I have to speak to Lugless directly as my (god awful) liason. I had to keep prodding Lugless to follow up and give me updates, which I don't feel I should have to do because why the hell did I pay for this service if I have to initiate. They could give me very little update other than "We're sorry. We know this is frustrating." I sent them a description of the bags for the investigation. UPS STILL contacted me directly for follow up because, you know, why even bother with this liason. I followed up 3 times to inquire about when the investigation will be closed so I can move forward with an insurance claim and I also demanded a refund for their poor service. They were unwilling to give me resolve on either front, continuing to blame UPS. They claim the premium charge ($118) was non-refundable, even though their service was far less than premium. Now I am stuck in a conflict with them, as I have resent my itemized description of luggage contents for the UPS claim. I sent it in 3 different emails and lugless kept coming back claiming the body of the email cannot be seen. This took me to a level of frustration I was already on to incomprehensible rage. How in god's name can I send this description 3 different times and your team keeps saying you can't even see it? I assumed it was a game they are playing, as they couldn't be specific as to why the "email cuts off" and a mechanism to continue to drag their feet. I am still waiting for support and resolve in this matter. I am at a complete loss. From my perspective, I made this huge and challenging move across the country and arrived to over half of my wardrobe gone (including work clothes for my new job) as well as years of sentimental things I've collected to bring with me. I paid extra for Lugless to take charge so it would be one less stressful thing to deal with during this challenging time, but I wasted my money. I paid to have these precious belongings still in my life, but I mine as well have given $300 to a junk man to throw it in a dumpster. This has been one of the most emotionally draining and deeply depressing dealings with a business I have ever had in my life, and I am convinced Lugless doesn't feel the least bit of care about that fact. Unprofessional, unreliable, disgusting.

I have been an Amazon customer for years. I have never had a problem until today. I received an email that my order had shipped. Unfortunately, I hadn’t ordered anything. I contacted Amazon to tell them that they had charged me for something I didn’t order. The first representative spoke such broken English that I had to ask for someone else. That representative told me they were sorry, they would contact the seller and when and if they heard back from them, they would issue a refund. I told her that wasn’t good enough, and she argued with me. I asked for a supervisor, who told me the same thing. When I told the supervisor I would cancel my account over this, he transferred me to the our-of-country seller, where no one spoke English. I call back and asked for a supervisor. I had to ask for a second one because the first one barely spoke English. This one told me to call my bank. I called a third time. This time, the supervisor finally said she would reverse the charge, but due to her very poor English skills, she was telling me she would reverse it in ten days when, after about ten minutes of asking every simple way I knew how, I determined she meant she was reversing the charge immediately but my bank might take ten days to process it. I am a pretty tolerant person, but when I call customer service from the USA, I want to speak with someone speaking coherent English. I have also NEVER before had Amazon refuse to make something good immediately. I should not have had to have spent an hour trying to recoup funds for something I didn’t order. I never order from third party sellers, and certainly not from a seller that is out of the country. They could have verified that by looking at the hundreds of purchases I’ve made from them over the past ten years. I asked fo a phone number to the corporate office; unfortunately, they don’t speak to customers. I’m so disappointed in what has been my go-to company for years.

This was my first time using Groupon for flowers. Usually I use Pro-Flowers. I saw a deal on Groupon for $20 and free shipping on flowers. Little did I know, this was just a "discount". The flowers through the shop, in my opinion, is astronomical. I paid Groupon $20 for the flowers, and then Blooms another $22. $42 for lower end flowers (without a vase mind you) to be delivered on Mother's Day May 12, 2019. While ordering these flowers on May 11th, 2019 through Groupon, it had given me a choice for the date of delivery. Of, course I chose the next day. After paying for the item, I received a notification that it wouldn't be delivered until Monday the 13th. Okay, no big deal. One day late. Then the evening of the 13th, I get a notification from Blooms saying the flowers will now not be delivered until Tuesday the 14th. I called into customer service to ask when the flowers would be delivered. After a 40 min wait, I finally got in touch with a representative who said it would be delivered to the physical address sometime today. Now, a time frame would be nice to know. Having flowers sitting outside in the cold or heat will ruin them. Customers, who bought flowers as a gift , can't expect them to stay home all day until 5 pm. To be delivered. In conclusion, I am disappointed in the service. I paid more than I would if I had gone through Pro-Flowers, they deliver on time and on the date promised. I will not be recommending this Groupon code or service from this company.

I used to love Apple products and have been an avid buyer for the last decade (multiple iPhones, MacBooks, iPads, beats and an Apple TV). My most recent experience has made me never want to purchase another product. I purchased a MacBook Pro in 2012, which wasn’t cheap, but when spending $2100 on a computer you would expect it to be quality. Boy was I wrong. The laptop all of the sudden would go to a gray screen when turned on and wouldn’t load from there. I looked up the issue online and found that this is a common issue with the 2011/2012 model of the MacBook, and Apple actually faced a class action lawsuit in 2014 over the defect, in which they offered out of warranty replacements from 2015-2016. When I brought it to the Apple store they ran a diagnostic test and confirmed that it was the defective video card. The Apple Genius informed me that the company considers my laptop obsolete and they no longer make the part so there are no options for repair. He immediately recommended that I just purchase a new laptop. Why would I ever want to buy another MacBook from a company that considers the device obsolete after 5-7 years and won’t even fix it if you pay the out of warranty repair price. All buyers beware any Apple product you own will be considered obsolete 5-7 years after release and will not offer any repair options after that point. There used to be a time where they would repair any model of any product but those days are long gone.

I'll attempt to keep this brief. I purchased tickets for an event that cost roughly $30 each. It's completely understandable that there will be "fees and service charges," as I am relying on the convenience of purchasing these tickets while sitting on my couch at home. Imagine my surprise when I am charged an extra $10 for each ticket. When I contacted the company via their chat, I was given rehearsed answers for why the fees exist, at which point I was told it boiled down to profits. TicketOffices.com admitted that they charged me roughly 1/3 of my ticket price so that they could make a profit. I would strongly suggest using another service to purchase your tickets, as many will only charge you a small fee for each order and not a fee for each ticket (even when its within the same order). TicketOffices.com is more concerned with making profits than they are with customer satisfaction.

Two month ago I purchased new account then I configured asus router with openvpn client, tried with tcp and udp, tried with uk,german,france,netherland servers.All connected, few servers not worked or not responded.My original isp speed is 50/16.But when I connected with vpn got max 16/14.Tried also win app but same result.So contacted support by live chat and also 20 times email support.They not resolved this problem.On live chat got answer: As I tried all the possible steps with you just now and we are still unable to increase your VPN speeds so thats why I suggested that I may then transfer the case to the 2nd level support..from email support got answer :Thank you for reply. Hope you are doing fine today. We apologize for the inconvenience you have faced so far, You are requested to join us on Live Chat and mention the Ticket # 1139826 so that the concern person can assists you accordingly...so I dont understanding what I did wrong..Im not monkey!..when I asked about remote support by teamviewer got answer all engineer is busy..after 2 month got answer by email from pure vpn : Dear Customer It is to inform you that speed is a variable and factor and changes time to time. It cant be controlled as there are other users and bandwidth of a server is shared among all the users on it. Moreover the speed you get depends on many factors and technicalities like transit nodes between your network and our VPN server, existing noise, etc. This is because the network traffic usually travels around the Earth from a user to a VPN server and then back to its destination. Note that when you are connected to the VPN you may not get more than 1/3 of the connection speed due to Encryption...so I asked about refund money..again answer: Thanks for contacting PureVPN support. We apologize for inconvenience. Unfortunately you're not qualifying for refund because you've submitted the refund request after 7 days of your subscription date...well I switched to another vpn provider and got full speed with openvpn tcp & udp without problem..so please guys be aware to switching to this poor provider..highly not recommended.

Facebook was a useful tool to communicate at the start, a way to share information and keep in contact and meet new people. And the service did not cost any money, but people did not understand it was not money you paid with but your personal information that could then be sold on to the highest bidder, and when they did understand they still used it. Facebook claimed to be a platform, a town square where all views could be aired and discussed, this meant they were not responsible for the content posted on their site, so if some views led to people being harmed they disavowed all liability, but then they started banning people for wrong think, those people that did not think in the far left manner, those people that resisted and went against the narrative published in the Media or spouted by Leftist Governments. They started to censor people. Labour & Conservative MP's started pushing Facebook to do what they say to follow their ideological rubbish, then they started blocking what people said, ban people, even delete posts that dared to mention certain names or post pictures of them. Then came the mass bans of people that did not follow what Facebook wanted to do, the election meddling started, not allowing people to have their democratic voice even if they had not broken any rules. Facebook turned from a Platform to a Publisher, a Publisher is responsible for what people say on their site, Facebook would be liable for the death threats, fanatical incitement to violence and the liable statements made by companies, political parties, newspapers, media channels, comedians and everyone else that posts. Facebook are now a publisher not a platform, and they should be counted as such by Governments and Organizations across the planet, you cannot have it both ways Facebook, you want to control what is said then your a PUBLISHER not a Platform who is interfering in Democratic Elections and CENSORING valid opinions. Facebook will claim some people have broken their terms of service, just look at Far Leftist or Religious fanatic pages, see the vile comments, death threats and incitement to violence, Facebook are not censoring these people. If you like Freedom of Speech, then leave Facebook and join Telegram, Minds, Gab and Bitchute, let Facebook disappear into the void of the internet. Bin Censorbook….

I placed an order online and received two confirmation emails with different order numbers. I emailed customer services to question this and ensure that only one order would be progressed.  My email, sent to the published customer service email address, bounced.  I checked the address and tried again.  Bounced again.  I sent 3 or 4 in total - all bounced.  I phoned the published cust services number *a lot of times*, including several calls during office hours, but my calls were never even answered - they all just eventually went to voicemail.  I left two messages requesting a call back.  Nothing.  In desperation I tweeted them with a query.  Nothing. I have now had one order fulfilled, which was quick, and is exactly what I wanted, and I have been charged for just one order.  Great. But I have heard nothing whatsoever about the other order.  No response to my emails, voicemails and tweets, no cancellation email, nothing. I love the classic Baracuta clothes, but I have never experienced (a lack of) customer service like this before.  I work in ecommerce and I am genuinely amazed - the least I would expect is an email fobbing me off!  But a cust service email address that doesn't exist and a tel no. that screens its phone calls?  Are you kidding?  It's unbelievably unprofessional. In fairness, they successfully and quickly fulfilled my order and charged me corrrectly.  But the customer service side of the operation seems to be literally non-existent, despite massive efforts on my part to reach them.  On that basis, I could not recommend them at all. Buy Baracuta clothes by all means - they do some lovely stuff - but buy them from someone else.

So here's the issue we had. The process of going through the online scheduling and sending the clubs out was all pretty good. However, the timing of the delivery was off by 4 days... early. In theory this is better than being late. Except that the golf course we were shipping to - like many golf courses - had a policy that they can only store clubs for 48 hours in advance. This is why we used shipsticks because we could select our exact delivery date. So when we did, and then they arrived 4 days early, you can see where we had a problem. I'm not sure what the fix is and I'm sure ShipSticks will say something to the effect of "it's out of our hands once FedEx takes over". But the bottom line is that it created a poor customer experience.

There was no friction as I had zero interaction other than calling for book delivery etc.   The biggest problem is that the program I completed should not be online only since computer network security requires hands on experience.  While I learned the concepts, I had nowhere to try them out.  You should outline that a certain PC with certain system requirements/software etc. is required since we can't play around with security concepts on a working laptop/PC at home or work.  It needs to be a dedicated machine, off the network too perhaps.  The biggest disappointment was that the BOOKS ARE ANCIENT AS ARE MANY TOPICS COVERED!  While basic security concepts remain current, A LOT OF THE INFORMATION REFERRED TO WINDOWS 2003/XP!!!! That's ancient in IT.  The books are not updated for today's world.  12-13 yr old concepts are useless.  Without any practical, hands on experience, I really didn't feel like I could apply what I learned...which is the only way to really learn.  I had no idea who to call if I had a question.  The timings etc. were not convenient and I didn't know what the process was.  I was not about to post a question and go back and forth to get an answer....overall, I am not impressed with this program in particular.  LOTS OF IMPROVEMENTS ARE NEEDED.

Oil change itself was OK.  However, I used $24.95 Car Care Package which includes "Top off fluids", not being sure what specific "fluids" were covered. (1) They sent me a photo of the power steering fluid which seems a bit lower than it should be, but they did not do anything about it (they did not even mention if the power steering oil was included or not under the definition of "fluid".  (2) They forgot to turn off the "Maintenance Required" warning lamp.  I noticed and asked but they said it did not work.  However, right after that, I brought my car to my maintenance garage, and they could easily turn it off by the usual oil change process.  I wonder if the Tire Depot mechanic did not even have that simplest knowledge on how to turn it off, or just forgot to do so. (3) They did not place any sticker (or even did not peer off the previous sticker) for the next oil change timing.  This was my first time to see it was not done. (4) The coupon package also stated several other services to be provided but I did not get any explanation about its status nor any documents of being them checked (Air pressure, Battery inspection,  Inspect belts & hoses, Inspect brakes, tire tread).  The only description in the receipt shows they did the oil/filter change and tire rotation.  Actually, when I brought my car to my maintenance garage right after that, the power steering oil leakage was due to the tightened hose just below the fluid container which Tire Depot mechanic has taken the photo.  This means, they did not even checked that "hose". This store was my second store under Tire Depot, and I have experienced unsatisfactory service in both stores.  I think I should not come back to it any more, because of 100% unsatisfactory experiences.

They don't care if your sneakers aren't authentic after the 3 day grace period even if their policy states they offer Assurance of Authenticity, which is highlighting that the sneaker you receive could be fake. In fact, customer service blew me off when I brought this up after seeing my Jordans Retro 4 paint chip apart after a few wears. They're making it sound like the quality on a sneaker made in 2012 is the same as 1992, so i'm going to consult legal advice about this situation because something don't smell right. -------------- GOAT: Hey there, Thanks for reaching out and providing those photos. Unfortunately, there's not much we can do in terms of a refund or credit as the damage occurred to the sneakers after they had been worn. Since this is more of an issue with the craftsmanship and durability of the sneaker, it's best that this issue is taken up with Adidas/Nike. Our service guarantees that the sneakers will be 100% authentic and in the condition as described upon arrival, and any issue that occurs due to wear and tear is something that should be taken up directly with the manufacturer. Thanks, Samantha ------------- ME Hello, So I want to make sure I got this right. The paint of the sneaker is chipping with less than 5 wears and you’re not at all concerned if the sneaker i received is authentic, even if your policy covers “Assurance of Authenticity” (which is pretty much saying that there’s a chance the sneaker people buy can be fake after purchase) So, where in the agreement between seller and buyer does it state that coverage in damages of the products through the purchase of a third party that guarantee’s authenticity will be covered through the manufacturers? I’m not trying to start trouble with you all. I’ve purchased quite a few sneakers from GOAT, all of which I typically collect as a small hobby and this is the first sneaker with paint chipping. We make mistakes in life, it makes us human but could it be possible that the ONE sneaker I got and barely wore, with paint chipping off could be fake? or are you already determining that my sneakers are authentic because this is an issue that happens often? It’d be crazy news that GOAT’s response was so vague, they’re almost giving the impression that 1. buyers have a chance of purchasing fake sneakers (as it’s written in your policy) and 2. Jordan’s 4 Retro sneakers peeling is a normal thing, according to GOAT customer service. Last time I had sneakers chipping was in the 90s. i’ve purchased a few Jordans. This right here is a first. Let’s do the right thing and fix this situation. Don’t blow me off like that. ------------ GOAT Hey there, Thanks for reaching out to GOAT, 1. The shoes were verified to be 100 % authentic and were verified with no flaws to be present on the shoes at the time of verification. 2. You purchased the shoes back on 11/25/18 and based on our policy there is nothing that we can do in terms of credit or refund as it has been past our 3 days policy. 3. The reason why you see cracking and chipping on the paint on the mid sole is due to the age of the shoes. These shoes were released on 11-01-2012. Based on the age of the shoes they are considered to be "VINTAGE" and prone to have issues of age. With all that said like advised we will not be able to do anything in regards to a refund or credit. Sorry about this! Thanks, Samantha --------------- So ya'll can go ahead and make a judgment call. The quality on sneakers from 2012 isn't different from the quality sneakers are made with today. The fact the paint chipped off wearing them 5 times SCREAMSSSSSS these are fake after wearing them. The reason why they're not going to cover me is because the cost of these sneakers are high and nobody wants to cut the reimbursement. This is going to cost you more than the price of the sneakers and the way social media works today I'm not understanding why any company would take the risk but okay, i'm game.

I am new to HughesNet.  I am used to high speed cable.  I don't get that with HughesNet.  I am both grateful for the service and disappointed to pay for a service that was promised when I signed up.  I was told I could keep my landline phone number from my previous provider, and no one informed me that in fact my number had changed!  That was very bad for me because my 90 year old mother couldn't reach me due to this error.  She was having emergency surgery and family members went out of their way to scout me out.  Yesterday, Monday August 12,2019, I had no service on my internet.  I was told the only time I would loose service is if there is a thunder and lighting storm.  We cut trees down in order to get a strong signal.  I live rurally, and need both phone and internet and was grateful when I was told the equipment could be installed a day earlier than scheduled.  I haven't had to  call tech support yet therefore; can't comment on that part of the service.  I am just glad to have the service that is provided.  Hopefully, there will not be many days that I have to go without.  There is always the library in the summer months, but winter leaves me stranded on the mountain.  Once again, I am thankful for the young man that installed my equipment.

I have used Freight Center several times.  This last and final time, I ordered a pickup.  It wasn't a rush, but I needed it gone the day requested.  It wasn't picked up and I never got a call.  The carrier had been switched from the one I requested.  When I inquired about the pickup, I was informed that the carrier I was assigned only did pickups in my area once a week.  Had I known that, I would have requested to go with the carrier I had originally requested.  The reps with Freight Center apologized and set up a new pick up with the carrier I originally requested.  Which was fine.  My shipment got picked up.  But what upsets me is that several days later, the first shipping company shows up to my office to pick up the shipment.  THEY WERE NEVER CANCELED.  I find out that this is a very small local company and this happens to them all the time.  I was told by the Freight Center rep that they had canceled it but got no apologies and got a very blase answer about it.  Due to their non or miscommunication, the small, local shipping company wasted their resources on a nonexistent shipment.  Being someone who has owned small businesses, they don't have money to throw around.  And due to that, I just can't - and won't use Freight Center again. My Response:  Your company keeps claiming it canceled, but I don't think the company would waste its resources and gas to pick up a shipment if they had received the cancellation.  The owner said this happens to them all the time.  I got a very short and trite "it was canceled on * date" and that was it.  I am very dissatisfied with the lack of taking responsibility on this and that is why I will never use your company again.

Need a mattress delivered so you won't have to sleep on the floor? Consider another delivery service. "Five-star express delivery" is a poor name for theirs. We scheduled our mattress's delivery two weeks prior to our move-in date to our new apartment, scheduled for the day we would move in. We scheduled for an afternoon delivery - oh, boy. We were under the impression, from the sales associate, that our delivery would be scheduled from 2:30 to 3:30 pm the day we moved in, which was perfect - we ensured our bed frame was ready and awaited the call one hour before the delivery would come. Well, we waited until 3:30 pm and finally called RC Willey... and then came to learn that our delivery wasn't scheduled until 10 pm to midnight that night. Be sure to read the fine print on their receipt with your order, as it states your delivery time will be available either after seven pm the night before (morning delivery) or after 1:30 pm the day of delivery). Complicating this debacle even more, I finally got a call from the delivery driver at 5:47 pm informing me that our delivery would come from 10 to midnight that night. (They were supposed to call just an hour before delivery - something seemed fishy). We end up waiting, having now made a makeshift bed ON OUR FLOOR next to our set-up bed frame, until 12:30 am. NO CALL. No voicemail. We headed to bed. Next day, I check the order status and the mattress is now scheduled for delivery IN ALMOST TWO WEEKS. We were never informed the delivery was re-scheduled. We call customer service at the distribution center and have our mattress delivery re-scheduled for the same day. I asked the customer service rep to please give me a call to inform me of the delivery time when it was available. I never received a call. Thankfully I was able to check online. Our new scheduled timeframe was 7-9 pm. However, we could have easily fallen into the same situation as the night before with a 10 to midnight timeframe, as the time they schedule your delivery is based on a lottery system. Our mattress finally arrives at 9:40 or so pm, a little later than the timeframe we were given of 7-9 pm. The delivery drivers, because we asked, were not the same crew as the night before, and one of the drivers made a comment that the crew from the night before was known for cutting deliveries short. Additionally, we learned the delivery drivers are paid by piece, so if they want to cancel your delivery, they can and do not need to inform you. AND they have delivered items as late as 1:30 am. We scheduled delivery with RC Willey due to their superior mattress return policy and $59 all-year delivery fee, but won't trust their service again if we need a mattress to sleep on the same day as delivery was scheduled.

Expedia should NEVER have listed the Hillsboro OH Greystone Motel.It is substandard by ANY measure.It's rating of 2.5 of 5 is overstated by 1.5 points.1.0 would be generous.The motel owner refused a refund of our TWO UNUSED nights even though we tried 2 rooms there.The 1st had a shower the exact size of a coffin with decades-old stains.The room was marginally clean, musty, extremely dated.The 2nd was far superior, but it was not thoroughly cleaned.Cobwebs, dirt in corners of floors, tub/shower handle didn't adjust temp.Generally unappealing.Due to the poor condition of this place, Expedia is responsible to resolve this...but, you refused to help.The motel owner has kept over $100 of our money, and we had to pay a Days Inn $170 additional for those 2 nights.Extremely poor quality should easily override a motel's rigid cancellation policy.Their policy is rigid for a reason:Once people see their rooms, they would want to run away.Wish we had sooner,but, we put trust in Expedia,won't make that mistake again.We'll be posting negatively about Expedia everywhere on social media.WE'RE DONE WITH EXPEDIA.WE CAN'T TRUST YOU TO PROVIDE REASONABLE MOTELS WITH REAL REVIEWS.

First time buying from Stock X and I purchased 2 pair of shoes and looking to purchase a 3rd pair. 1 shoe I am satisfied with the other I am not. They were some things wrong with the shoe, I don't know if it is a manufacturer defect or a fake but I contacted customer service and they only gave me the option to return for a refund or take a $20 credit on my next pair.  I want this exact shoe but the other asking prices are way more than I want to pay. Great customer service would be to get me the shoe I want at the price. I don't want to lose out on a shoe I want but I'm not 100% satisfied with the product. If it's fake, it would be paying above MSRP for a fake with only a $20 discount. I love shoes and buy shoes all the time, but I can believe in a 50/50 chance that my shoes may not be authentic. May be looking into the Goat to purchase shoes. Do the right thing Stock X and get me the shoe I want at the price I want. This leaves me to wonder if they are okay with customers selling fake shoes and keeping the money they received on them.

After doing my research I ended up purchasing 7 gift cards at a discount to purchase some funiture.  As a Google trusted store I knew my purchase would be protected.  After receiving my gift card codes I went to use them to buy my new furniture.  To my surprise the first 2 codes had a zero balance.  Then the next 4 worked.  Then the last and highest value code didn't work.  I guess I could sort of understand if one code didn't work, accidents happen, but for almost half not to work is seems negligent/fraudulent. I also purchased 9 discounted cards from one of their competitors and all of their codes worked no problem.  The furniture I was purchasing was on sale and the sale was ending that day.  This left me out the money for the cards and effected my originally planned purchase price.  I called Giftcards.com and they told me it would be reviewed and someone would get back to me within 48 hours.  They did follow up with me the next day and issued a refund for the cards that didn't work.   I would not purchase discounted cards from them in the future.

Everything about this device I love, except the pods. They use Silica wicks, which is 1 red flag. I've blown through both pods included in not even 2 weeks due to the neglect put into the pod itself. Flavor is terrible, if it doesn't taste like a highly mute flavor, it's burnt or dry. I find myself pulling the pod out several times an hour to get it to wick the juice so I'm not vaping silica wick throughout the day. I get absolutely no throat punch despite being labeled a salt nic device and running salt nic. From a company like Limitless, I am beyond disappointed with this product. And the icing on the cake is it's almost 15 dollars for three of these pieces of garbage. Would not recommend, will be thrown in the trash when my Pavinno Puro arrives.

I had 3 problems with my order of 11 LPs from Oldies.com. 1. I was browsing Oldies.Com's LP inventory when I came across a LP the I had been searching for. I decided to order it. Since I was ordering one LP I decided to order more. My order processed & shipped normally. Upon receipt the box (unopened) was wrapped for Christmas. When I opened the package I discovered that the LP I wanted (the main reason I placed my order) was not in the order. I called Oldies.Com and was told the item was out of stock. Their website still showed the item for sale (and still does). When placing my order I was not told the item was unavailable, if I had been I would have cancelled the whole order. 2. Another LP had been water damaged and had mold on the sleeve and record. I spoke with Oldies.com and returned the item for replacement. However, they did not replace the item (it is still in stock on their website). Again Oldies.Com did not communicate with me. I didn't know what was happening with my return/replacement until after the refund was applied to my credit card. 3. Another LP is slightly warped, but still plays. I would normally return it. However, based upon my experience with the moldy LP I decided it was better to have a slightly warped but playable copy than no copy at all.
When you have paied, you get no help or service. I will never use them again

Horrible customer service at Viking Bags. I needed just a lid to replace the one I damaged on my Viking saddlebags which had been custom painted. They do not sell just lids, so I had no choice but to purchase a whole new set of bags, just for the lid. Which I did. I was never advised that the model I had was discontinued, and I placed an order in good faith, received the bags and the lid does not fit. Therefore I am obliged to custom paint the whole new set of bags which is too expensive for me to do. Being a Canadian client, I have already paid a high percent rate of exchange, duty, taxes, shipping etc.... and I called asking why I had been advised to buy new bags when the lid would never have been able to fit. I was misled. The customer service said if you don't like the bags, ship them back. This is not the way to handle customers. I don't want to ship back bags at my expense for another $100 dollars and again loose money on the exchange rate from Canadian to American dollars. They don't care at Viking. They have no skills at communicating with their clients, they refused to help me find a solution or to even accept for me to ship back the bags at their expense, considering I was never told that my original model bags had been discontinued. This company is horrible . I do not recommend any out of country purchase, as if you have any problem at all, they do not care and will not stand behind their product. They never told me the bag was discontinued. They allowed me to purchase expensive bags that would not fit with changing of the lids, and they don't care at all that I am out of pocket approximately $700 . They really don't care about anything. Their customer service is 0 quality . There is no care factor. Highly do not recommend.... low end service ... very low end.

Sure it's a great idea.... As an owner After putting my truck up for rent...a nice guy rented my truck. mid way into the rental I got a call that he clipped a curb and busted a wheel and tires...I wasn't mad I know accidents happen..I just wanted it taken care of... so "I thought" Turo would handle things promptly, entirely, and correctly....since my truck was a money income for them to get it fixed and back in use. I get an email from her stating the estimator came in at $334 which is shy $700+ of the actual cost. And that they will send me payment as such. So now I'm stuck still without a truck...I had to cancel another rental that someone wanted to use my truck so I lose out on that income. And I'm stuck in the middle. Don't have my truck. It's stuck at the dealership. And you don't want to cover the actual costs that the renter did to my truck????!!!!!  I have to wait till tomorrow to see how this continues?? I will come back and post a review of an update and see how long this takes Turo to fix and get my truck back. And I will continue to post 1 star bad reviews until this is taken care of correctly. Turo Tiffany....you still haven't answered my questions from my emails. I still have not gotten a call from you. And I still want to know how to get reimbursed for a rental costs for myself?? Horrible Horrible Support!!!! CEO/Managers/Owners of Turo...you need to create better support teams for your company that handle customers and especially owners of vehicles to get things handled promptly and correctly. be back tomorrow....and the next....and the next...if it takes that long...until it's resolved...1 stars all the way home.... --------------------------------------------------------------------------- Thx for the reply Turo below...but it's still not resolved..and I don't know how to reply to your comment here other than edit/add to this post. Day 10 without a vehicle.... I did receive an email from Turo Tiffany...and she did give me a phone # now. hmmm..tried calling went straight to voicemail and it said she returns calls within 24+ hours. Left yet another vm for you TT (Turo Tiffany). You have yet called me now on day 10.  Here is the response email I got below: --------------------------------------------- Hi Daniel, I've reviewed the estimate that you have submitted from Ford. You have replaced two tires and will only cover the cost for the damaged tire, so one tire is included in our estimate. Also, we have applied betterment for the tire. Since the tire tread had 35% wear, then we will pay for 65% of the new tire. Ford has replaced the wheel and our appraiser determined that the wheel could have been repaired. We will only cover the cost of the repair to the wheel and not the replacement. For the car rental reimbursement please send me your rental reservation and invoice so that I may review it. If you need to reach me by phone my number is (520) 277-5325. Thanks, Tiffany --------------------------------------------- So now I'm at a loss for words here. Turo's "insurance" that I chose on my car says "zero-out of pocket" coverage on claims. "1 million dollar insurance plan"  and here is claim from a renter that I had no doing of myself. And they want to cover 29% of the actual repair/replacement costs. TT you couldn't have called me on Day 1 when I sent you that Ford repair estimate/invoice and said we barely cover jack repairs and will only have used replacement tires and sanding/painting over a cracked wheel. Sure that will make the wheel back to where it was before??!! really?!  I'm sure you would love it if your husband/boyfriend brought you 29% dead flowers and band aid'd them up a bit and said I'm only replacing the flowers you had before. huh?! Day 1-5 I took uber and also filled up a friends car with gas for my rides. Are you going to reimburse for those also? They tried to buy me off with a £20 VOUCHER - whilst STILL committing fraud. After MANY emails, they EVENTUALLY agreed to refund me. They then refunded only part of it and I am STILL chasing the balance. Time after time I had to argue that I WAS IN THE UK. Time after time I had to argue I HAD NOT PAID WITH A CREDIT CARD. They wanted me to FAX my credit card details TO ANOTHER COUNTRY. They claimed their legal address for me to issue Court proceedings was IN THE USA, rather than IN THE UK. I HAVE SENT OVER 50 EMAILS!!! I was dealing with staff with less than a basic grasp of English, who were deluded or - more sinister - is it company policy to deny refunds even though THEY had the money back in their accounts? They are the WORST Holiday company. Save your money, do NOT book with them - or their expedia group.

VBeware of their booking mobile app - it is designed to fraud your money. They scammed me for £280. I attempted to use their mobile app and was charged 4 (FOUR) times for 1 transaction. When I tried to make a booking, the app displayed a message 'the card payment hasn't gone through', so I retyped the card details, thinking I made  a typo, the same message appeared, so I switched to my debit card. After having received a third message 'The card payment has been rejected' I moved on to my laptop. The payment on the laptop has gone through fine. You can appreciate my surprise when, a week later, I discovered 4 transactions from Wizzair, 3 of which were for different amounts of money, and when I logged in to Wizzair, there were 4 bookings for the same name, same flight, same date and the same hour. So, according to Wizzair, I'm going clone myself 4 times,. Summarising, they owe me £280 for 3 of those transactions. I emailed their customer service, but no response for 8 days and counting. They say if you have an urgent issue you can call them but... the calls cost only 77p per minute!! Nice way of making a few extra bob on top of what they've scammed out of me already. So not only did they steal my money by abusing my consumer trust, but also want to charge me to speak to them! I recorded it with my bank as a fraudulent activity and I will get a refund.

The Rug Doctor STINKS The first rug doctor I picked up at Wall mart failed to extract any water from  the rug during the first 3 gallons applied. It started out with them telling us to be ready at the hotel for pick-up by 6:05 (hope to see you there comment from the driver) and the bus didn't end up arriving until 6:50am, which means we had to wait for wayy too long. Overall it was a good trip for the short amount of time we had available due to the long drive there and back. On the way back we stopped at a lot of great sights to take pictures which was great, but on the way there he told me I didn't have enough time to use the restroom and I would have to wait another hour. We did two more 15 minute stops in that time, none with a restroom available, which made it very uncomfortable for me. Our driver was nice, but seemed quite confused on how to operate the bus (mic was on without him noticing, turned the heat on instead of a/c, lots of rattling of the bus, and almost let too many people on the bus on the way back which lead to confusion and people afraid of not finding a seat). He also drove very fast and a loooot of swerving and lane changes (I felt very unsafe and scared, especially on the way back, since we almost got in an accident where he passed a semi and then had to slam his break in a traffic jam). It was a good tour, not sure if it was worth the money and the risk though.

Pay Pal appears on the surface to be a convenient method of making on line payments, and certainly whilst it was still owned by Wells Fargo this was largely the case, although actually speaking to a human operative when things do go wrong was never easy. Since the sale to ebay however, customer services has degraded massively and several of the companies policies are, at best, highly dubious.  The companies tendency to almost always side with a buyer even when the buyer is pulling an obvious scam or when the post office confirm the seller did send the item, the item was delivered and in some cases even when the post office provide evidence that the buyer even signed for an item they later claimed not to have received, has naturally lead to a huge increase in fraudulent charge-backs and buying scams.   If you are a seller be very, very careful indeed whenever accepting payment via this company. This charge-backs scam has become particularly popular on high ticket items such as laptops and so  on, and in the space of one week 4 separate sellers that are on my Face Book list fell for the same scam.

I have found that many items I have received from Tophatter auctions are coming from the exact same address even though the seller names were different. The final comment I have is about Tophatter Easy Returns: "We want you to be completely satisfied with your purchase on Tophatter. If you are not satisfied, you may return any item within 30 days of delivery." I have received items that were defective, wrong quantity, terrible quality and even the wrong item. Tophatter sometimes gives you a return shipping label to print, but not always, often they expect you to return items on your own dime all the way back to China with a tracking number, the cost of shipping an item back to China being more than you paid for the item. Definitely not completely satisfying the buyer, really just robbing the customer of his money.

Horrible!  I saved $2.00 over the big booksellers, who's names I knew and trusted, to purchase from this unknown company.  It showed up on some aggregator list as the best price for my book.  The website claimed the book would ship within 24 hours of payment. I ordered the book on 8/15, and as of 8/22 it hasn't shipped.  All of my other book orders have already been shipped and received. I called their direct line about a dozen times on 8/20, and received a message that "all service employees were busy, please call back later."  I finally did reach a live person. She seemed helpful and gave a semi-plausible (The book was being drop shipped from the publisher) explanation for the delay.  She offered to upgrade the shipping and put me on hold.  When she came back she said the order was already in the shipping department, so the shipping couldn't be upgraded.  She assured me the book would be sent the next day.  It is now two days later, and the book hasn't shipped.  Worse, they have changed their phone message so that there is no option to speak with a representative.  They offer a "chat" on the website, but there is no mechanism for this so called chat.  There is only a page that allows you to ask a question about your order, but it is not live by any stretch.  This appears to be a very poorly run operation with little regard for customer service.  As I said in the title, Buyer Beware.

Bus was supposed to leave from Vienna metro at 6:30 am. No one showed up, they wouldn’t answer their phones, no correspondence to notify passengers of delay. Bus and check in attendant arrived at 7:10. Return from NY was poor a mess too. I will never use them again and advise people to steer clear!

1800Flowers has to have the worst customer service.  I ordered flowers, that were shown online, to be delivered February 6, 2019.  The flowers were not delivered and were not available any longer.  1800Flowers offered to replace the original flowers and make delivery on February 9, 2019. The replacement flowers were not delivered either.  I called to cancel the order and have my money refunded.  After spelling my name for the millionth time for the agent she stated that my order would be canceled.  By the way, I was put on hold for 33 minutes.  I called again on February 18, 2019, to find out that the agent was confused and did not refund my money.  I was told that the refund would be processed in 5 to 8 business depending on my bank.  That time has now lapsed, so I called again today March 11, 2019.  I was told today that it will take up to 1 or 2 billing cycles to have my money refunded.  I immediately asked to speak to a supervisor.  However, the supervisor always seems to be on the phone or not available.  I know because I have asked for a supervisor before and they never seem to be available.  This has to be the worst experience ever.  I will not ever but flowers from this company again.  I would rather grow flowers in my yard myself.  This is deplorable.  I am going to tell everyone I know to never purchase flowers from 1800Flowers.  I suggest anyone reading this review to NEVER order flowers from 1800Flowers.

Background (short version): We booked a flight, Bangkok-Adelaide, back in July 2014 with departure date March 5th 2015. When we checked in to the flight everything was fine, at the stopover in Kuala Lumpur we got the information that the flight was canceled two months before and there was no connecting flight. This is on Air Asia’s, but they had informed Bravofly about the cancelled flight, that was on record and  I read it. Bravofly had failed (not even tried) to notify us about the canceled flight. The problem/complaint: When I arrived home I immediately contacted Bravofly and explained what had happened, the woman I spoke to was quite rude but promised me to look in to the matter and contact me with a solution. I expect to get some kind of compensation because the canceled flight cost us one night accommodation and new flight tickets. It’s now over two weeks since I spoke to Bravofly and I still haven’t heard a word back. It's time to take some responsibilities and come up with an soloution!! Solution for others: NEVER book anything through Bravofly!

"Columbus Day Sale" Experience, Would have been nice to know the 20% Columbus Day sale isn't credited/ taken off the existing sale package price. Then the sales associate calculates the estimated cost based on existing sale package price, giving incorrect estimated cost. Literally had associate add up prices, quoting me totals that were vastly incorrect, directing attention away from actual pricing used. Accordingly not crediting the 20% off, toward total warranty pricing, and initially not applying warranty to entire furniture package purchase. I became so fed up with the constant issues, double pricing, I declined the warranty. It seemed I could never get a straight answer, with associates trying to hide the true pricing of the furniture, in addition to warranty pricing, and applying 20% Columbus Day sale to entire bill. Somewhere in the fine print, which was never able to be shown to me, the 20% Columbus Day Sale was taken of original price, not he advertised existing sale price!  At no time was this explained, displayed, until cashing out. Imagine my dismay when we were at an 800 dollar difference from original estimates. I have had previous experiences in which I was satisfied with the customer service, as well as furniture quality! Unfortunately this was not one of those times. In the staff's defense, they were never rude. Unaware, misinformed, negligent in correctly/accurately answering  questions asked, ... yes.... resulting in confusion and mistrust .... yes.... Due to vast online competition, as well as traditional chain stores, why deceive a customer that has already committed to buying furniture previously/currently. The cost was never the issue, the principal of deceit, with smoke and mirrors trying to hide the costs was very poor/unprofessional. The reason I completed the rest of my furnishing needs at several competitors. Consequently, there were no issues and pricing was exact. I have faith the furniture will last and be quality, to withstand regular wear and tear, the reason for my repeat business. Highly disappointed with this transaction, wish everyone better luck.

I've bought loads of Mac kit over the years, iPhone 4, 5, 5c, 6+, two iPhone 7's, two Mac mini's, three iPads!,  a G5 back in the day, a 27" thunderbolt monitor - when I think of how much money I've personally given to them over the years it makes me sick to my stomach that when I first needed a repair. The battery won't charge on my iPhone 6+, it's a common fault and they are offering £25 repairs at the moment because they know there is an issue. I went online to report it and after chatting to someone for an hour they wanted £336.44 to repair it (promising to return any money that I overpaid). £336.44 is quite different to £25. I am now stuck with a useless phone that wasn't fit for purpose that I guess I'll just have to go down a different route with but one thing is for sure, I will NEVER buy a piece of apple equipment again. I am sure the money I have spent which is a lot for me is just a drop in the ocean to them but if it helps anyone make a decision on whether to buy Apple equipment in the future then taking the time to write this will be worth it.
