So of course I called them right away. THERE COMPANY DOES NOT ACCEPT PHONE CALLS! The voicemail literally said they can't answer their phones due to high call volumes (RED FLAG). So I emailed them and politely asked them to call or email me back right away. These shirts were a preorder for my online shop and they were bought and paid for by customers. A few days went by and I heard nothing from them. So I started emailing them daily. Not a single response for over 3 weeks. I was in tears multiple times because I felt so powerless. This company had my customer's money and I literally couldn't talk to ANYONE about it. I finally got online and tried their chat for about the 20th time. FINALLY someone responded (it took a minimum of 10 minutes between each chat reply) The guy online said they needed to get my approval to delay the shipping date before they could print. ARE YOU JOKING? You've already missed my deadline and you are saying you've been sitting on my shirts because you have to ask if they can be delayed? I basically told him if they weren't sent to production that day I would file a claim with every available outlet I could. He assured me they would be sent that day. A week later I received another email saying there was a delay. I just broke down crying and immediately called Paypal. Not surprisingly that evening I received an email saying my shirts were being printed and gave me a new delivery date for the following week. The shirts finally arrived almost 3 months after I placed the order. The best part is now a few months later I am getting email responses from the dozens of emails I sent them 5 months ago. All of which are automated letters telling me my order was delivered. Yeah thanks guys. TERRIBLE HORRIBLE AWFUL....JUST THE WORST OF THE WORST. DO NOT ORDER FROM THIS COMPANY!!!!!!

I had issues with the site when trying to purchase my flights. Received an error code twice during checkout. Then tried to use my husband’s card to book, and the booking went through fine.  At that point I was pleased with my experience, until the next day, when my checking account was overdraft by $1000, because all 3 of the transactions had been taken out of my account ($6000 total) by justfly.com.  I subsequently spent 4 hours of my day fighting on the phone with unhelpful customer service “supervisors” at justfly. They could not locate bookings for the 1st two transactions that were charged to my card and kept telling me over and over that they must just be pending charges (which my bank had already told me they were not pending).  I ended up having to call my bank’s fraud department to try and work out the issue as I was getting nowhere with customer service.  My bank opened an investigation to help return my money.  I will never book with justfly again!

Beware of the Seatgeek seller Scam and Seatgeek's ineptness to address.  I purchase three months in advance 2 orchestra tickets to Neil Young via SeatGeek.  The specific ticket location was not identified, but per the terms they were to be delivered 2 days before the event.  Unfortunately the tickets were not delivered as promised, in fact was 6 hours before the concert start and the Seller had purchased in secondary market from existing inventory at discounted pricing to fulfil the order. A complete fraud transaction that the Seller used to make arbitrage profits.  SeatGeek did not care and disavowed any responsibility. I've had 100s of successful transactions on StubHub, this is the first and last time to use SeatGeek.

They lie about there inventory. Out of 8 items I ordered only one (1) came in. They billed me for all the merchandise with out giving me ANY news on the missing items despite my numerous calls to try to find out what was going on. They simply treated me like a D rating to be polite.

WORSE SERVICE EVER!!!!!! takes a lot for me to complain about service because I've worked in customer service for so many years. So I have the empathy to see both sides of almost any situation. It takes extreme that negligence or rudeness or both to make me complain. This is the first review I've ever done. I'm not sure how well they work for other people but GrubHub in my area has absolutely failed not once,  but twice!!  I'll never even attempt to order using their services again. They have competitors here and those competitors are doing a much better job. the first time we ordered using grubhub because I am working two jobs and wanted to make sure that the kids had a hot meal instead of waiting on me to get home and stand in the kitchen another one to two hours. GrubHub accept the order after listing the restaurants that are still open. The restaurant was listed to be open another hour and half! We received no updates for over an hour. But the estimated time of arrival was 45 minutes to an hour so we didn't think anything of it until we received an email an hour and half later stating that it could not be delivered . The email came with a promo code to take off our next order. Come to find out the driver didn't make it in time. tonight for the same reasons we tried the promo code and GrubHub again. Alas after an hour and a half of waiting we receive another email from GrubHub 7 minutes after the restaurant closed stating yet again they've dropped the ball and the driver did not get there in time. I called customer service to no avail. The person at the other end of the line could not help me at all. again I will never use GrubHub again and I will tell everyone I know not to use GrubHub ever!!! The only reason they got one star from me is because I had to put at least one star in order to post my review!!!! Awful!! PS...I use the online app with Domino's and my order was complete and on the way to me within 25 minutes!

I’m an ICU nurse who works night shifts. Came down with a sinus infection and I am in the middle of a work week. I thought this would be perfect to get treated and still be able to get rest so I could go back to work tonight. I get sinus infections at least once a year, I have a very long (and painful) history of tonsillitis and have had to have my tonsils lanced 4 times due to infections. I am very aware of how fast a sinus infection turns into a serious life threatening emergency. I tried explaining all of this to the MD who told me “to give it a few more days” and “take 3 OTC ibuprofen” and “switch my allergy pill”. So after that complete waste of my time, I am now sitting in my PCP office because he could luckily squeeze me in to treat my infection! But way to make me feel like a drug seeker for asking for an antibiotic!

I've ordered previously from the now closed Windsor, CT location and was very satisfied. Now that your operation is in TN the experience was awful. This first started on Monday, Oct 21st. After looking at some parts over the prior weekend, I had some questions about which brand to choose and specific parts. It took me three calls to get someone to answer the phone. Is there only one guy answering phones there? Then the guy told me Rein brand was made in Germany which isn't true. I found out its actually made in Turkey from your website. Next was the poor communication and shipping after I ordered 13 items. I REALLY needed some eccentric bolts to finish a job I was working on. It states on your website if you order by 4pm your order will be shipped that same day. I placed my order shortly after Noon in Tuesday, 10/22. I received the first shipping confirmation at 11am the next day for only two of the parts. So I called the TN number to ask if the eccentric bolts ordered would be shipping out soon and if they could give me an ETA on them. Of course, once again no one answers the phone the two times I called so I ended up leaving a message. Miraculously, I got an email at 6pm saying they shipped but no one called me back like I asked. That's what keeps customers coming back and creates business growth. I got the final package shipping confirmation at 8pm that same day. I received the first and thirs packages on Friday 10/25. As far as the most important items, the eccentric bolts, I have still yet to receive. On top of thay, the tracking number still says "Your package is on its way to a USPS facility" and its been the same since 10/23 at 9:13pm. It is now 10/26 so I still dont know if the items ever shipped or what's going on. I'd call but that's a waste of time obviously. Apparently they are coming from Texas. Order number is 1905528 if you want to review it. I think I will order from FCP for my two VWs, BMW and Volvo. You guys don't compare when it comes to customer service, even if your prices are great. Business's die because of poor customer service, not price. You also advertise fast shipping which is false advertisement in my latest experience.

Seemingly, I thought I booked a tee time to play on Friday, 9/12/14.  I went to my email to print out a copy of the confirmation email, when I saw that the tee time was scheduled for the Same Day - 9/10/14.  I immediately called to find out what the deal was.  The customer service agent told me that the system must have re-routed me to the current day, since I needed to book three players, but two players were only available for Friday's round.  I thought, what kind of run around am I getting here.  He was friendly enough and gave me the option to give me a credit and use the money for another round or refund my money.  I opted to get my money back.  From the moment I finished booking the tee time and the time I received the confirmation email couldn't  have been more than a minute.  It wasn't like I waited till the next day to cancel or reschedule, I called immediately because of an error.   And to top things off, it was raining most of the day here in Southern Wisconsin.  Golf18network wouldn't have known about the rain, but the golf course sure could have verified the weather and only an idiot would play in this weather. The next day i received an email confirming my refund - Green fees less Booking fees.  I called immediately and was told that they couldn't refund my money but give me a four dollar and change credit towards my next round or rounds.  So, let me get this straight, the customer service agent says the "SYSTEM" re-routes me but I have to pay the booking fees because of Golf18networks error?  I guess that's one way to create revenue.  In the end, I'm obligated to book a round through Golf18network to use my "credit", which I will do, but it will be my First and Last time to use this site.  All the reviewers who cloyingly praised this site, one day you'll click the wrong "Day Icon" or get "system re-routed" and you'll be grumbling about the hard and fast policy of "BOOKING FEES ARE NON-REFUNDABLE!!!!!!!!!"

My dresses took way to long to get to me so now I have to just return them because they took 3 weeks when it said 5-7 days shipping. Also no one answered my emailed and you don't have a phone to call. I was very annoyed and will not be ordering from you again.

I tried to buy a deal for an adult scooter, I received an error message when I was making my payment but also received a confirmation from Paypal that the money was sent to Groupon. I called Groupon first to which an advisor informed me the payment was not successful and that Paypal had blocked the payment. I called Paypal who told me that the payment was successful and advised me to call back Groupon with the Invoice ID I was provided with. I called back Groupon and explained the situation to them, this time the advisor said that the order was successful. It all sounded a little fishy to me so I asked for my order to be cancelled to which the advisor said that is fine and that it would take 5-7 working days for my money to be refunded to me. I closed my account with them the following day or the day after as I kept receiving emails stating that my order was being dispatched and that is was on its way. I called Groupon to make sure they hadn't processed my order and explain how my money was supposed to be refunded to me. The advisor told me that you aren't supposed to close your account if you are being refunded and that they will now have to do what is called a manual refund (I take partial fault for this, but the advisor who I contacted to close my account did not tell me I had to wait for the refund before closing my account!). The advisor informed me I was going to have to wait a few days for them to come to a resolution, I completely understood and awaited to hear back from them. I have since received 2 emails from them, one asking me if the problem had been resolved yet (um, no... I'm waiting to hear back from you guys?) and the second email said the payment attempt did not go through for the deal and I should contact Paypal! So they have sent me back to square one as we have already established the money was taken from my account. I am now looking to take this further as none of them seem to know what they're doing or how to help me get my money refunded to me.

2 experiences with Paypal. Both bad. 1. Claimed replacement of part under warranty. Paypal initially said "no problem". I filled out the required online form. That's the last I heard. I didn't bother (I now wish I had) due to the small value item. 2. My Bank account was charged for a purchase I supposedly had made. I knew it wasn't my item because I had not made a purchase for many months (maybe year). I contacted Paypal immediately. Not even an acknowledgement of my message. Great service, I don't think . My account is now closed. I'll never use Paypal again. Nothing wrong with using Bank Account directly. Why involve Paypal?

I have never left a review before and so shocked by this company i had to leave a review. So i bought a relatively small item that is 12.75" round and 1.75" deep and weighs 2lbs. I sent this item as a test as i need a service like this going forward. They wanted nearly £200 to ship this item to the UK!!! One of the biggest services they pride themselves on is their repacking service. They have listed the box as 18x18x24. Which seems extremely oversized. So i contacted the manufacture and they gave me the dimensions of the product box of 18x18x4 which means it will fit in the box 6 times!! So the repackaging service they apparently offer does not exist or they got the dimensions completely wrong on the box. What it seems to me is, they dress it up, offer a nice site and then charge a fortune on shipping, it's ludicrous and possibly a scam. I am a decent and fair person and contacted support several times, first time Friday and after chasing i get a reply back today being Wednesday which might as well said unlucky the box is what it is, they took a long time to get back and the reply seemed a generic reply. If you use this service, be prepared to right off any goods you send to them as you might find the shipping costs way outweigh the goods you buy. I have bought much bigger and heavier items from USA that have cost me much less to post. Such potential, such a shame. I am disgusted and shocked. Suite no. 1898-4992 Please resolve asap!!

Snaptravel advertise different prices then the total cost of the booking as a way to offer a “better deal”, this is basically false advertisement; hidden fees can be a way for companies to trick consumers into paying excess fees on a product that was advertised at a specific price as a way to increase profits without raising the price of the actual item. This is in fact illegal and i am sure someone will take them to court sometime soon!

I placed my order a week ago after seeing great reviews of the Shapermint Highwasted Shaper Panty on Facebook.  I received my confirmation fairly quickly and a shipment confirmation within 24 hours. Coupon offers was enclosed inside. I took the Shaper out the package it was in and the material felt really thin. I tried it on, it did absolutely nothing as described it would do. Only thing it did do successfully was stay in one place, did not fold or roll down. Very disappointed, nothing about this product felt smooth or compressed. Im not too upset with cost because I just so happen to catch it when it was 50% off and I found a coupon code online, so with shipping I barely paid $17 all together. I would of definitely gave 5 stars had the panty did as it said it would, but again the material was very thin and made no difference to my figure.

We ordered the Canine Caviar buffalo bully sticks to hand out to people who adopt dogs from our organization. We sent back the order a second time and are really unhappy that you are still using the photo of the individually wrapped bully sticks in your ad.  We have 600 people in our organization who are now being told not to go to Petflow.

Paypal limited my account because a customer sent an envelope to Sudan. They gave no explanations and would not review the case. If you run a business, do not use this company. Read the other reviews as this is a common issue. Use sagepay/Worldpay etc etc, but not paypal.

As a longtime customer of Expedia (for several years I was a GOLD member), I was surprised to recently realize that the first time I needed their assistance I was not able to receive it. I used EXPEDIA's service to rent car on April 25th 2019 in Rome, Italy (Itinerary: 7427668957092). The rental company was Dollar (serviced in Rome by Hertz). All went well of my side – I returned the car with even more fuel than what was in the car when I took it. However, I soon discovered that the rental company has charged me 100.83 Euro because I "neglected" to fill the fuel tank. On May 8th I sent an email to Expedia with the relevant documents showing that the car was returned with even with more fuel than received (I received – 6/8 fuel tank, I returned 7/8). Meaning that the charges by Rental Company are wrongful. Since this email, Expedia has been dragging their feet in any possible way and finally on  May 31st I got an email explaining that Dollar "have denied your refund request" and that EXPEDIA " act only as an agent". I am now wondering why should I bother with EXPEDIA services if they are not able to protect and represent you? This is  a big disappointment for me since you expect the full protection in case you are being "rubbed" because of a transaction brokered by EXPEDIA.

I have been consistently disappointed with Vivint's customer service and products.   Yesterday I called with an issue and was promised an escalation and an email from the supervisor I spoke to.  When I called back today they had NO RECORD of my call.  This was the last straw with Vivint.  I can tolerate a lot, but not lies.  I have had issues with just about every component of my system.  I would never recommend Vivint to anyone. After seeing Vivint's response I am even more convinced that they do not understand the issue.  They simply send an automated response.  Just so disappointed with this company

I was sent to SkyLux Travel to buy business class tickets. They got me tickets for my journey and said they were not able to get me business class for one leg of trip. I paid the nearly $10,000 for two tickets. About two weeks before departure my traveling colleague asked me if my travel agent notified me the outgoing flight was changed and we would miss our connection. I said no and called SkyLux. They were so difficult to understand, English is not their primary language so I did a conference call with the airlines to help get my flight changed. The agent from United proceeded to tell us both the fare for the ticket I was sold was over $3,000 less expensive than what I paid and this was all business class and it was one week before departure. In other words, I did not get value, I got really over charged. I further found out they buy "bulk tickets" so these are not even the same type of tickets as if you went directly to the airline. I have asked them for an adjustment before taking further actions but I'm very unhappy with how I was treated.

Share my honest opinion, that'll be easy! I ordered a Christmas present on 12/14 and @ checkout I was guaranteed delivery by 12/21. I even jacked up shipping just in case. On 12/20 I emailed customer service (still never answered). 2 hours later I called to explained this gift was for my daughter and it was very important to her and therefore the upmost importance to me! I was told the gift was a little behind but it was going out. 12/21 still no email confirmation so I called again and again I was guaranteed delivery but probably on 12/24. I told the rep now how imported this gift was to my daughter and it really needed to arrive. At this point I offered to pay overnight @ my expense. I was told that was not necessary. Yep, 12/22, you guessed it, I just got the email stating the package would not arrive until after Christmas. Now, you will take this review and compare it to the others but just keep in mind that if a company can ignore this father's need to get his daughter a Christmas gift just image how they will treat you??  This is totally on them! They did not need to lie twice! There was time to refund and give me a fighting chance to not let my child down but that is NOT how they decided to handle me, my daughter, our order. How will they handle yours??  The email I received stating the order would not arrive before Christmas said it would arrive on 12/26, hmmm, i wonder if I should count on it?? I will keep Trustpilot posted. I just went through all the reviews for the last 48 hours and you guys really wrecked a ton of people's Christmas!! Please do not respond to my post saying you are sorry because your NOT!  Sorry for the long winded post BUT I have nothing better to do because my dinner PLANS with my WIFE fell through because she is out SHOPPING because you didn't SHIP our order

Be aware! Priceline will list a casino hotel and book you at a 1 star quality inn! After speaking with not one but two supervisors that showed no empathy or care of pricelines misleading  information, I am done with the company for good! Priceline makes me think of the old saying you get what you pay  for! I know feel that I would much rather pay full price than to rip myself out of a great trip and experience! I understand a great deal is tempting but please if you choose to book with priceline DO NOT BOOK WITHOUT CALLING AND RESEARCHING THE INFORMATION PRICELINE PROVIDED! You will be in for a BIG surprise if you do not. Call customer service and they will make you feel like the cheap person that got what they paid for! If you want upfront facts book through book it ,expedia , hotels.com ANY of the above and you will have better chances of getting something close to what you expect. Run run as fast as you can priceline line has a thin line between quality and cheap... I just wanted a deal.

I've used their service for many years and it's been useful.  However, any prospective customer should know that shipping is expensive and slow. They also have an incredibly strict set of generic rules covering what they will and won't do - and they won't consider individual cases.  They also seem to apply the rules arbitrarily.  A good example is a paperweight which was made in China and which I had shipped back to HK/China where I live.  This was done without any problem but the third time they refused to ship it to my address for a reason which made absolutely no sense. Another example is a shipment of four bottles, one of which was broken.  It is very complicated to get them to return the shipment to the sender and, as with anything else they do, they charge a high fee for doing this.  They would not destroy the broken bottle and send the other bottles to me on the basis that it would be too dangerous for their packers to do this.  It's not that hard to put on a pair of gloves, pick out the unbroken bottles and then destroy the remaining contents of the package. Again, they have a set of rules and they won't deviate from the rules, regardless of the circumstances.

Today there was an issue with my card on file (not sure what the issue was, the card had not expired or anything) and I updated my payment info asap with a different card because I did not want to miss the next  Freshly delivery (due next Wednesday, in 4 days). It does not seem fair that everything was okay yesterday and today there is no way to fix the issue. It's disappointing that Freshly can't charge my card again today (4 days before my delivery is due, and the same the issue with the old card was detected), reschedule the delivery so that I can still get food next week or at least offer a solution or credit to make up for this inconvenience. Other meal delivery companies are more flexible, faster to react, and provide a better customer experience. Until now, I was happy with my Freshly meals but I will rethink my subscription knowing that I could be left with no food and Freshly would do nothing about it.

Stockx is a load of crap. They claim their shoes are DS (Deadstock). Received a pair that I waited almost two weeks to get (their claim the seller has 48 hours to ship is a crock too, this seller took a week and a half to ship them out) and when I got them, they had toe creases on the right shoe. Now, owning multiple pairs of this same model, you can tell when they've been worn. I contacted Stockx and their response was the shoe passed their "authentication" process. Don't waste your time trying to contact them either, they give you these canned responses that make them sound like their customer service is in a 3rd world country. The only benefit of this website is that the prices are sometimes lower than you'd find on eBay but at this point, that's all they have. You'd be better off to use Flightclub or another reputable consignment store, at least you'll know you're getting true deadstock stuff. Trash company.

I shopped at Tobi for the first time after eying some clothes for a while. I bought 3 dresses in the same pattern and same size with different styles. Shipping said 3-5 days, and I knew that a few days would be needed to process, but the package didn't come in for almost 2 weeks. I was fine with that, as I don't need the dresses until New Year's Eve, but when they finally came in they fit horribly. One of them was so small I couldn't get it on, one barely fit and came to mid butt-cheek, and one was very tight in the hips and loose in the chest. I ordered a few new dresses and figured I'd return the others. 5 days ago, I placed the new order... However, it still says "processing" and hasn't even shipped. I gave myself well over a month to find a dress for New Year's Eve and it seems like I probably won't even have the second order in time. I'm annoyed with the lengthy shipping process (at least acknowledge a realistic timeline rather than saying 3-5 days) and the fit of the clothes (If I'm buying the size that I always wear, at least one of three should at least somewhat fit). I'm not sure if I'll shop at Tobi again, but I definitely will not if I have any sort of deadline within the next 2 months on when I'd like to wear the clothes.

When I initially enroll I sign up for the nllg program which will protect me in case of the galleries of being sued by credit card company later I received a letter from a law firm hard by Discover card to recover fun for me even though they were listed on my Freedom Debt Relief account I sent the letter to Freedom Debt Relief no one did anything 2 months later I will serve a civil summons for court when asked about the legal program to represent me within Freedom Debt Relief I was told I did not enroll when I have received numerous emails from the nllg legal program but yet they did not I was enrolled I will send several Power of Attorney documents to sign and these documents had account numbers that wasn't mine I tried for 2 months to get someone to respond to my question why are you sending me power of attorney documents to sign with a count numbers that weren't mine no one would answer me as soon as I stop my direct deposit withdrawal from my account then they call at what time I told them about the POA they did nothing I end up having to go to civil court without any then they agreed a settlement agreement with this Law Firm I never saw the settlement statement I never agreed to it they paid this Law Firm 600 some dollars of my money I still cannot get a copy of the legal settlement agreement they say outside three different scenarios one representative said I was sent the agreement via a chain email the next one said they sent me the email that if I click on any part of the email it would automatically signs agreement something that scammers do then another representative said they sign the agreement without my Authority or without my agreeing with it and that's something they could do I am Consulting a lawyer to sue them

Within 30 minutes of AT&T leaving the premise, our TrueStream installation (VDSL2) has been flapping off and on for hours at a time. We received our fish and 2 were dead on arrival, the other 3 were not doing well. The water out of the bags was very cold. We acclimated all 5 (per instructions) and put the 3 half dead in the tank and have not seen them for over 24 hours. We submitted the guarantee over 24 hours ago and have not heard back. We tried to call Saltwater Fish 2 times during business hours and no one will answer. We have never had a bad experience before and are very disappointed with this transaction.

My fiance and I booked flights in October 2014 from Sydney to Bali for our honeymoon which we are due to go on on the 16th of March. In January we received an email from Garuda Indonesia and then Bravofly to tell us that our flight had been changed from the 16th of March to the 17th of March. A full 24 hours later meaning we would loose out on an entire days holiday as well as the cost of our hotel for that night. Having spoken to both Garuda and Bravofly we established we were entitled to a FULL REFUND! We went ahead and requested this via Bravofly. We were then informed by Bravofly that a confirmation email would be sent to us once this request had been sent to Garuda. This email never arrived. Being concerned that we would not be able to book replacement flights without this refund I emailed the Bravofly customer service team for an update and was then informed that they could not guarantee when we would receive our refund, they would charge us $20 each handling fee for the privilege and could take up to 12 MONTHS!! to get our money back to us. I have contacted both Bravofly and Garuda several times since this. Neither Garuda or Bravofly can tell me 1. where our money is and 2. when our refund will be processed. Being that our honeymoon is now only 2 weeks away I have managed to find the money to book flights with another airline. However this has now prevented me from paying a supplier for our wedding. So I decided to call the Canberra Bravofly customer service centre today. Firstly, the person who answered the phone (i cannot give you their name as they didn't bother to provide it) answered the phone with "HELLO" no more and no less, I proceeded to explain the situation to him, he then huffed and puffed and then told me there was nothing i could do but maybe if i had asked for the voucher this wouldn't of happened. I was never informed that a voucher was an option and was certainly never advised that it would take up to 12 months to receive the refund. I cannot believe that neither Garuda or Bravofly are only able to advise me the refund is pending... The customer service I have received from Bravofly has been disgraceful. Poorly worded, formatted and 1 word sentence replies to emails and telephone calls with customer service reps who couldn't care less about their customers. I would never ever use bravo fly ever again.
I was excited to order from them, but it quickly turned to disappointment as their cartridges didn't work! I've tried everything, factory reset, cleaning, etc. I will have to return them

My first experience of Airbnb and I will not be going back. I created an account, made a booking and payment and was in touch with the vendor, only to have my account suspended 10 minutes later, citing that my payment method was invalid (which it was not). Absurdly the payment had been taken but refunded 24hrs later. I provided yet more personal information and a screenshot of a bank statement, as requested by Airbnb who had assured me they were trying to resolve the issue, only for them to keep my account suspended causing confusion and uncertainty for me and the vendor only 2 days before my trip. They did not have the decency to reply to my correspondence and I had to make alternative arrangements the day before. It felt like Airbnb had harvested my personal and payment information and then just dumped my custom. This made me start to think this was some sort of scam given that none of it seemed to make sense. They even had the audacity to email me a week later telling me my account had been reactivated and that I should try to make the reservation again! I have told them to delete my account. Let's hope they can get that right... Avoid!

I reserved to have Van pick up at 1pm, but my flight delay until 2pm. We didn't get to the Van Rental until 3pm.  But it literally took the staff there 45-60 mins to get my group a van!  How is that possible?  We had to be a rehearsal dinner at 6pm north of Los Angeles! we didn't' get our van until 4pm, so with LA traffic we didn't' get were we needed to be until 8:30pm!!! They claim they didn't have vans, that's not my fault, if I reserve a van it should be ready for me.  I would consider renting at other car rental places like enterprise etc bc checking in was fast with them.
my new IPhone blew up all day telling me my order was ready to be picked up AFTER I picked it up. I would think with all the profits made you could work on your technology.

I looked at the sizing carefully and even though I'm usually a medium I choose XL to make sure the shirts would fit. They are all too small and are 3 different sizes even though they all say XL. I will not be purchasing from Bookbyte again, as I ordered a math textbook for my 7th grader July 25th and today, August 12th, it is still not here. I want this text book sent NOW - overnight - at the seller's (and/or Bookbyte's) expense.

I purchased my 2011 Hyundai Sonata in August. The moment I drove off the lot the low tire pressure sensor came on. I took it a tire shop that stated that the sensor is going out in one of the tires and also they made me aware that the front passenger side undercarriage has been wrecked. Mind you I signed a letter with Drive Time stating the vehicle has never been in an accident. It makes sense though, my rack & pinion is going out and the vehicle is only at 78k miles. Makes me wonder if the front end was damaged. When I bought the vehicle it was sitting on the side of the building and now I wonder if it even was inspected properly because it was not detailed yet. Now I receive a letter from Hyundai advising me that the vehicle is on the recall list because of a major engine component going out while driving. I can't win from losing with this vehicle. So now i am left to pay a almost $500 car payment, $200 for insurance and also the cost of the rack & pinion which is around $800 or more. I am unhappy with the vehicle and the lack of support from Drive Time. This will be the last car I purchase from them. Buyers beware, don't put your all your trust into a buy here pay here.

I guess I am the first person to give 1 star.  My experience was horrible.  I set everything up.  Got confirmations that all was fine.  Then a week later, on a Monday, took out some of the money, I got a confirmation that it would be in my bank Tuesday, then Tuesday nothing showed up.  I  waited until Wednesday morning and still nothing, so I called and support sent me an email that I needed to send them a void check that the routing number was wrong (I'd like to know how everything was confirmed if this was the case?), so I emailed it.  Then Thursday nothing.  So I called and no one answered and left message and they finally called back 8p Eastern.  I had called again earlier and they wanted me to step through everything again, which made no sense.  No one seemed to know what was going on. As a business when you need to borrow from a line of credit this can't happen.  Luckily I had another Line of Credit (Bluevine) that sent me the money the next day (Friday).

So I rented a book from bookbyte. It took the book 14days to get to my home and rental date was counting down. Anyways, I went to school two weeks without book. Finally when the book came, the professor said he wont need the book. So I post the book through USPS. My tracking was not updated for 7days. So I am guessing the book was lost in transit. When I contact bookbyte about this, they told me that I have to pay the purchased price which is like $163 plus the rental price which was $57. Are these people kidding me? When I asked them if my $57 will be discounted from $163, they said NO. That its my fault. WHAT is wrong with these people?It was not my fault that the book was lost in transit. I believe I should get some type of discount for this because I don't even have the book, So why should I pay a total of $220. I find the buy it now price on Amazon for $90 and they are charging a ridiculous amount for these books. I would not recommend this website to anyone. They don't even have a PHONE NUMBER in which people can contact them about situation like this. You have to deal with people over the chat, which doesn't feel real. PLEASE EVERYONE......DO NOT RENT BOOKS HERE. HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!! THIS WILL BE MY FIRST AND LAST TIME RENTING BOOKS ON BOOKBYTE.

Don't get me wrong or discourage you from trying. Everyone's skin tone and type are different which is why this product works for some and not others. I am of mixed ethnicity and am considered to have an olive tone. I chose brown/black- which to me was on the lighter side but still meshed well with me. Kinda freaked out with the black since it may be too dark for me. I have oily skin, so I can take a kleenex and wipe off wunderbrow but not with my finger. So I saved $ not having to invest in the solvent to remove it. I have not experienced color transfer on my clothes or sheets but I could have wiped it away too with as many times as I wipe my face. It does last longer than an average pencil but I don't know if it's worth it for me to reorder when I'm done with mine.

The mobile app experience is rough - it's hard to tell whether you're actually signed in, the filtering/sort options don't seem to work very well, sometimes the delivery date doesn't apply and the item has to be deleted from the cart in order to set the correct delivery date, the coupon field does not give helpful error messaging. Other than that, the flower quality is usually very nice and the blooms last. The company is good about rectifying situations where the flowers die shortly after arrival. The selection and arrangements are lovely - though it would be nice to be able to choose a vase and apply it, rather than only being able to remove a pre-selected vase. So far, all of my deliveries have arrived bang on time, so despite a suboptimal mobile app experience, I keep using Bouqs. Having said that, if a competitor offered the same quality of inventory and speed of delivery with a better app, I would probably jump ship and start using them instead.

Let me start off by saying that I love this controller and think that it along with the service I received during the holiday season was wonderful. I won't be talking about their service, just the control today. The Good: - The control feel great! I have fallen in love with the pro grip and the Scuf grip handles and will be sure to put them on all new controllers I use in the future. - When using the trigger stops the power to alter them to the shortest pull needed from game to game is amazing.(with its downsides) They are very easy to install and remove with the tool they provide with the kit. - Lastly but not at all the least, it looks even better in person the website does not do their color choices any services. The Bad: (Not all bad just not my taste) - First off let me say that this isn't so much a bad thing or of a personal taste. Let's start with the trigger stop... I know I said they are great but the biggest issue I have is that you either have to have them on or off which at first probably sounds like I'm dumb right? I bought them so why not use them? Well, when you have them on the controller you can not adjust them to give you free control. You start only being able to press down half way and can only restrict yourself further from there. This alone isn't a big issue but when compared to the Elite sold by Microsoft I believe for a player that play any game where you use both guns and cars the Elite controller would be a better fit for you. - Next the paddles. The Axe paddles themselves are great and easy to use when you're only using the outside paddles that your finger more than likely rest on most of the time as for the inner paddles they can prove fairly difficult to hit for anyone that has shorter finger making them nearly useless if not harder to use. Now for the horrible... When I got my controller it was in perfect condition but after about a two days of use one of the inner paddles broke off. For a controller that I spent 180$ on the plastic used for the paddles is insanely cheap and when looking into found this is pretty common for people. - I love using this controller but I have one huge annoyance that keeps me from honestly enjoying it. The back button and no I don't mean the B button I mean the back button left of the select button can be very unresponsive. I've tested it and it does work but it has to be pressed down all the way sometimes while other only slightly. From what I can tell the button used in my controller is slightly smaller than the select button which means that I have to make sure to press it flat to the controller with each use. In the past, this wouldn't have bothered me but with the rise of my interest in games like PubG and Fornite where the map is commonly linked to that button, it can cause simple gameplay to require me to spam a button just to remove the map to let me see the player shooting at me. On the subject of the buttons, I'd also like you to be informed that due the alterations made to the design to allow you to change your joysticks the frame around the joystick is insanely close to the A button. For a player with larger thumbs be warned you may find it a slight annoyance. All around I'd have to say this controller is worth a good amount of money whether or not you believe it is worth the cost Scuf sells it for would most likely be linked to the amount you invest into gaming. Even with the issue I have had I do not regret my buy even though it didn't live up to the expectation I had and in addition has cause me to take an interest in purchasing an Elite controller to use in games where turning off the trigger stops on the fly would come in handy I still find that it's well worth the money I spent. Ratings: Paddles 2/5 Look 5/5 Feel/Grip 5/5 TriggerStops 3.5/5 Buttons 2/5 (not at all what I'd expect for the cost of a controller that they say in their process is tested)

I absolutely love being an Angel and receiving all the great wine that is available to the lucky few.  My gripe is the delivery.  It has been a week since I placed my order and I have not received my case of wine.  I waited home ALL day on Sat., July 11 for the FedEx delivery that was "in transit" all day!  After no delivery by 8:00 p.m., I figured that the wine was not going to be delivered.  I called FedEx and was told the delivery would not happen until the week of July 12; probably on Tuesday, July 14.  I just checked my email and, in fact, the wine is again "in transit" with delivery scheduled some time today.  The thought of waiting home for a delivery AGAIN is not something I'm looking forward to.  The only thing that makes the wait bearable is the delicious wine that we will enjoy.  If FedEx makes another "delivery exception" after waiting for this delivery, I might cancel my Naked Wines membership.  Not your fault, but the delivery methods used is sub par, and who can wait all day for a delivery that requires a signature.  Frustrating!!  Thanks for listening.

Teleflora has the most beautiful floral designs of any of the "top" brands for flower delivery (FTD, 1800flowers, etc). When I started using them (3-4 years ago), I was so happy with the service & quality, as compared to other brands--even if they were a bit pricey. However, my last 3-4 experiences have not been so good: late deliveries; dying/wilted flowers; not the promised container/design. My last delivery was for my mom. Flowers were beautiful & vibrant--but I ordered a particular arrangement for the beautiful mercury glass vase it advertised & I didn't get it. The vase it came with was a very basic plastic cylinder with "metal-like" plastic coating. It was downright ugly and detracted from the flowers. I know it says that they sometimes substitute, but I haven't gotten the promised container the last 4 times I've ordered. The worst part was that half of the flowers were dead the next day. That was an $80+ arrangement. I've also taken the time to write to Teleflora to tell them of my disappointment; I've never received a response. I'm taking a break from flowers for a while.

I’m pleased with my refrigerator but it took about 10 days longer to get it than we planned. The shipping company that was used here in Dallas, Texas was impossible to deal with. The female we talked with was unhelpful, rude, condescending, disrespectful and uncaring about our situation. She did not care that it was in Dallas sitting and waiting to be delivered as we had planned 9-10 days before. We had to wait until she said it was going to be delivered. We paid for a Gold Plan delivery that would put the refrigerator in the kitchen. I was told I could attach it to the wall. She said I would have to pay an extra  $100. dollars to have the the box removed, more to connect to water line, buy a water line if I didn’t have one. So it was over $200.00. This is a racket!!!  I said NO just deliver .   I called the day of delivery and she said it was scheduled between 9-1 and  I would be their last delivery.  So I was thinking of going ti the store, until I saw a truck. They were at my neighbors. Then they called and asked if I was at home and they had a delivery for my neighbors house. The girl running the delivery office had on purpose told me it was going to be around 1:00 pm until I received my delivery hoping I would leave and miss my delivery and have to reschedule. She told the delivery guys the wrong address my next door neighbors so I would not get my delivery.  I told the delivery guys the story and they were suppose to report her.  But he said I understand that you asked about us setting up and taking the box. I told him I did but this same girl told me you could not do it because you didn’t have any tools. He said he has tools and stated he could do the water line placement for 25.00 but would have to charge me &100.00 to take the box. I did it but I truly think all of these people are in on it. Its a scam and I got played. I feel stupid because I gave them each a tip for their help. The main guy had me write the check out to him and took both of the tips. He said he would split the check and the cash with the other guy. I doubt it! Lesson learned!!! Buy in town.

I booked the rental over the phone. The customer service rep was very helpful and courteous.  She advised that Avis and Alamo were the only car rental companies that had rental counters inside this particular airport. She informed me that the best deal was through Alamo so she booked it. When we received the e:mail confirmation it stated that it was booked with.  I thought that perhaps she mistakenly told me Alamo over the phone when it was actually Avis.  The problem arose when we got to the airport and found there were no car rental counters in the airport, that they are all in a remote location.  We got up to the Avis counter after waiting in line for about 40 minutes.  They informed us that they didn't have a reservation for us and the paperwork indicating the reservation number was not one of theirs, though it stated Avis in the text.  We told them of initially being informed it was being booked with Alamo so they suggested we go to their rental counter. So we dragged our luggage over to Alamo and, thank God, they did validate that our reservation was with them.  It was a very tiring and frustrating experience after having travelled all day to that point.  The Avis rep also advised us they had experienced problems with other customers who booked through CarRental8.

Buses were old and had seen better days. The tours largely depend on who your tour guide is. Our first tour guide was the highlight of the experience and there was a sharp decline after that. They were all very nice enough to inform you of where they are going and if it is consistent with your plan for the day. It's convenient because they do have a bus that literally goes to any tourist attraction in the city. However, we got stuck on one for much longer than we anticipated and we suffered, freezing cold for 1.5 hours while trying to get to the place we wanted to go. The only plus was that we saw a lot of places that we weren't planning to see. I'm not sure how it compares to other tour buses in NYC, but I'd much rather experience the city myself.

I am an at home kitchen small business.  Granola + caramels.    After careful thought, I placed an order for the zippered gusset pouches for my granola this year.   I was happy that they showed food items in the bags to help me.   I always weigh out my granola to be  8 to 10 oz.    These bags stated 8 - 10 oz with coffee beans.    As a home baker that sounded perfect to me.   Guess what - it makes a HUGE difference as to what you actually will be placing in these  bags. I didn't think that coffee beans vs granola was much of a difference.  Wrong! I could have fit 2 lbs of granola inside these zipper bags.  I was so excited to received them, yet I was so disappointed to fill them.  Pay close attention to sizes.  Call cs first to make sure you are purchasing the correct size.   I will use the 100 bags up before placing a correct order.   Next time!    Live + learn.  A happy customer otherwise.

I really want to like Park and Fly, the people and service there are fantastic.  But I can't get over the fees that are tacked on that most people probably don't pay attention to (and don't they know it...). Worst is the gas surcharge.  Somehow 2 years after the high gas prices went away and during a period of historically low gas prices they are still charging a gas surcharge.  It blows the mind and is inexcusable especially for a company that works so hard to project such a great image. Then you have the Access Fee.  Why is this a separate fee instead of a cost of doing business built into the prices?  It is like Amazon charging you an extra 10% for warehousing the stuff before they ship it. Finally the $4 processing fee, which is the fee for the national company to place my reservation on the website.  Because somehow processing my reservation is not a normal part of the business???  This is like Amazon charging me to take my order... The $18+ combination of the three, especially the gas surcharge, is beyond sketchy and makes a mockery of their posted prices.  I will just park in the garage now.

Order #16162516 Product description: Hole's Human Anatomy and Physiology Practice with Connect Plus/LearnSmart 2 Semester Access/APR Online/PhILS Online I purchased this book used online. I have had a very good experience selling books to this company except for one issue: when you put in the name of a book, or even the ISBN, several options come back, which makes it very confusing. I had a book that showed me an option with the exact same picture as my book and offered a decent price for it, so I sent it. They didn't pay me for it because my book didn't have an ISBN (older edition, I guess), but looked just like the picture. When I asked what happened to the book, they said they could not return it and referred me to their Terms & Conditions. Well, really, does anybody read all that? I just wish they had made it clear that, even if a book looks identical, they can't buy it back without an ISBN. I would have never sent that book if it had been made clear. Now I don't have the book, which was in perfect condition, or the money. This makes me sad. But everything else has worked out well.

The customer service I received from Olivia was outstanding.  I've worked with her for two years on our Service Awards Program. Two of the three needed to be reordered -- one had bubbles in it and the other had a large white speck in the crystal and it was not a scratch.  It also had some bubbles.  For the two years I've ordered the awards, the presentation boxes they came in were so obviously damaged yet the packaging box was not.  Last year I had to have boxes sent several times.  This year two of the three were severely damaged and should have never made it out of there.  I see from reviews that others also experienced this.  I'm waiting for the new crystals and boxes.  Olivia is wonderful to work with.  Quality Control should have a closer look by management.

If given the option, I would probably score my trip 2.5.  We were the first pick up stop that morning (May 29), so sitting through all the other stops was no fun (although I didn't deduct for that).  The morning seemed very scattered.  We drove around for an hour (including going back to the office to pick up audios) before we even started the trip to Yosemite.    To be honest, I though he was a little rude to a couple of the other passengers. The bus itself was terrible.  I'm not sure it had shocks at all (and I'm not even a comfortable ride snob), extremely bumpy. Yosemite itself, was of course, gorgeous, which earned probably 2 of the stars. I thought the driver drove too fast down the curvy, mountainous road on the way back and followed cars too closely from behind.  I know that he's probably very familiar with the road, but they way the drove those curves on a bus made me very nervous. The speaker was SO loud, and on the way back, he played music, which was even louder.  Everyone was tired after a long day, soft music, or even silence would have been preferred.  Needless so say, I was extremely glad to get back to San Fran. We took a city tour (with a different company) earlier that week that was wonderful, unfortunately, this one just didn't live up.

I am finding order processing and shippng is taking much longer with all orders then previously. Processing used to be 1 day now often 3 days and delivery in Ohio used to be UPS next day. Now packages are sent to Fedex delivers to Smart post in 1 day but USPS smart post takes another minimum 4 days to receive order. Fedex is efficient but USPS smart post is not efficient, typically bounces packages to multiple points before delivery.1 star shipping and processing and 5 star for everything else so, 3 star average.

After a long wait and couple of weeks talking to the support I received my skins. Their withdraw system is still a bit buggy because I had to press the claim button a couple of times before the skin arrived via a trade on steam. So if you get an error about bot1 just go back to your inventory on skinhub and try again. As for skinhub as a gambling site : The site looks good and with the now more or less working withdraw system it's promising. BUT the cases are still VERY UNBALANCED which means that you most likely make a huge loss. Don't get me wrong : This is gambling and you'll loose and win sometimes but on this site you really get hit hard if you don't win. Some cases cost around 50€ and you have a 50% or more chance to get a 4€ skin Imao. Just not worth it.

Went into Mavis because my tire was starting to deflate. I was told I needed a new valve & 2 new sensors for the tires.  Was told to ride around for 20 minutes so the sensors would recalibrate.  They never did. I went back & was told they were too busy & come back another day.  A few days later, I had to call AAA  because that same tire was flat. I went back to Mavis and they said there was nothing wrong with my tire, but I needed new sensors. After waiting, several hours, they said I had to go to another Mavis to recalibrate the sensors. I got into my car only to see my spare thrown in the back of my car.  When they put the donut under the car, they tossed the box of CDs I had in the front to the back of my car. When I got in the car, all of my stuff was all over the floor. Very unprofessional.

After placing my reviews, the company immediately contacted me. The representative investigated and a refund was issued for the second tub.  I was told a refund has been processed for the first as well. Shady, shady company. Do not use!! Back in Dec I ordered a tub from efaucets. Unfortunately it came via UPS (which they swear they never do but my driver delivered it) damaged but unfortunately my contractor didn't report it until the 33rd day after delivery. As it could no longer be returned another tub was purchased from efaucets. Unfortunately that tub too came damaged. This time I contacted the company THAT DAY for a refund. After an exchange of emails and pictures they told me my refund would be processed. Almost two months went by and I inquired about the refund. I was told I now had to fill out a form. I sent in the form. Hear nothing and inquired again. I received this response: I am so sorry for the delay. There must have been a mix up in communications. We had not put a refund in process at this point. We have exceeded the eFaucet 30day return allowance. The good news is that Kohler is awesome to work with & will still credit you for the damaged tub. The thing is... Kohler asks that you, the customer, to contact them directly for an Authorization of Credit letter. Kohler is super easy to work with & can usually email the letter to you. You can reach Kohler at 1-800-456-4537. Once we have received this letter, we can process the credit back to you. Please feel free to call eFaucets if you have any questions. In case this email does not fully answer your question, or you would like to contact us for any reason, simply reply to this email. You can also get immediate assistance during our normal business hours via our Live Chat support service by clicking the link below: Here's my response: No there was no miscommunication and no we did not exceed the 30 days because I notified you THE DAY it was delivered. I did my due diligence, your company did not. I was told that as soon as picture were received (which they were sent the next day) the refund would be processed. Then OVER 30 DAYS later - only after I inquired about the refund YOUR COMPANY sent me a form!!! YOUR COMPANY SURPASSED THE 30 DAYS PURPOSELY IN ORDER TO PASS THE BUCK TO KOHLER. I have sent you 14 pages of emails showing the communication exchange that took place between myself and your company, beginning the day the tub was delivered. I will be contacting KOHLER, and posing the exchange and your acceptance and then denial of my refund all over social media as well. It appears that unfortunately ligation will unfortunately be my next step.

As many others I made a reservation and when I got to the hotel the reservation didn't exist. I called them and was told that my reservation would be canceled and would get refunded. It's been 12 days and I haven't received my money back. Aside from the stress of getting to the hotel at night exhausted and being told that there is no room for you, I still have to deal the financial burden of, it seems like, loosing 300$. UPDATE: I got the full refund from GalaHotels so I am updating my review. I gave three stars because even though I received the money back (took ~15 days) I had to call there twice and thus it was stressful experience.

I placed my first order using 499ink for 2 of each color except black ordered 3.   What I received in my package was 2 of each, which I assume 499ink sees as a complete order.   No packing list enclosed and no mention of a backorder or shipping separately on the 3rd black.  Had to call customer service letting them know I was shorted 1 black and was offered that on my next order could they just enclosed the 1 black they owe me.  Other than this, ordering online was simple, user-friendly and I received notice that it shipped out the same day.

I'd give them a higher rating because the end product turned out great but the artwork service is terrible.  After submitting my artwork I was emailed and told it was the wrong size and to call artwork customer service. I called multiple times with no answer at all, not even voice mail. I was beginning to wonder if it was a legit business. After my 5th try, someone answered. The artwork submitted was the correct size, they were just trying to crop off all the white space I had. So after submitting the exact same artwork two more times, they finally figured it out after I had to explain to them what they were doing wrong. They need to upgrade their software and get people in there that know what they are doing.
The website could be much better organized and the 15% off pops up every couple of seconds which is very annoying.

I had two different experiences on my trip to and from DC to NYC.  On the way there, the driver took us on a very strange route.  Maybe it was to avoid traffic but it still seemed too long.  Also, the driver pulled the bus over at the Woodrow Wilson Travel Plaza to wait about 20 minutes for someone who had missed the bus at the scheduled stop in NJ.  On the way back, I called to see if the bus was leaving right on time because I was barely going to make the scheduled departure.  While the phone rep could not help with asking the bus to wait, he did call to check on me and confirm that I had made it.  That's excellent customer service.  I am going to assume the ride there was unusual and would use them again.  Ride there 2 stars.  Ride back 4 stars.

We had to wait until the office opened at 930 because we couldn't get into to the climate controlled unit because we weren't given the door code. Very frustrating and unprofessional to not at least have a number we could call after hours. Just horrible!

The process started great no problems. Then when it was time to automatic withdraw the payment is when the nighmare started.  They didn't send up the correct ARC paper to start with which resulted in us being behind. From day one. ok got the paper withdraws are great for a few days. Then they start hitting us $10.00 here then $25.00 there for the missed payments from them not getting us the correct ARC papers. Next we get emails stating they couldn't auto draft again and another $35.00 extra. They kept posting our we had insuffient funds for the withdraw. Which is not true. We keep 3 weeks of payments in that account just for them so this doesn't happen. We have to call daily. They say oh yes we got it fixed. OH yes it's all good. Not it's not we still get charged the extra $35.00 for no reason. Now if we were at fault I have not problem with the extra fees but not like this. For a lending rate of over 18% for a loan and to be $35.00 every day that loan is really starting to not be worth it. I know should have went with another  lender. Only advice here is to make sure all the papers are in line and check around for the interest rate.

Contrary to other reviewers I was quite disappointed about the NY pass. At most attractions you need to get in a line to exchange for a ticket and then enter the line for the attraction, which were extremely long maybe due to the Christmas holidays. Why cannot the pass serve as your entrance ticket like for the ESB? Fast lanes were not there or only when getting near to the ticket counter. Visiting an attraction at the end of the day makes that the day counts for a whole day. So in the end we did not manage to visit sufficient attractions to balance the price we paid for the NY pass. I cannot recommend the NY pass.

I am frustrated that I have to spend my only day off for 6 days at a mechanic and the warranty people said they may not even cover it.  If that happens that car is getting returned. My overall experience with western union has been good, but I am going with an average rating as I am starting to feel a lot of inconvenience lately while using western union as a money sending service. I have been asked to submit a lot of identification documents every time I am trying to send money someone. The entire process is taking about two to three days before my money is released. I moved from Xoom to WU because of no fees policy that WU has at that time compared to high service fee of Xoom. This has changed recently at WU and I am being charged from $2.99 and more just as I was being charged at Xoom depending on the amount I am sending. These are some of the reasons for 3 start rating and this is causing me to look at other services who are transferring money at a very less or no fees. As soon as I find a good service I will no longer be using WU. Thanks for giving me the opportunity to sharing my thought.

"PetFlow sends out email ads: "15% Off Site-Wide!" You go through the trouble of putting together a big pet food order, and belatedly realize that the squiggle that appeared to be part of the cute illustration was actually an impressionistic rendering of an asterisk leading to a very, very small print footnote explaining that "Site-Wide!" does not include PetFlow's main product: pet food. I wrote to PetFlow complaining that this was misleading advertising. They gave me a $5 courtesy credit and their next email ad had the same darned hoax. "$15% Off Site-Wide!"
Rolling the dice to see if the price is to good to be true.  Will update rating once delivery has occurred.

The part arrived in good condition and is now on the car.  The wrong part was returned and I have been credited.  There was over a week delay that should not have happened.

I ordered my stuff on a Thursday at  3:45 pm, got my stuff the following Monday at around 3 pm. Their website shows a map of the US and I fell into the area with an estimated delivery length of 1 to 2 business days.. So that wasn't real bad. The stupid thing about them, is that they do not do returns. Even if the product is unopened and has not been used. The only time that they will do a "return", is if you have a product that is defective or broken, and even then- it's just an exchange for the same product, and you have to let them know that you have a broken or defective item within 72 hours of receiving your order. Then after that, you have to get the item BACK TO THEM within 7 days. So if you live far away from where they are located, you're probably out of luck no matter what.. They tell you that when you get your package, to immediately open everything up and try everything to make sure that everything is intact and that it all works..There are definitely other sites that will accept returns, as long as the item has not been used and is unopened.. That's pretty much the only thing that I can complain about... I wanted to return a sub-ohm tank, but then found out that I couldn't, once I read some of their policies...

Had problem with booking first reservation through third party (carrentals.com). Required a refund and rebook new reservation (instead of simple change of date). Took 6 weeks to get physical check for refund. Required multiple hours on the phone talking to people both locally and in national office. Sent over 10 emails. I ordered the Fast 5+ program and four weeks of program food.   When I received the shipment, I looked through the written materials before starting the program.  Unless I overlooked it, nothing was said about not exercising during the first week when I was on the Fast 5+ program.   I followed the Fast 5+ plan exactly, without cheating, and also added more activity than I had previously been doing.   At the end of seven days, I had not lost any weight.   I called a Nutrisystem counselor and he told me that I had not lost any weight because I had exercised.   That seemed counterintuitive to me because everything I had ever read about losing weight said it was dependent on "diet AND exercise."    I have now completed 2 weeks of the program and I have lost weight (about 6 pounds), so I am happy.   I will stick with the program because I lost 40 pounds on it thirty years ago and I know it works.   But it would have been nice to have lost the "guaranteed" 5 pounds the first week.

I checked my seat assignments yesterday, a week before I'm leaving for Australia and for the two long legs to/from LAX, showed my seats were not assigned.  I need to know why.  They we were back in February.  Also, I am an all-inclusive person and have worked with overseas outsourcing operations, but SkyLux needs to have either more clear English speaking customer service personnel or pass customers back to the states when there is a critical issue like I had with the seat assignments.  I would by happy to discuss the reason for the seat assignment issue with someone from SkyLux.  I still do not understand what happened.  Thanks.

The driver on the way to the airport was very friendly and funny.  When we returned from our trip about 12:30pm, we called to get the shuttle and asked where to meet and received a sarcastic response of "Did you get a card from the driver that dropped you off, the information is on the back of that card."  Rude.  It then took about 35 minutes for the shuttle to pick us up.  When we arrived at the park and ride, our vehicle was waiting but then we sat at the gate for the employee to get off of the phone and open the gate so we could leave.
It took way more time than expected.

I usually enjoy Groupon and have tried out buying through Groupon Goods recently. I purchased a two St. Patrick's Day shirts and another item making the total eligible for free shipping. Great! When I received the items one of the shirts was defective so I returned it for a refund. And that process was very simple and easy. I then went to re-purchase the shirt and saw that shipping was being applied. I used the talk with an customer service agent now on the computer and explained that I don't feel I should have to pay shipping since I was sent a defective item and am only re-ordering since I was sent a bad product. The customer service only quoted policy that free shipping is only allow after a certain dollar amount has been reached. I explained that this is a special situation and that it was Groupon's fault not mine that I was sent a defective shirt. I understand policies but I also understand loyalty and it Groupon wants to keep customers loyal they need to take care of them. In the end, I ended up purchasing extra items that I did not want to make the total over the amount so free shipping would apply. All they had to do was take off the $3.99 shipping and they could have kept a customer. I do not plan on using Groupon Goods again.

I was totally disappointed in the shipping process. You schedule it out in ADVANCE with plenty of TIME and it doesn’t arrive until over the weekend of the week you pick. When you ship to a business you have to go to post office to pick it up and it has set there All Weekend!  Terrible! Businesses should have their product delivered early in the week - you need to rethink your process for shipping. And we have to pay for shipping - to not only sit in the post office all weekend but have to go pick the stuff up.

The experience went Okay.  Post people will only deal with the company once or very infrequently so every customer is going to be a new user.  A couple points worth mentioning.  Its cool for the price you're offering to go up to incentivize a potential customer, but having it go down after they engage with you leaves a bad taste in their mouth.  I clicked on the e-mail that offered $680, and by the time it was all said and done with the web site the offer was $595.  Site insisted I had a Matrix XR based on the VIN but I know the car has always been the base vehicle.  Site seemed to use the claim that it was the higher XR trim level to justify reducing the offer?!?!? Second thing is don't surprise your customers with a stack of blank DMV forms that you expect them to just sign.  You should never sign something you haven't read and understand and your tow operator doesn't want to sit around while I educate myself from the DMV web site.  People are naturally cautious when they've never done business with your company, and this almost blew the deal.  Any forms you want people to sign should be briefed ahead of time to the customer and the form should arrive filled in, not blank.  One of the forms for example was an application for a duplicate title, which made no sense because I had the title in hand. Third point, you said the tow would arrive between 11am and 2pm but the guy showed up at 10am.  I had to interrupt another activity to drive home to meet the tow because he came at the wrong time. Last point, let people know in advance about the security features of the checks they will be receiving from you tow operator.  Most people have never seen anything like this before.

There are positives with how quickly the order was done and shipped out. I’d say that is the best part of the experience. However, the quality of the print and execution is where I’d say there is room for improvement. The shirt itself is marked by the press. Like when you hold an iron down too long on a dark shirt. The color of the print isn’t quite accurate to the color I provided which ultimately dialed down the vibrancy of the original color of my design. My last concern is longevity. The transfer or ink on the shirt doesn’t look like it’ll really hold up for that long. Perhaps, some of the fault is on my side. Not specifying a Pantone color and proper file like a vector Ai or EPS, might’ve helped with color accuracy. Also, maybe a phone call to discuss the printing method as well as provide an example of the quality of shirt and print style I’d like would have help hit the target expectation. All that said, it is great for a test run on an original design. The price point is nice and they rocked the shipping. I would definitely like to come back for more. However, I’d like to personally work with someone to achieve commercial quality next time.

There are some interesting products here.  But the fact that there is no review of the products, all (or most) sales final, very little information on warranties (especially for high end watches), very little in ease for customer feedback to Touch of Modern, very little feedback to the customer in the process of waiting for a product, and no ability for customers to give feedback on a product (I realize the sales are temporary and no shipments go out until the sale is over, which is sketchy in and of itself) and very little or no information on who is actually fulfilling the product...just a lot of sketchiness that makes it hard to trust a purchase and I feel there seems to be no information on what happens if a product is faulty.  For instance watch sales say all sales final, no refunds, no warranty info.  I did see some watches claiming a manufacturers warranty, but no info on who the seller is and if they are an authorized seller for that brand (and if not, the warranty is void, that's how it is in the watch business).  I just feel like there is no consumer protection here.

The biggest problem I have with the system is the carbon filter.  Whenever I have to turn off the water to the house for repairs the carbon comes through the system and clogs the filters in the reverse osmosis system when it is repressurized. I travelled from Riverside Station in Newton, MA to NYC on February 25 @ 8:30 AM and returned on Feb. 26 at 1PM. Everything about the GoBus experience was excellent with only one major problem. I had hoped to do some work and reading while on the bus but finally gave up. I expected a much smoother ride even though the roads no doubt had some frost heaves. I didn't expect that there would be so much rattling and bumpiness but there was. I'm not sure I'll use GoBus again because of these problems.

We purchased a Rear Axle assembly so we could get our truck back on the road. Found the part, ordered, paid and within 10 days we received said part. Too bad it was horribly damaged somewhere from point A to point B. The upside was we took photos as it was coming off the truck; complained to the driver; made immediate report to shipping outfit, BUT due to the holiday could not contact Automix. Sent off pictures after holiday and with no issues at all, they reimbursed us. There was no arguing or fighting necessary. I would not redo this buying through the Midwest (where part came from) BUT I will say as of now we had issues with Automix.....

I found the products to be of good->average quality.  However, I found the coupon system to be not easy to use.  Even though they have coupons for free shipping you have to choose the shipping option before you could enter coupons, and they would not affect the shipping price.  I chose to buy a few things and pay the shipping rather than try to spend more and get the coupon to work.  Also, their customer service is ONLY available M-F from 9-5. At first it seems there is a lot of information and that's a good thing. After seeing almost all videos, lectures, movies, different doctors  it gets very confusing.  There is a differing  opinion on practically every subject. Fasting vs fasting causes stress in women which can cause weight gain. Protein consumption I'd debated. Eat cream and cheese but some say eliminate.  Eat nuts but don't eat nuts. Calories don't matter but some of the videos say they do.

I picked through their catalog and found 55 records I wanted (45s) and only 14 of them were actually available, the other 41 went to a "save for later" section in the shopping cart. It took 9 days for delivery and 2 of the 14 skipped so bad that they are trash. The prices are absolutely fair, but it is not cool to see a record you really want for a fair price only to see it is currently not available. Kind of like finding your favorite record in the bargain bin and then somebody snatches it out of your hand.

I pre-purchased a parking spot for a Sunday afternoon and was very pleased with the rate ($4) and how easy it was to use the website. I didn't have a printout of my barcode to leave on my dash, I only had the screen shot, so I had to purchase another parking spot (which was an additional $10) so I had something to leave on my dash so I wouldn't be towed.
