I like shopping with your company but you need to make more XLs in your clothing selections. They go faster than any other size. After awhile it becomes frustrating because you have to hurry up and pay for your items the same day when you put them in your bag because tomorrow it might sell out. If your a size small to large you do have to worry because it’s always available. I think you should start making people that wear a XL feel more secure knowing their size will always be available too. Everybody is not a size 2-10. Size 13/ XL is very popular also. But it seems like that size is overlooked because a lot of items are SOLD OUT in less than 24hours. I get emails about new items & try to order it just to find out XL is crossed out. It seem like they have a PRE-ORDER website I don’t know about.

In general VV is great, but... Less stars because - charting could be improved, now many free comprehensive charting apps available - cost of add-on components and training... Lately VV has become a sales operation more and more... In total cost of using VV has increased as my skill levels have increased eg I would use more "tools"  in my investing/trading - past a couple years renewal process lacking and I have got a bit indifferent treatment... There is a currency convertor at the top of the screen, wish I'd seen it sooner.

For the most part my experience with Tilebar's staff was good. They were friendly and helpful from the point of shipping samples and up to placing an order. However communication has potential to be exhausting if a problem arises.  I absolutely love the 4x8 Calacatta Polished Marble tile I ordered. I ordered 150 tiles; it was a small order,17 tiles were defective and poorly packaged in their original carton. I received two plus units of damaged or poorly polished tiles, and TileBar Reps requested I take photos proving their condition. I was annoyed, some of the imperfections were not easily detected with a basic camera and I'm not a photographer. The Marble tiles were not separated one from the other, some had internal cracks and/or divots front and center. Replace them, don't put the customer through the 5th degree. After a couple of emails and several calls, each time reaching a different Rep, I found myself having to reiterate my concern over and over again. They finally figured out I wasn't requesting to return the entire order, which they were informed of during my second call to them. In that call, I requested only for the defective tiles to be replaced. After several calls one Rep figured out I just wanted the defective tiles replaced; eventually they made good on the order, and replaced the bad tiles. I would have given them 5 stars, however having to constantly reiterate yourself can be exhausting; they finally got it, my concern was fully addressed and resolved.
Shipping sucks...why offer 3 day shipping for an additional price then it still takes wks to recieve?

I find customer service with the Bouqs to be frustrating. Discounts can only be applied to very specific bouquets, but the error code when you try to apply it doesn't explain that. Delivery isn't available on certain days of the week, and it always ends up costing way more than expected. Relatedly, searching for flowers is frustrating, too. Why isn't there a feature to search by delivery date available? Since there are limitations on many bouquets (ex., the earliest this/that one is available is two weeks away), this would make sense to me. I once had a credit for a damaged item, but I wasn't able to combine my credit with a special that was running at the time. Why? I don't know. I continue to use them, but these things definitely bum me out.

We stayed at Cape Cod Cottages(#7) in Waldport, OR.  The cottages were once in good working order.  Some great upgrades, some serious safety risks.  The couch/hide a bed was so worn out you could feel the mattress springs as well as the bars underneath. It was completely unusable. The balcony wall almost blew off in the wind, the adirondack chair on the balcony was busted and had been "repaired" several times.  Fell apart when I sat down.  Screen door on balcony was completely ripped out. We enjoyed the quietness and the view.  Sweet little spot otherwise.  Hoping they do some safety upgrades so we can go back.  The check in info was complete and thorough.  Very helpful guide.

My wife booked a ticket with Quatar through Vayama. We need to change her ticket to another date, and previously information was given that this comes to xxx amount. $100 penalty from Vayama itself is a rip-off, but anyways, they are upfront about that. Now, for some reason they cannot make the change. the customer care is so incompetent that after speaking to 2 different individuals, none has been able to explain me why I cannot change the ticket to another date. Their employees' English was very poor and hardly intelligible, the background is very noisy,  and they seem to have no interest to be kind or even attempt to explain me the situation. The second person just hung up on me. I will not book again with this company. Seems there is hardly any training or monitoring of customer care staff! Very Indian (I love India, but not that part of it), but come on guys, you are an international company, get with it. The two stars is because Vayama does have good prices once in a while. But if you need to make a change, seems you are pretty much screwed. Update - after receiving a satisfactory reply below, I have upgraded my review to 3 stars.

I booked my trip with Property ID #99971 almost a year ago and had Hans Kraeger randomly cancel my family's trip without explanation on 1/27. I proceeded to inquire as to why they following day because he gave no explanation. He said, again, 11 months after I booked, that his policy was to book Saturday to Saturday. I told him "HomeAway's site allowed me to book the trip and this error is of no fault of my own. I think it would have been courteous, at the very least, to email me prior to just cancelling my family's trip. Perhaps ask if I could change my dates to a Saturday/Saturday or work with me in some fashion. I am also a HomeAway owner and would never cancel one of my guests' vacations without discussing it." I had to scramble to book another trip, and had to pay more money for lesser value of a property bc there are less options now, 11 months later, as it's much closer to the date our scheduled trip. Refund was processed, but it took 8 days for the money to return to my credit card and I had to pay out of pocket for my 2nd trip with a different VRBO owner as I waited for the money to return to my account. I contacted CS and they "escalated" the situation and said I would get an email. I got an email the following day basically stating me and the home owner needed to sort it out. Bottom line is I just don't appreciate that a trip I paid for and counted on that reservation can be cancelled on a whim and no one is accountable for it. If this happened with my Homeaway Property I would have left the reservation be, despite a "Saturday/Saturday" policy because that's just the right thing to do for your vacationers.

I tried this for the first time and got a discounted rate. I enjoyed the meals once prepared but it stops there. To begin with the website told me there was an error on the page when I went to make my selections and I had to contact customer support through chat. It was clear they were chatting with several other people simultaneously because the short conversation took longer than necessary. I just wanted to know how to choose my meals. The recipes are really written for an expert because I was supposed to prepare and cook a couple of things while something else was either cooking or preparing. Some of the steps were a bit vague. The recipe list is frustrating when it lists an item and says 1 or 2 (1 or 2 what? oz. grams. tsp. tbsp?) You have to read through the recipe to figure it out. Plus a few ingredients are sometimes not included. And the most important for me was I couldn't find anything on the site that let me simply pick healthy meals based on my macros. I had to guesstimate ingredient by ingredient to know how much carbs, fat and protein I was getting in each meal. The nutrition card provided was a bit off after I calculated everything ingredient by ingredient. I would recommend this to someone who just wants a meal kit and end up with a tasty meal. But if you want to track your macros or if you want a simple step by step that takes a minimal amount of time to understand and prepare this is not for you.

I give an average rating because... Speed is relative.  It is good most of the time, but cannot always be counted on.  I have not run out of data, but videos buffer.  I don't have other devices connected, but uploading a photo or a document takes several minutes.  This doesn't always happen, but it does happen. Customer service.  Look, I understand that companies can have customer service call centers in other countries, and that it is cheaper.  I also understand that the people in those call centers have been trained to say certain things, but that is not good enough.  Customer service should be about the customer, not about your cost.  These people need to be trained better so that they understand the difference between "Why is this happening?" and "What is happening."  This problem has also happened with people in call centers in the US for other companies, so I am talking about TRAINING here.  Not getting into a debate about whether we should keep those jobs in this country... that is a whole other topic. There is more, but I will stop there.  Hughes Net is the best I have found for now, but it is not perfect.  Thank you for being interested.

I have been a longtime Tobi customer and love the clothes on the site. Back during the holidays I experienced some issues with processing and shipping times but it seems that those are starting to get handled better again. My issues lies with the "sizing chart/guide" on the site... a few years ago I was a regular online shopper & a tiny size zero and had no issues ordering smalls. Now, I am a size 4. The site lists sizes 2-4 as a small. I order smalls and they're just small enough that I can't seem to get them zipped or buttoned all the way. I go up to a medium (Tobi lists as sizes 6-8)... WAY too big. I understand that you cannot help how clothes fit, however, you should at least be honest in your sizing charts to more accurately fit the everyday customer - not everyone is a wispy size zero like your models & it sucks having to send things back.

I rented a BMW 4 series from Turo and the service went mostly great. First, I found a 4 series that I wanted and the owner emailed me immediately telling me it wasn't actually available when I wanted it. Seems odd that their system wouldn't automatically know that to begin with. She then tried to get me to rent one of her other cars but I wasn't interested in them. But to get to the point of talking to her I had to "reserve" and put my credit card in. They really should not list cars that aren't available on the dates you choose. Then I found another that said it had free delivery. So I was stoked. Then I talked to the guy and he said he couldn't actually deliver it. It was the only other 4 series I could find with my specifications so I agreed to it anyway. I don't understand how you can list that but then not provide it. When I got to the Turo lot to pick up the car by LAX, the night shift guy looked incredibly bored and didn't say much the whole time while he was doing whatever he was doing on his phone to sign me in. The car itself was great and I think the price was reasonable. They just need to work out these kinks.

Many people use music streaming apps like spotify as their source of music so blocking both that and video services leaves people with very little use for wifi at all.

As far as an option to cut the cable cord, sling is good, it's just not great. For $20 a month I don't feel like I am getting anything better than the $8 a month Hulu selection. I then had to talk to customer service and the person I spoke with did not really understand what I was even talking about. It was incredibly frustrating. Amazon has great prices and they ship fast, but they are a massive company that just doesn't get it right all of the time.

I bough saddlebags custom fit for Suzuki C50, but non of the existing hole match with the motorcycle. I figured out how to mark down and drill each hole. The lock doesn't lock the bag, it's just to show that iris lock, but without too much enforce you can open the bag, even when it is lock.

Mobiloans has a very rapid process of approval, which is great. The only thing that concerns me is the hidden fees. Upon approval, there was no indication of exactly what I would be paying over the course of the loan. Also, if I am being asked my pay periods, which is monthly, I would expect to know that I am being set up for bi monthly payments prior to accepting the loan. Granted it is stated in the FAQs, however, but I didn't find those until after the fact. Even the customer service reps seemed a little hesitant about offering information about the interest and pay arrangements. As if they had heard it all before.  Maybe a a bit more of an upfront approach would make this experience better. I am going forward with this loan and hoping for the best. Other than that, the website is nice, customer service is nice, and I received my loan in a timely fashion.

I had no issue with the ordering or order fulfillment.  When I tried to return items there were waits of a week or more in between communications and the process was difficult to understand. It was easy enough to go through the process of getting books printed, but the PDF I submitted (which had been properly formatted using InDesign) was reformatted in their system with completely screwed up page numbers. I also used their template to calculate the cover size of my book, and yet the cover came out screwed up as well (the width of the book's spine had been calculated incorrectly - even though I downloaded and used the template they provided). Would I recommend the service to first-time authors? The price is right, but then again I was forced to order and pay for screwed-up books and nothing was done on their part to rectify that mistake.

We had a couple of minor issues this time around. In addition, there was a miscommunication about our parking validation policy.  This policy has changed this year and we no longer validate tickets, which I communicated to our event planner.  Unfortunately this information did not reach the therapists, and they were a bit taken aback after learning that they were responsible for covering the parking costs. I needed a rental car at the last minute - and attempted to make a reservation using the Enterprise App - but, was unable to do so and instead called the rental location. My rental process was fine.....until my vehicle arrived (driven by someone else) and it was completely wet (had been taken through the car wash). While I appreciated a newly washed vehicle - I would have rated the service a 5 if I didn't have to ask the vehicle to be dried.......of which someone else dried off parts of the vehicle but not the major sections (i.e., windows). Wow service for me - is excellent customer service with a smile and proper greeting. Even while waiting - it would have been nice to hear - good afternoon and I'll be with you shortly...didn't get it.

Tomo has some of the coolest stuff you will see from watches and headphones to really high end sound equipment and jelly fish tanks. Their selling point is that they offer things you wouldn't/couldnt find anywhere else, the drawback is usually the stuff is still really expensive. Not really a "deal site." Also their shipping practices are pretty out dated, you sometimes have to pay for shipping per item and its a high price for shipping and it takes a really long time. Ordered merchandise online with basic shipping.  Took a few days before actually with UPS.  Dec 3 to est. delivery Dec 11.  We had left for Colorado then with mail forwarding. UPS left parcel at my local post office in PA. Eventually the parcel sent to redirection center in PA.  Parcel then mailed to P.O. in local town in CO.  They sent a notice to the office of large resort we're volunteering in.  Person in office didn't know what to do with this messg. so filed it away.  Our parcel arr. 12/24 unbeknown to us.  Parcel contained present for our son, visiting us for Christmas in CO.  January, we still couldn't track down the parcel.  Went to local PO to find out where it was.  They eventually found it via your tracking # we found online.  We had to pay $6 plus to redeem it.  USPS delivers for UPS, but does not redirect such parcels free!!!  Son had returned to East Coast, so we had to forward it again.  USPS wanted another $6 plus to redirect it a 2nd time!!!!! Eventually let us redirect it again, paying only 1 x $6 plus amount!! Finally son received the merchandise and is very pleased with it.  End of story.

I had ordered an emergency pendent for an elderly family member that recently moved in with us, salesmen told us at the time of sale, that all we had to do is call and we would receive one for free, not true, so I ended up ordering one, after 10 days  no pendant, so  I called and was told the order self cancelled ?  Vivint customer service said since we had an appt scheduled, they would send one out for free with the service tech, not true.  In the  interim, one showed up in the mail and my credit card was charged $60. I've always had an overall pleasant experience with the customer service folks, but seem to get less than the truth. Update 7/1/19 - Safestreets came back out and replaced my motion detector with a number of window units.  Apparently I misunderstood that one device couldn't monitor a larger double window area, so my count was off.  I ended up having to buy another $300 in window sensors to get my house secure.  That $300 plus the $360 spend the first time puts me near $700 to get my home secure.  This was after hearing on the phone that all my investment would be was $49/mo for 3yrs; $68/mo with Ring.  My home is secure now, but it cost me a lot more than I had been told up front.  It's over.  It's done.  I want to move past this experience.  $700 paid for peace of mind and to stop misunderstandings/miscommunications.  I recommend SafeStreets be more transparent over the phone.  The "national standard package" will not secure a home.  It doesn't come close.  It may guard against intrusion via certain methods or a few areas of your home, but your home will not be completely secure.  That'll cost you....which I found out the hard way. I felt very pressured to buy a system from the tech that came over.  He handed me a sob story about coming all the way from out of town to install my system when i was under the impression that it was merely a planning/fact-finding visit.  Once here i was told that the system i was told i needed over the phone would not even come close to protecting my home and that i needed to spend another $1000 to get close.  I felt mislead and railroaded.  I wish i could get a refund, cancel, and get this stuff out of my home.

first, the product arrived very late, was told a different story on each inquiry. It arrived just in time for a massive snow storm, delaying installation and extending my lack of phone service as my first booster died of old age (approximately 18 months).  Then, after designing a tower to get the antennas the minimum 20 feet apart vertically, I find out you need a lightning suppressor AND a surge protector (1000 joules minimum or your warranty is voided) Now that added another long trip to town. Knowing their customers are rural (or we would not need a booster) Wilson FAILS to include either of these items. Unforgivable.  Charge more if need be but include EVERYTHING I need in the box, dammit.....finally, WHY is the coaxial cable bright white? Again I am rural and a bright white cable looks like hell on my house, so now I have to paint it to disguise it.   OR look like a booster commercial. This is NOT a well thought out device in many ways. The installation instructions leave a little to be desired also.  I will be looking elsewhere bor my next booster, rest assured.  Les Kuzior 740 213 5970

My eyebrows are a hot mess, very sparse. I was hopeful in finding a product that would make my life easier and eyebrows look more substantial and normal. I am tired of adding so much eyebrow pencil to my eyebrows early every morning just to see they don't match, at all and it looks drawn on. This product, if you know how to do makeup well can be useful. It stays on for a couple of days if you are careful while washing your face. They still look drawn on, but I like that they stay on for awhile. Also I use a taupe color pencil and wasn't sure which color to buy - I bought blonde though I'm a brunette with blonde lowlights. You need to keep adding the product so my husband who tells me like it is notices, even using blonde, my eyebrows sometimes come out way too dark. It's not a very thick substance, more watery so you keep adding color to fill in where needed. Maybe they should make it a little thicker so if you buy blonde, it looks blonde or at least taupe. So, my review is just ok. Someone's gotta do better.

Some companies are just sharks, they do the minimum required and try to take advantage of people who don't know too much about the skilled trades.  In my professional life I deal with contractors of all trades on a daily basis, so I'm familiar with the tricks.  When I see variations of 10k or more I know something is up.  Some will call and not show up, others won't even call, still more will take your request and use it as an opportunity to upsell/change your mind.  But there are some gems on this site.  My advice, do your research on your project, you don't have to be a pro and know how to do it, but know the materials, have an idea of the process, check industry benchmarks THEN contact a pro.

Ben, in retrospect, Cindy Wang probably should have advised me against refinancing   I wouldn't be out hundreds of dollars. There was to much stalling, and no one got back to me like was told.The VA home loan sounds good, but it isn't because of ridiculous requirements like removing all chipped paint and picking them up and removing them from the property-even if there is no lead paint present because the building have been scraped and painted with new paint several times. The VA certified home appraisers are usually rude, arrogant, and unfriendly because of the VAs policies. If you are young, and the house is fairly new, then it might be different, but I didn't have that luxury. I just regret starting this whole process.

The reason I gave a three star rating is because I had things in storage before and there was flooding so I had to remove everything out as everyone else did at the storage rental so they could make repairs.  I came back to Public Storage after they told me repairs were done and the flooding issue was fixed much to my surprise it wasn't I went to storage unit after a week of moving my things back and low and behold there was water in the unit so I guess the repairs weren't fixed as indicated. I believe the roof is leaking so it would be great if they were to fix that problem, otherwise I guess I will be moving my things out in the near future to another storage facility.  I don't mean to complain but when things were suppose to be fixed and now maybe the roof leaking in my opinion with water in the unit every time it rains is not good.  Hope this gets resolved.

The recipes pretty much always look good, but we've had some issues. First, the biggest issue - our produce arrives partially frozen, crushed, or rotten 75% of the time. Definitely doesn't invoke the descriptor, "fresh." Second, our meals are really good only 20% of the time. The rest of the time, they are either too greasy, relatively tasteless, or devoid of green vegetables. We alternate with Blue Apron and choose Hello Fresh more often because the recipes sound more appealing. But the Blue Apron meals always feel higher quality and tend to be tastier. I'd say Blue Apron Meals are really good 50% of the time. Moreover, the Blue Apron communication is way better. Our Hello Fresh boxes were held up in the mail several weeks in a row due to weather and maybe some other issues, and Hello Fresh didn't contact us at all. Even when one of our boxes was 6 days late! Blue apron is always on top of that. Overall, it's been nice to not have to plan my own meals, but the Hello Fresh experience has been just okay.

We had a 3 nights stay in late December 2016. The room was okay, clean enough and the buildings are quite new. At arrival, we were a bit frustrated to learn that the bed and breakfast option we selected (and for which we already paid a considerable sum of money) did not include ANYTHING outside the sleep and breakfast service, i.e. no access to main building, no swimming pool access, no activities, no beach access. All this was not clearly stated in the website at purchase, reason why we complained. By paying an extra 20 Euro/$ per day per person, we got access to all the activities, buildings and buffet for lunch and dinner, but only from 11AM to 11PM. I don't understand the reason for this time limitation, anyway if you book make sure to get straightaway the all inclusive option, otherwise it's definitely not worth the money. The entertainment team was good, the beach and sea are absolutely fantastic (all over it's 18km stretch).

Hotel is nice and comfortable, nice area to park!! Only complaint is with shuttle service!!! Getting to airport shuttle was right on time and great service!! Pick up service at DIA was different story.  We arrived back at DIA at a few minutes after 3 got our luggage and went to pick up location on level 5 third island where it says hotels only!!! We were at this location by 330 waited for about 15 minutes, before calling hotel to confirm we were in right location, hotel confirmed we were in correct location!!! They said it would just be a few minutes!!! Waited another 15 minutes no shuttle. I called back hotel and they said just a few minutes that shuttle should be there any minute!! By now it's 415 still no shuttle. We had seen numerous other hotel shuttles several times come through but none from embassy suites!! I called back a third time to only be told that in a few minutes shuttle would be there!!! I finally saw first shuttle from embassy suites  after waiting for an hour!!! There service says every 30 minutes. This was the first time I had used this service since I had an early morning flight, not sure if they were having a bad day or what!!! Probably would use red lion inn or one of the other hotels/shuttles in the area as they appear to have better shuttle service!!

3rd revision. I started getting a brake squeal after 1500 miles after the brakes have warmed up. I contacted Brake Performance and I explained that we followed the instructions to the letter. Their response stated that they actually do recommend putting an anti brake seal compound on the pads prior to installation. Well it’s certainly NOT in their detailed instructions. So now if I don’t want squealing brakes I have to take the vehicle back to the shop and pay a second time so they can pull the pads back out to add the anti brake squeal and reinstall. Not happy at this point. I was specific in following those instructions and I purposely told the technician no to the anti squeal when they were originally installed because the instructions SPECIFICALLY said NO chemicals can be put on the rotors or you will void your lifetime warranty. But now it’s ok to use anti brake squeal AFTER I already installed them and now have an issue. Why in the F$&@ would that little piece of important information not be included on n the instructions? I am upset that I have to go back to the dealer and pay a second time when this clearly could have been avoided. Good brakes, they stop well but definitely not a fan of the way this has worked out for me. I hope they update their instructions to include this otherwise others may have the same issue. Wondering how they determine if a brake rotor is eligible for warranty? Does the testing they do tell them what kind of chemicals have been applied? Not really adding up to me. Frustrated!!!!! IRevised review. Ok I have just gone back and changed from a 3 to a 4 star review. I just had the brakes installed and the process was seamless. All the parts were a direct fit and the initial results are very good. The bedding process is a little lengthy but if you follow it exactly as printed you too should have no issues. The brakes are quiet and stop very well. 1st initial review I can’t speak for the brakes themselves as I’ve yet to install. Should be next week. My only issue was that after I placed the order I received a message and was asked to contact them back concerning my order. When I did they only wanted to confirm the billing address and shipping address. This delayed my order by a couple of days and I think it was unnecessary since I confirmed it when I placed the order. I get the whole fraud thing but there should be a simpler process that doesn’t hold up the orders. It is difficult trying to balance where to have it shipped where you know it’s secure and requires a signature instead of dropping at my door when I am not home so some damn porch pirates can take it before I get home and have the pleasure of watching them take it on your cameras. I’ll update after the install as I am excited about the new brakes. Hopefully they are well worth the money spent and the reviews I read were accurate.
The help phone line was weak in assisting me to address my issue with my credit card being declined for a "possible fraud alert". They were too vague.

This is the 4th time I have booked with this company and every time they blow the competition`s pricing away.    This time it was nearly a saving of around $250 to $300 per person for flights to New Zealand.    My only real gripe and it`s a small one compared to the pricing I get is that they take up a lot of time on the phone with you afterwards.   You book online and check all of the details yourself but before the booking is confirmed with the airline they call you and go over all the details over the phone.   This time they wanted me also to fill out a credit card authorization, send a copy of my credit card with numbers blanked out except for final four, copy of driver`s license and passport.     I understood the reason why but then they wanted me to send another authorization because they said my signature wasn`t matching my driver`s license.     For anybody who remembers signing their driver`s license you do this on a signature pad and then they copy it onto the license they send you in the mail and so it can look a little transposed and shrunken.     I am not complaining because I would really recommend using Just Air Ticket but I just wish it wouldn`t take multiple emails and phone calls to complete the booking especially for somebody like me who they recognized to be using them for the 4th occasion.

I was really starting to enjoy this service more than Beiber bus until my last 2 experiences. The first time we were delayed for hours, granted it was because the driver fell I'll, so understandable. We received an email saying we would receive a $25 coupon for the delay and never got it. I contacted OurBus before booking my next ride regarding the coupon and never received a reply. This second time the bus I was supposed to take changed pick up locations and we were notified via email and text, however they failed to mention that the bus was not actually going to be a bus. Once I got there there was only a small van/bus thing with no label saying the bus company and regular buses from other companies. The OurBus staff did not make any last call announcement as I stood there for maybe 10 mins wondering where the bus was. Once I approached the OurBus staff and asked them were it was, that's when they told me the little bus/van that had already left was my bus. I was told I would have to be standby for the next bus 2.5 hours later, even though I had booked my trip days in advance. I hope I don't run into more experiences like this since this is my only option, but so far I'm dissapointed.

I bought a full price 2-piece bathing suit for MO this past week. The top I had ordered was unfortunately too big, despite having done research on the manufacturers website to determine which was the appropriate size for my measurements. I was shocked to find a tag on the item which said "this item is final sale and cannot be returned for credit or refund." I went back to the item's webpage to investigate how I could have missed such an important detail. Much to my suspicion, "FINAL SALE" is not clearly stated anywhere obvious. In fact, you have to click a drop down menu further down the page to find out the item is final sale. I am very disappointed in this return policy. For such a high-end market and clientele, one would think they would be more amenable to returns and exchanges. Now I am stuck with an item that does not fit me, has not been worn, but cannot be returned.

I've been using Carousel Checks for about 15 years.  I was surprised to see the almost $10 service and handling fee added to the bill at the end. I could have ordered checks from my bank for what Carousel ended up charging me.

My daughter received the certificate to get her permit through this program. It fit our budget which was great. I paid extra for her to study the 100 questions for the permit test at the DMV. That seemed to be a waste of money because she failed the DMV test twice in a row.  We took home the booklet from the DMV for her to study.  She liked the free booklet a lot better than the test questions on Idrivesafley.com, and after using it to study she did great on the test and finally passed. When I took her to practice actual driving I didn't realise that none of the mechanics of driving were taught to her in the course. She didn't know what a turn lane was, or simple things that I thought every kid would know, like the fact that you use a blinker to change lanes.  I guess since she always sat in the backseat on her cell phone growing up she hadn't paid attention to basic driving.  She started out trying to use her left foot for the break and the right for the gas. Aye aye aye. She has almost completed her 50 hours of driving, but I'm still not sure that is enough practice, honestly. One time she was making a left turn and looked left, then looked right, waited for the car to pass, then didn't double check again to the left before turning and turned right out in front of a semi. She also got confused while pulling into a parking space, hit the gas and the car lurched onto the sidewalk almost crashing into the window of the store. This was after she had already had twenty hours of practice driving. Her father and I have done all of the instruction. It would have been less nerve wracking to pay someone else, but it saved us hundreds of dollars. I wish the coarse would have included a video similar to Motor Mania and Freewayphobia which is an old Goofy driver's instruction video. Even though it is old it teaches some basic skills I think are still relevant. I found some of the video on youtube I plan to have her and our younger daughter watch it.

I recently bought a car from Carvana and while I was very apprehensive through the entire process; buying a car online is scary your first time.  The customer service representatives were amazing and very patient, kind and explained everything in detail no matter how many times I asked the same questions.  Then came the first hiccup in the process, I had my car scheduled for delivery on Saturday afternoon; on Friday afternoon customer care called and said they had to let a delivery driver go and could no longer deliver the car on requested date they did offer to give me a uber code to go and pick up the car.  Luckily my boyfriend was available to driver me to their location to retrieve the car.  I was understanding to this situation being a manager myself and knowing the struggles of turn over rates. At the pick up everything went smooth and everyone was very pleasant and helpful; again great employees. Once i got in my new car i noticed it had not been cleaned at all.  I couldn't see out the front window due to smudgy steaks all over, the floor board was covered in dirt and just normal dirty for used car the outside could have used a car wash as well.  For a dealership one would think you would receive a nice clean car used or not, so this was disappointing to say the least.  All somewhat small things that i just took note of and i didn't let it bother me or turn me off that much due to the wonderful service I received along the way.  The car looked great and was exactly what they said.  So I decided to take it for the 7 day test drive. of course my first plan of action was to take it to my trusted mechanic and have everything looked at to ensure it was a good car. Well seeing as i bought the car on a Saturday night I had to wait until Monday to take it in to get looked at.  Sunday morning I get in my car to run some errands and that's when i hear it.  I clunking rattling sound from the left tire well area.  Knowing a little about cars i figured this was my struts.  So i call carvana and the warranty to see what to do. They suggested getting it to mechanic and see what exactly is going on.  So I took to my mechanic first thing Monday morning.  where they did confirm that my left strut was shot.  Seeing how I still have 5 days left on test drive I tell them to get it fixed with the warranty. It takes until WEDNESDAY to get the approval from warranty to cover the cost of repairs leaving me now with two days left on 7 day test drive.  While it has been a true struggle to fight with warranty everything else has been great.  The car is fixed and no further issues seen.  My mechanic did say it appears that in transferring the vehicle it was dropped on its left side destroying the struts completely on that side.  This goes to back the story from Carvana on letting go a delivery driver I'm assuming the one who dropped my car; however, the fact that after a vehicle was dropped they failed to re-inspect vehicle is quite unprofessional and very upsetting.  If the warranty would not have covered repair 100% I would have returned the car immediately and asked for full refund. However, I spent 5 months looking at cars and deals and I fell in love with the one I picked and couldn't find a better deal at another dealership. So over all the idea is amazing and the employees (that are still there) are with out a doubt wonderful, I do feel there are quite a few things that can be fixed and looked into a little deeper and some policies need to e put in place about how to present a new car to customer, it should be cleaned, detailed and told if anything happened in transit with the offer to repair any issues 100% upfront.  This is the best way to build rapport. At this time I'm keeping my new car; however, I do not feel I will buy from them again unless these things are addressed and fixed.

I switched from Apple's print service to Motif this year to print the annual calendars for my family, since Apple discontinued their print service.  Out of six calendars I ordered, one had to be rejected, since the colors were off significantly. I contacted Motif and once they reviewed my case they reprinted and resent the calendar with express mail at no charge.  I appreciate the rapid response, but must say, that with over 70 prior projects ordered through Apple in the past decade, I never had a single reclamation. However, in the end all calendars turned out well - and I appreciated the additional layout options that I did not have before. One comment for the next year - please provide the option of ordering calendars with 13 or 14 months - going into January or February.  Frequently, calendars are created and ordered over the Holidays, and the family members therefore do not receive their calendars before the middle of January.  In prior years everyone appreciated having the calendars last through January so that they could continue to use them to note upcoming appointments, etc.

I feel they should have sent me the form they wanted via US mail before taking the step to cancel my policy, especially since I've been a policyholder for the last 13 years (beginning right after graduation from nursing school).

I wanted a different experience on car shopping, and oh boy I got one. I am not at all disappointed in the quick effortless buying experience at all with in a week and a half I had the vehicle in the driveway, definitely a 5 star on quick. Where I had the issue and where I gave 3 stars was the package with temporary plate was supposed to be here before the vehicle, well I asked where it was was told they are going to send me email with temp plate and for me to print it out for time being so I could at least drive the vehicle, nothing about why package was delayed or when it would arrive, I did what they said printed it out and drove Chevy Trax 2 blocks and police had pulled me over. I live in a town of 896 people so that printed out temp plate, the officer was not having it. So 7 day “free” trial I am down to 2 days and got to test out the vehicle for 2 blocks. Called customer support and asked why I have not received the package yet, Lady on other end said it it will take awhile for registration and plates to show up, at this point I am confused because this package was supposed to arrive before the vehicle. So finally I explained to her that I never received temp plates no paperwork no nothing at all, so put me on hold and came back and said how sorry she was and that there is a lot of new employees and that my package will be shipped out right away. Ok so 6 days later, vehicle still sits in driveway and my 7 day test drive is the next day, so I had no 7 day worry free anything because there are “new people” and if I would have not called after police pulled me over I would have still been waiting for temp plates and papers to sign. I have 3 stars because of the mix up and no 7 day nothing...but the quick hassle free car buying was excellent!

I bought the New York Pass assuming ot would save me time and money. It did neither for three key reasons. 1 - it didn't get me in lines that were quicker, although the advertising promised that. The New York City Pass, the New York Pass - there are so many passes that promise shorter lines that it's impossible for all the purchasers to have a short line. I waited just as long as everyone else, which was especially frustrating at places like the Statue of Liberty - where I waited for nearly two hours. However in every line I was in, there was a group who sailed past all the rest of us and saved HOURS - those who bought tickets online for a specific time. That's what I'll be doing next time. 2 - it didn't save money. I bought a five day pass, thinks I could get to three attractions per day, which . Wrong. Each attraction alone takes up half a day to do it justice. And by day three I was exhausted from all the walking and subway travel that I ended up doing only two things pwr day. Plus a number of the places I wanted to go (eg most of the museums) have a 'suggested fee', allowing poorer patrons like me to pay what we can afford. The 'savings' in the NY Pass only take into account the top suggested fee - so no saving there for me as I wouldn't have paid the top fee. And finally re saving money - don't believe what it says about savings on Broadway shows. The savings are only $10, they aren't good seats, and if you go to the TKTS booth early, you're likely to get much cheaper and better seats than the ones promised in the NY Pass literature. 3 - I have an issue with the requirement.of using the NY Pass on consecutive days. As discussed, I bought a five day pass. By day three I was tired, by day five I was exhausted. I would be much more likely to buy the pass in the future - and recommend it to others - if you could spread your visits to attractions acrossore days. You need a rest day now and then! In that case, you would be much more able to get your money worth. As it is, I would never recommend buying the NY Pass. Rather - book things like Empire State Building and Statue of Liberty online and arrive at a specific time. Buy Broadway tickets from TKTS in Times Square. The main value I got from the NY Pass was the information on the website, which helped me plany trip. I wouldn't buy it again unless the ruled about consecutive use were changed. Even then, I'd think twice. There are many ways of saving money in NYC and this is not necessarily one of them.

I almost gave a 4 star rating but I feel like there is enough room for improvement. I spent way too much time trying to figure out why the humidity/temp sensor wouldn't work. It gave me issues right out of the box after sync. and after deleting and re-syncing the device, it was no longer discoverable. The product info from one sensor to the next is inconsistent and makes it difficult to compare products. I wasn't able to easily compare and shop for the ideal sensors so I ended up just buying a few of each to spread around the house. The 1080 cam we bought for some reason doesn't go full screen when we flip the phone sideways but the iota cam does. There isn't much in the way of instructional for the hardware unless I'm searching for specific issues through the site. For example, I'm not sure yet what the SD card is being used for that I put directly into the iota. I am holding off on buying another for the 1080 cam until I can figure out how it is being used. It doesn't seem necessary. The thumbnail disappears every 3 days which I believe is a part of pushing people towards paid services. But I'm not sure why I wouldn't be able to tell it to snap another snapshot automatically to update the thumbnail. Or to store a thumbnail on the SD card so it doesn't go away after 3 days. I also had to disable the motion sensor because of my cat but I would have rather a setting that allowed me to switch the sensor to record only instead of just an on and off button. I bought a variety of door/window hardware, acoustic glass break sensors, humidity/temp sensor, I didn't order enough stickers. I am not thrilled with the 1080 cam that I bought, so I am going to try to buy a z-wave cam from another source and see if it syncs up with the abode system. I would also love more information from Abode on how to integrate their system with my echo dot. I downloaded the app but it doesn't seem to be kept up with.

StubHub's greatest strength is the web traffic they promote.  It helps broaden the number of potential buyers/sellers in the market, making it easier to find tickets most events.  However, the fee structure is completely absurd.  10% (minimum) on the seller and rates fluctuating between 15-30% on the buyer (usually 20%).  On a $10 ticket I guess I wouldn't flinch at that, but it gives me pause on tickets ranging up $100+.  StubHub makes $30 on $100 ticket for acting simply as an intermediary.  They don't even change the scan code on the tickets to help prevent fraud, like TicketMaster does.  The fees for StubHub should be capped.  I looked at Packers tickets recently and the fees were going to be over $100 just on me as a buyer, let alone the seller, for two tickets costing a little over $200/piece.  StubHub stood to easily make $150 in fees on two tickets for doing nothing but having a website.  That's insane and stopped my will to purchase.

EzCater is a relatively reliable company, with many options for caterers and a user-friendly website. Something that could be improved are the portion sizes listed per caterer. Often times what is listed as "feeds 25" actually is enough to feed double that amount. This results in a lot of food waste. However, if the same amount of food is ordered from a different caterer, that "feeds 25" could actually be spot on. It would be great if ezCater could somehow inform its customers exactly how much food they are going to get based on pieces, pounds, etc. rather than head count, which is more often than not, inaccurate. In addition to this, we have had a number of occasions where our caterers were late to delivery and rather than being informed from ezCater that our food would be late, we were the ones who had to reach out for help. We understand this is a difficult process to facilitate, considering it requires compliance from both the caterer and the customer, but it would be great if ezCater could provide more real-time updates before problems arise, rather than after the fact.

Booked through TripAdvisor and paid through Cancelon.  Received a voucher which was presented to the resort at arrival. The resort had NO reservation for us (??) but they accepted the voucher and nothing was said until we tried to leave the resort, only to be told Cancelon had never paid the resort.  The resort demanded we pay for the entire stay again!  We refused and spent 2 hours arguing with Cancelon and the resort trying to get things resolved. We missed our plane home because the resort detained us like criminals and would not release us unless we repaid the bill. Long story short we had to pay it again and barely made it out of the Dominican Republic. Cancelon was easy to get on the phone, but it literally took hours of having the same conversation over and over to get someone to offer to refund us our money since we had to pay the resort directly.  They did ultimately respond by refunding our money plus $100.  The entire thing was a horrible ordeal, but I do appreciate Cancelon stepping up and getting our money back to us in a timely fashion. Be careful with these type of bookings.  Make sure you verify with the hotel the day before your arrival that they have a reservation for you, and that they've received the payment for the stay.

This is just a heads up. Website is great, easy to use and book, but there are a couple of things to be aware of. Firstly, if you book and carrentals.com confirm whilst the rental firm is closed - you will not receive a confirmation voucher, even though booking is confirmed and money taken from your card. Secondly, selecting the cheapest options available will result in you getting the oldest cars in that rental companies fleet. I booked with 'getyourcar' in Paphos, which is actually run by Sixt. However, you get what you pay for. Sixt customers get cars not older than 3 years. GetYourCar customers seem to get get ones 5 years and older. I had to switch the first the 2012 Skoda Octavia I got as it would shudder at any speed over 70 kmh, and it was replaced with an even older 2011 version that wasn't much better. It is fine, does the job, and there was no problems with the Sixt team about an exchange - but it is a bit misleading to suggest that the search is on like for like cars. It is NOT. I'm sure the cars do the job, but it should be flagged that you are taking a much bigger risk with the cheaper options.

My 87 yo Mom moved from Florida to NY- it was a quick move, not much time to take care of important business like insurance. Not having a good handle on the differences between medi-gap, medicare supplement, etc I did follow through with reaching out to this company. The initial experience was good, not really anything that I couldn't have done myself- but it was a time saver re: plan comparison. Willie Tello was helpful in educating me regarding coverage. I would give Mr. Tello a 5. I signed up with the Plan N with him because he had devoted so much time in educating me and comparing the plans. Moving onto pharmacy coverage, that was an issue. One of the medications my Mom uses is a Nitro patch. I was told that this medication was not covered, the cost would be approximately $475/month. It seemed a little steep, especially considering the medication was covered while she was living in Florida- could NY be that different? Something had occurred with "the computers" that the young man stated he would "call you back" shortly. While waiting, I researched Humana prescription coverage myself. I put all my Mom's meds in (just like they do at SelectQuote). Hmmm.......Nitro patch is a covered item, some restrictions (such as frequency of filling) but definitely presented as covered. The guy called back, I advised him of what I saw online. He was not aware, did not offer to research himself. I said I would call Humana directly, which I did. The gentleman at Humana was so helpful and I ended up signing up for my Mom there. Yesterday the test was done. Prescription for Nitro patch called into the pharmacy (who was helpful in obtaining the ID for us as the sign up is so immediate no time to get the card!! Covered and same cost as she paid in Florida. End opinion- there is good and bad, do not just believe- research yourself.

The car was totally fine, and that's what's important.  It was waiting for us as per the reservation.  No complaints about that.  I would just like to point out that I think much better info could be provided regarding the pickup and dropoff locations.  In both cases, we spent quite a long time hunting.  For the pickup, we were given the address "Atocha station" (Madrid), followed by an address.  Well, I know where Atocha station is, so I didn't look at the rest.  But, this pickup place was about 1/4 mile from the station.  It was a tiny desk in the lobby of a hotel.  There was nothing to tell you it was there.  We dragged our bags all over the place before finding it.  It's true that the rest of the address correctly identified this hotel and its location.  But, the words "Atocha station" should not have been included; they were misleading. The return was worse.   We dropped the car in Montpellier, France.  The Hertz booth, as it turns out, is in a parking lot that is about 10 lots removed from the train station (and there are no signs anywhere to tell you where it is).  In this case, there was no street address; just the name of the street.  We literally drove around for 2 hours and could not find that Hertz place, though it was easy to find the right street.  In the end, I called the Hertz people and got better directions.  I think it would be useful if AutoEurope could provide very detailed descriptions as to where these rental offices are, with maps.  (Oh, btw: the info people in the Madrid Atocha station said they had never heard of Hertz.  They said all car rental places were within the station...which was not true....)

I have purchased from RedCoach twice before, my first ticket was a First Class ticket and my second was Business class. Both of my original experiences were wonderful. The busses were pretty much the same besides the seats being smaller on the latter. My third experience was a little different. I had purchased business class again, but this time was completely different. The bus was quite smaller, as well as not being as comfortable, and the ride wasn't smooth at all. I'm not sure if my original two experiences were just mix ups with the bus and I had not truly gotten a business class bus, but this third experience made me not want to purchase business class again. It was very unlike the description that was on the site. Not only that, but the seat I had reserved for myself was taken up by the driver's two bags, which I had to then move myself so I could seat myself and my belongings. I've never had a problem with RedCoach before, but this was one of my least favorite experiences. If anything for next time, I would appreciate a more detailed description of what kind of bus I'm getting before purchase.

I must have a funny shaped face, because I tried multiple pictures and could not find a single pair to sit in a normal position. 2) My biggest complaint and largest reasoning for the 3 star rating isn't even actually because of the website or product at all, but more for the shipping costs! I understand (and am completely willing to pay) the cost of shipping, but what I do not understand is how $6 will get me 7-14 day business shipping while and additional $13 will get me nothing more than a tracking number but the same time frame.

I purchased tickets for my girlfriend to visit me in America.  She's from Spain, and this was her first time visiting America.  I opted in and paid for extra protection just in case something went wrong during her transit.  While she was at the airport waiting for her first flight back to Spain, she found out at the last minute that her flight had been delayed, which would cause her to miss her connecting flight.  She ended up being stranded at the second airport.  I contacted Sky-Tours and asked if they would provide a hotel for her.  Sky-Tours told me that I would have to pay for a hotel, then send them proof that my girlfriend missed her connecting flight because her first flight had been delayed.  They promised to reimburse me for the cost of the hotel.  I informed my girlfriend about this, and she decided to just stay at the airport for all of those hours. Now as I think about that, it makes no sense.  What's the point of paying for protection ahead of time if I'm going to end up having to pay for the hotel room anyway?  If I have to pay out of pocket for a hotel room in case of an emergency, then there's no point of me paying for any type of protection to begin with.  The purpose of me paying ahead of time is so I won't have to pay in emergency situations.  Since I paid for that protection, then Sky-Tours should have just provided the hotel room with no questions.  It's not like people volunteer to be stranded at an airport. One good thing I can say about Sky-Tours is that they did in fact have the best prices I could find, and the tickets were legitimate.  The ticket-purchasing process was very simple and straightforward.  I would definitely use Sky-Tours again, but I'll never purchase their extra protection again.  That was a total waste of my money.

The prices on BookRenter are better than anywhere I've found.  It's really easy to rent and return the books and they are in great condition. The book eventually made it to me, but it took some time.  Once again, I am awaiting a book that I ordered about a week and a half ago, and this is also in the hands of the post office, so once again I am left with nothing to do but wait.  So fair warning, if you are ordering a book give it some time, I'd say at least 2 weeks.  Other than that, I am very pleased with this company and plan to continue using them.

My experience started out great. I was looking at ordering either 50 or 100 USB's for my company with our logo. I had my mind set on a particular style but after my account manager got in touch with me and sent me a sample box, I was intrigued by the "on the go" styles that offered a second port you could plug into your mobile devices. My account manager was quick to respond and follow up with quotes and info I requested. I asked whether the port would be compatible with our company phones (iPhone 7 and iPhone 6s - same port) and was told it would be. Here are the exact words of my account manager “Yes, it will definitely fit into an iPhone 6S and other iPhone models with a USB-C port” And then when I asked this again just to be 100% sure before ordering he replied with “Yes, if you choose the USB-C connector, it will fit the iPhone 7” so I placed the order for 100 of these flash drives without hesitation. Keep in mind, these were more expensive than the original style we had planned to order. When I received the USB's I was excited to plug them into my phone and test out how we could share info on our company phones. However, I was very disappointed to quickly realize they do not fit into our phones. Not even close. I immediately contacted my account manager about this issue. I told him how dissapointed I was that I was mislead to believe these were compatible with our company iPhones. This was over a week ago and this issue has still not been resolved. My account manager has been so slow to get back to me with solutions to this issue. Always calling this an "inconvenience" and never acknowledging his mistake. He now tells me all the devices this USB IS compatible with which does not make a shred of difference to me since they are useless in our phones which is why we purchased them. I have had to follow up several times when he hasn't got back to me when he says he is going to. Always saying he is waiting on his "Quality Control Team" and he appreciates my patience. I have asked for a manager to get back to me on this issue and this request was ignored. At this point I have been offered 30% off on my next order but there will be no next order. I shouldn't be paying full price for a product that does not do what was promised and I shouldn't be waiting over a week for a solution when he was so quick to respond to every email prior to this order being placed. I have asked again in big bold letters for a manager to contact me and that is where this issue now stands... Edited to add a manager did reach out to me and resolved this issue. I was offered a partial refund to compensate for this error which I accepted. I appreciate the quick follow up once I escalated the issue.

Arrived on time at rental place and looks like they're slightly behind 5 renters and bending over backwards trying to find the right car for a customer ahead of me. I check in (with new guy Matt) and tell them about the double upgrade. 15-20 mins later they have my car ready.. Except no double upgrade or even single upgrade. They didnt even attempt or offer to check other locations. The guy (Bradley stepping in to help new guy Matt) really pushed to get me in the economy car and instead of asking for a ride home and picking me back up when a double upgrade car is available I just took the economy car. This is probably due to them being behind. The consolation offer was 2 bars of gas and a future double upgrade. Thinking back this is unacceptable because my visa card always has double upgrade. Again even though I arrived on time they were slightly behind maybe 5 people and when they saw me looking like a non professional who wouldn't complain they could get me out with the eco car. They really should have seen the promo notes. And IF I ever rent again with Enterprise, I will schedule for opening hour pick up and call the day before to confirm all promo are set.

I'm using Tel3 over many years and with the App since the it's creation. The App needs tools to tweak it's smooth operation. 90% of the time the automatic dialing is too fast and I have to manually enter the phone # I intend to dial. That creates it's own problem to first pull the number from my address list and then enter mostly a 12 digit # manually. All this can never be done on the go but only e.g. in a stopped vehicle because it is a 2 handed operation with a good chance of a typo. Please allow your App to use pause symbols or dial slower. The quality isn't quite as good as the Skype audio quality. Hope this helps

Requesting an appointment was easy but the rest of the experience left a bad taste in my mouth. After setting up my call, I kept receiving an email saying my appointment request was incomplete. When I would log back in it would prompt me to put in my card info again. The money had already been taken out the first time. I recieved this email two more times, one after my call was complete. When the doctor did call they were hard to understand. He seemed frustrated and just wanted to get the call over with. Didn’t ask for me to verify who I was or what my symptoms were. The prescription was ready shortly and I’m feeling better, so that’s a plus. I like using sites like this to “see” a doctor because I have a pretty busy schedule. I just may not use this site again.

My sons and I each got a 3-day pass. We liked the pass and found it helpful. But... it seemed a lot of money to pay for only three days and there were far too many things to do in just 3 days. The time estimates were unrealistic and some of the suggested "what to do in a day" were absolutely impossible to accomplish. We barely got through half what we had planned. So the value in the 3-day pass was not really there for us. In the end we did some things that we probably wouldn't have done if we were paying individually... and all those things were marginally entertaining for us. The 'front of the line' didn't really apply except at Empire State Building where there was no lineup anyway.We didn't have time to get to the harbour & Statue of LIberty, which was a real shame. Maybe next time! We have used city passes in a number of places (LA, San Diego, Orlando, Seattle) and have always been happy with them. I would suggest that you consider lowering the cost of the 3-day pass and allowing individuals to bundle 10 activities for that lower cost. That way a 3-day pass might feel more do-able and cost -effective. Another suggestion  is to allow a 3-day pass to be used on 3 out of five days instead of consecutively. We were exhausted by the end of our 3 days and still didn't get to everything we wanted to see. I get that NY is huge and has many things to do, but I resented paying the higher price for ALL the stuff when you could, realistically, only take advantage of 3 things per day.
have to pay for shipping and it takes time to get the product

Picking up the van was a big hassle and a long process (over an hour). There was only one person at a time working in the whole company. So, they guy running the shuttle from the airport, is doing the contracts at the counter too and pulling the cars from the lot. It's too much for one person to do efficiently. I reviewed the site as well as the product.  I just placed my order and hope I wont be disappointed. Update.  12-20-16 Honestly this process has been very frustrating.  I ordered on the 9th of Dec. and I am still waiting for a tracking number.  I have called and emailed several times.  I have spoken with 2 or 3 different people and there is always some "reason" I don't have one yet. I was supposed to get one yesterday and didn't.  I called this morning and they said they had it and emailed it to me.  I got the number and entered it into the shippers system and it was not found.  I called the shipper and they tried looking by tracking number, name, phone, address - nothing. I call Joesav  back and they looked it up again and said "oh yeah I see the problem.  I have to send the shipper and email.  Give me 5 minutes."  I asked how long it would take the shipper to update and they said "give them an hour"  Five hours later still nothing.  I called Joes back again and tried to explain this and was immediately transferred to voicemail.  So I still don't know if I am getting my wife's new TV before Christmas. Their price is great and I believe the only reason people buy from them is price.  These people are rude.  They have zero personality for customer service.  If I had to do this over again I wouldn't.  I had better get a valid tracking number tomorrow or I am going to cancel this order because I have no evidence to show me this has been shipped. Got a valid tracking number last night.  The shippers website stated ETA to be Jan. 4, 2017 (but possibly before).  So much for the 7 to 10 day window I paid for.  When I bought the TV I was told that the free shipping was up to 21 days.  However if I bought the Mack extended warranty they would upgrade my shipping to the expedited 7-10 day.  Definitely a lie to get me to buy the extended warranty.  Now waiting for TV to show up. Jan. 11th 2017 The TV showed up the day after Christmas.  I was wanting the day before but so be it.  My problem now is 2 fold.  I am still waiting for the Mack warranty I purchased.  I was told a couple of times they would email it to me.  Has not happened yet.  Second I am waiting on the $150 refund for the amount I was overcharged.  That is a long story but the point is I still don't have the money refunded yet.  These people are a pain in the butt to deal with.

I had very good experiences prior to this one. They always send my stuff in prompt. But this time, it sucks. I shipped my items to German hub on 11/15 by FedEx. Packaged was signed. Then no update so far. I contacted customer service every other day to see if there is any update on my case. They will use the standard customer service language: Sorry, we will escalate your request. Then nothing happened. I requested a call from their manager. And the guy called, at 3am US time! I am not against indian call center. But 3am!!! Also it's a call without any information. They do not have guideline, no business rules, no policy regarding to the delay and missing package. The customer service has to wait for warehouse to declare package missing. But if warehouse not declare, you basically doomed. Well, I understand it's Christmas time and expected delays. But please be honest and have a clear message that expected delay for certain days. And give a deadline for "package missing" and how to submit claim. My request ticket is 201740192. Quick update, I just received my package after 2.5 weeks back and forth, they finally processed my package, after that, everything is smooth and happy. They gave the reason that the suite number was not on package. However FedEx was able to give me the delivery approval which shows everything was correct. At this point I would say I'll probably still use the service but not around the holiday season. And the customer service was helpless.

We enjoyed the double decker buses, such a great view. We did some of the things we paid for, but felt, the restriction of using the Pass on 3 consecutive days was annoying, and pressured , especially as we had 2 weeks in New York. We decided that we would have been just as well to pay as we went, in our time, and according to the weather. You couldn't see anything from the Empire State Building the day we went up a young chap said to us "Why have you come up here today when it's drizzling?"  "Because it's the last day we can use our card!!!!" You NEED to be more flexible with your timeframe of the 3 days.

I ordered 3 vinyls, and they came sealed, but when I opened them 2 of them had some scratches and dirty oiled (?) stains on them. I've tried to clean it, but it helped just a little bit. Luckily, these LPs are playable, so I decide not to frustrate myself with returning them. However, I will  try not ordering anything from Oldies. They are not clear if their LPs are new or used. And if they're used, why sealed? 3 stars because they were fairly cheap, and my favorite one (Tom Waits) came clean.

I did not like that I was not given a tracking number. My order was not delivered on the expected day and I had no way to track it and find out why. I had to wait until the next morning to call traveled to find out the delivery had been attempted that there was no one there to sign. If I had had tracking I would have known when I needed to be home.

Bought a 3 day New York pass in August 2013. It was good a friend had a book we could look at prior to arriving in New York so we could get the most out of the attractions. Would have been good if attractions had been grouped together so you could see more in a smaller area. ie: rockafeller centre tour, tour NBC in the same building, and top of the Rock. Utilised the phone app and found this helpful especially the map, an idea may be to integrate notifications on attractions available nearby based on GPS location. Hop on/hop off bus found not useful between attractions. Would have been quicker to use subway. Bike hire for Central Park should be stipulated that they cannot be ridden on paths. This then does not allow you ride too attractions. Have to ride a long ways round, can't cut through the park. This should be told in the book. Advantage of having the pass was ability to jump queues, Top of the Rock following Rockefeller tour.
Could be another contact form with the facility besides local telephone. At least a email address.

I'm indifferent. Customer service definitely lacking by comparison to Chewy. Just ordered product, and the dry cat food received has the same expiration date as the product I purchased 8 months ago! In other words, it will expire before I can use it all feeding my cats. I called PetFlow and they offered to let me return the recently received product and they would send another bag, BUT, they CANNOT guarantee it will have a better date range - thus that's a rather worthless option as I might just receive another bag with the same exp date.  Obviously this means the product has been sitting in their warehouse, or stock is not properly rotated. I would rather buy from small local pet supply stores, but when that is not an option I choose Chewy as the prices are almost identical across all online retailers.

I used this site for the first time book my flight. I found the best prices here but started freaking out after reading these reviews. First, I did pay the extra fee for cancellation within 24 hrs. Not sure why I decided to pay this but I could have saved another $75 if I didn't. I guess I thought it would give me an extra 24 hrs to search a better flight. I think 3 days would maybe it would have been worth it. I read all of the information on baggage fees so I was not surprised about that fee. The day before my flight, I get an email from JustFly saying "last chance to reserve seats" which alarmed me because at first I thought I did not save my reservation. I went to the site and there were only 8 or 9 seats left and only one row where the seats were together! So I proceed to reserve the last few seats together and see there is a charge of about $12 per seat!! So almost another $50 bucks. No thanks. I will take my chance at the check in (which you do right from the Alaska site). I can't tell if Alaska charges that fee but I was surprised that the only seats left were at the back of the plane even though I checked in exactly 24 hrs in advance. I get to the ck in and I am able to reserve the seats for free...whew! Not sure if it is less stressful to do it direct. I might use justfly again. we'll see. I guess if you don't have to cancel or make changes to your flight, this option works well and saves you money.

I made a total of about 6 transactions with this Company. All was fine until I ordered 3 1/10th oz. Gold Canadian Maple Leafs. I only received 1 of the three coins. After leaving several messages, by phone and email, I finally reached a human that apologized for the shortage and promised the missing coins would be express shipped. Instead, the next day I got this email: After checking our inventory and records, we did not find any discrepancies and are confident we sent out the correct order. Please check the package again and let us know. Thanks, -Harry and the Penn Metals Team I replied back by email, confirming that in fact I only received one coin instead of the three ordered. After a bit of hesitancy, they contacted me and offered to send the missing coins and by doing so, made me whole.

Overall a good itinerary website with some glaring gaps. Main issue is adding inter day travel. Ie; traveling by train to visit a temple whilst based in a city. Also, adding hotels - there is no option to add your own accommodation. Ended up manually putting in as a custom event each night till midnight then midnight to morning. The address field does not get you map coordinates meaning it won’t map out travel to hotel!!
Seems to have a really good focus on security, but are missing pieces that connect the dots for security management. Needs pin controls and better management of smart locks in particular.
Good product, a little uncomfortable if you wear it too long though.
The response to my inquiry was swift, and the hinges sent were a perfect match. But, the screws were of such poor quality, the head broke off in the hole while attaching the door.
3 stars, I was able to place my order.

This is my honest experience - some of your food is absolutely delicious when plated with vegetables; however, I have found your boxed dry food is among the worst I've ever had.  Someone there should taste it after it has been boxed and sat around for awhile.  Most of my experience with your boxed food has been awful.  The frozen food is quite good and I order as much of it as I can.  I've been on this diet for approximately 2 months and have only lost 5 pounds.  It does leave me hungry at times or at the least not satisfied.  Breakfast items (frozen) are fairly good.  Hamburgers, chicken sandwiches good.  I have taken pictures of what your boxed food looks like on a plate compared to what the picture on the box looks like - looks like someone vomited when cooked and plated, especially the meatloaf and mashed potatoes.   Sorry, but you asked me to be honest!

I booked the installation to place my 65in TV on a cabinet not the wall. The office book me for service between 1-3pm on Tuesday the 25th. About 3:15 that afternoon the office called and said that they had to cancel the appointment because of some personal issues with the installer. Then about 5min later the installer called me and said that he could come if it was alright with me. The installer arrived (alone) at 4pm and (I) had to help him remove the TV from the box and place it on the table so the stand could be installed on to the TV. The installer didn't have tools so I provided him with the tools needed. He completed the stand and then (we) moved the TV to the cabinet. (I) helped him hold the light to attach the components. (I) helped him work through the controllers to complete the set up. Without my help there was no way he could manage the TV by himself!

I booked a hotel with free cancellation which I cancelled the following day. It's taken one and a half month (almost two weeks more than the 21 working days they say on the website) and a bit of insisting (calls, emails and ultimately a review here) to finally get a call from customer service who then indeed very quickly took care of it. It's only a bit disappointing that companies in general don't seem to care so much and stall you until a review is posted online, rather than solving the issue without any hassle from the beginning. In the end however, it was all sorted at least and other than that one issue, Gala Hotels worked just fine with the reservations I did keep. So, fine to make bookings with them but just be aware that if cancelling it could (or not) take a bit longer than usual to get the refund.
