I've used the same handyman on a couple of occasions. He did a nice job on mostly minor repairs. He also did a nice job on fixing and patching back patio screens on the first time I hired him. I was having some problems with my toilet as it was leaking & running too long after flushing. He fixed the leak from the crack in the water container, but the toilet still runs. I contacted his office & explained about it still running, I was told they were unaware about the running & are very busy at present with other jobs. It's been a couple of weeks now without hearing back from them. They are nice people & I'm sure they are still too busy to have contacted me. I have since contacted another handyman to take care of the running toilet & hopefully he will fix the problem in a timely manner. No hard feelings, as I had mentioned both the handyman & his wife who handles the office are good folks & it was a pleasure dealing with them.

When I download software to update my computers, I have to do it at night and hope the downloads don’t get interrupted which causes the updates to fail. Last week I wanted to update my credit card information on HughesNet’s mobile app, but there was no way to do it so I had to call them. I have printed two series of my fiction through Lulu over the course of the last few years, for personal use and gifts to friends & family only. At first I was impressed by the quality and consistency of the printing. However, with the latest two books in the series, and the few orders I've had to make recently for new copies of the older books, I find that the paper is noticeably thinner, and that the paperback binding is less consistent - many of my last batch of 500 page paperbacks came with crookedly trimmed edges, and severely skewed spines. I'll still use them, since I don't sell these books, but it's disappointing to see the decline in quality.

Stars: 3.5 I really like the layout of the website. The detailed explanations from the answers to the questions help out a lot!!! Most of the questions & answers have become very very easy. Some of the questions I struggled answering are vehicle mechanical issues (e.g., tire blows, engine fails, car skids) but these answers to the questions are in the Texas Driver's Handbook. Since it floods here in Texas, so far, I have not found questions about "Flooding." In the Texas Driver's Handbook, it's on page 53. Also, I've always wondered what the "Barrels" were used for. I didn't know that "barrels that are engineered to act as an impact cushion reduce the seriousness of crashes" (Texas Driver's Handbook, page 38). I had to search for pictures to see what a car would look like when crashed into those barrels on the highway. The road signs have become redundant. I didn't see road sign questions "Mounted in front of an obstruction which is close to the edge of the road, such as culverts, or center piers on divided highways" It's colored grey with yellow lights (or perhaps reflectors?) (Texas Driver's Handbook, page 31). Overall: I wish there were more pictures in the questions. So far, the detailed explanations help clear what's not mentioned in the Texas Driver's Handbook which is the 2017 version & not 2019. The Texas Driver's License Office said they are using the 2017 version & have not updated to 2019 yet.

Also, the house I booked is owned by someone from England.  I am being charged a fee by my credit card company for converting from English pounds to US dollars.  This will add an unexpected @$30.00 to the booking.  The fact that there may be currency conversion fees for a foreign owner should be stipulated up front by somebody. Overall our experience with vacation express was very good.  The price and flights were much better than I was able to get through other sites.  We did experience a problem with airline seating.  I'm not sure if it was the fault of the airline or the fault of Vacation Express but the flight time changed by 5 minutes and that somehow caused us to lose our seats.  It took a lot of frustration and phone time but we did get seats although not together.  Then, on the way back we were informed the day of our flight that my husband no longer had a seat.  Something about a name discrepancy.  I checked the vacation express documents and his name was spelled correctly on my confirmation, so apparently something happened in the interaction between VA and American Air.  Again...added stress and we were unable to sit together.  Despite these issues, I will most likely use vacation express again.

I absolutely loved working with Quicken Loans. They did call A LOT in the beginning even when we didn't have an update (new home build) so that was a little annoying but once we got closer to closing, the phone calls were necessary and really helpful to make sure we were on track. They also need to do a better job communicating on closing details. We were really unsure what the process was for closing and they were not able to give official details (amount, etc.) until the day before. We have an online only bank so we had to scramble to get a cashier's check before closing. Other than that, I love that everything can be done online. They are really good about getting all the paper work in to make sure everything is good a few weeks before closing so you can relax. Highly recommend using them!!

Unfortunately, you are not identifying which problem I had with Thriftbooks.com and which customer service representative I worked with. Without that information, your survey is meaningless. Please use identifiers specific to the purchase in the future so customers can respond to a particular transaction. These vague inquiries on your part don't help me and, consequently, they will not help you get the feedback you desire. That said, I will respond as if this about the replacement copy I received of the Harry Potter Hogwarts Cinematic Yearbook: Imagine, Draw, Create. The first one I received from Thrìftbooks.com was awful! It had already been written in and scribbled on throughout. Definitely unusable. I wrote to Thriftbooks and received a very fair answer saying that they would replace the copy. I just received the replacement copy and it is in very good condition and I am pleased. I do not have access to the customer rep's name right now, but you can trace it down. So, for this go-round and this transaction only, I give Thriftbooks high marks. However, I find that I am increasingly having to write to Thriftbooks about really awful books they are sending me. Their books are not matching their posted descriptions and their quality control seems to be waning. I have recently received some books from them that were labelled as "good" or "very good" that were in downright rotten condition. This means Inhave to write to Thriftbooks over and over about replacenent or reimbursement. The books being sent out from their distribution centers are clearly NOT BEING CHECKED FORVFLAWS AND DAMAGE! Shame on them for not doing their due diligence. Please not that I will not be able to continue to provide helpful feedback to you unless you indicate which book(s) or order(s) you are referring to when asking for my help. I order too many items from Thriftbooks.com to sort out each item.

I contacted 10 dealers for the same new car. The TrueCar prices were a good guide, but several dealers played a shell game that muddied the water. A few dealers reduced the advertised price by $3000 and after I arrived told me they added $3000 of products I had to pay for, (pin-stripping, nitrogen filled tires, life time car washes, lifetime oil changes, and more). These dealer additions all had some value, but never the value they claimed. So the TrueCar price is not 100% accurate as a few dealers try and game the system. I had no trade and brought my own financing. That really simplified picking the best dealer with the lowest price.

As the sales and marketing coordinator for a company, the biggest and most obvious responsibility is to promote and sell products/services and what better way to promote a quality product with another quality product? Whether it be a trade show or a sales trip, I am confident when I give a potential customer a Flashbay thumb drive. Ever since we began using Flashbay in 2013 we have had no complaints or issues with their products. An additional perk with these is our printing costs have actually decreased because let’s face it,  how many brochures do you see on the ground of the exhibit hall after booth tear down at a trade show and how many more catalogs are probably left in hotel rooms?  Would you rather pack a stack of heavy print materials in your carry on or a lightweight flash drive with the same information? Even if the recipient erases your files to use the flashdrive for personal use, your materials have been seen and your company name/contact info is still seen sticking out of their USB port which is only a few mouse clicks away from your website. If you want great customer service, a reliable and impressive product, Flashbay will accommodate your needs in a "Flash."

I had shopped all of my local appliance stores, and big boxes for this particular model of refrigerator. Plessers, beat the lowest price by over $400, and they had free delivery,  and a 10-year  free extended service plan! My local businesses wanted $50 - $118 to deliver. Their service plans were all over $250, for only three years. From the time I ordered, to the time I actually got the refrigerator, did take a little while. I was in no hurry, so time was not an issue. Plessers kept me informed on the progress of my delivery. The delivery men arrived at the stated time, took the refrigerator off the truck, placed it in my garage, and unwrapped it for inspection. Both of these young men were very pleasant and knowledgeable about their jobs. I will be back shopping at plessers when the need arises for any new appliances... Highly recommended!

I find SHAREMONEY to be a quick & efficient way to send money. SHAREMONEY is thorough & dependable. They provide timely & excellent communication,  throughout the process! My overall experience,  in sending money, via SHAREMONEY was EXCELLENT! The ONLY difficult part was entering the name of the payee; because,  after entering the first name, there is a field for a nickname. My payee Does not have a nickname; so,  when I keyed in NONE; or N/A it kicked me back to the beginning of the process,  until I entered the 1st name, ALSO, as the nickname. The other problem is that Filipino people carry the Maternal name, as their middle name; so, the same name has to be entered a 2nd time; &, therefore, appears twice on the payee's information,  required to pick up the funds. If not for these issues, I would rate SHAREMONEY,  as an OUTSTANDING service provider,  with VERY REASONABLE transfer fees! I have to believe that SHAREMONEY is an INDUSTRY LEADER! Thanks, SHAREMONEY; Sincerely,  Philip D Roberts

Hi, I’m a grad mental health counseling student at Nova Southeastern University. I found bookrenter.com while searching only for affordable books for this semester. My budget was extremely strict and also I had very little time to finally get my books. My courses are online so as soon as the semester starts so does my load of work and assignments. None of the other websites had the books that I needed for the price that I could afford. I found the 5 books I was looking for; I rented them for 90 days , paid the $25 express shipping and it all added up to $177 including tax …I was extremely happy and pleased but a little concern about the delivery as I had a couple of bad experiences in the past with other sites. Well, I received my books via FedEx right by the day and time the said I would. I paid for them on a Tuesday night and by that Friday morning they were at my door…I was impressed with the expedite service and the great customer service they provided me with. Since then, I have recommended the site to all of my peers. Saving so much money made a difference for me and I’m really thankful for that. Although I only have one more semester to go before I graduate, I will definitely be getting my books from bookrenter.com again. I wish I knew about Bookrenter.com sooner… Thanks so much for an awesome experience! Diana

Zicasso did an excellent job of providing me three travel agencies, from which I chose one, for a fantastic 10-day trip to Spain. The travel agency I used through Zicasso for my trip to Spain was amazing and even better than we anticipated, and we had very high expectations. They planned a 10-day trip to Madrid, Seville, Granada, and Barcelona just as we requested. They also included Toledo and Ronda as day trips. The specific travel agent we worked with designed a wonderful itinerary which was first built on our request and we used many of her suggestions. She offered a number of options in each city we visited for things to do and hotels. Ultimately, it was always our choice and our travel agent was never pushy. When we arrived in Spain, we found our printed detailed itinerary, which was already provided weeks earlier, at the hotel front desk. In addition the travel agency provided us a loaner cell phone with our travel agents mobile phone number programmed into the phone and an envelope/bag to return the phone that we gave to the front desk at our last hotel. Everything on the trip went as planned except for one transfer which was late and when I contacted our travel agent by phone about it, she took care of it in a few minutes. The travel agency we used through Zicasso was always friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable from before we booked the trip to after our trip ended. I only have positive things to say about them. I would recommend working with Zicasso to anyone coming from the US who want to work with any awesome travel agency in planning a trip to Spain.

I was over 180 pounds.  My cholesterol was through the roof.  My doctor told me I was a walking stroke waiting to happen.  I began the IdealShape program in January. My doctor says when I hit my goal weight of 135 pounds, he will let me come off of the cholesterol medication.  I love the protein bars!!!  I love the audio c.d.'s, especially the ones that help me sleep.  I have had sleep problems for over 20 years. Now, thanks to the c.d.'s, I go to sleep at night in 15 minutes or less, and sleep deeply all night.  I have read all of the books, and now understand why my previous diet efforts were not permanently successful.  I know now, deep in my heart, that thanks to this program, I will reach my ideal shape, and I will keep it.   My deepest heartfelt gratitude goes to David and everyone at IdealShape.  May God bless you all for the work that you do every day!

OK, so the interest on a quick 14 day couple-of-hundred buck loan is *way* higher than if I had a credit card. But LendUp is completely up-front about the charges. Nothing hidden. The web interface is great. I click on a slider for how much I want, how many days I want it for, and it tells me the interest charge. The money is automatically deposited in my bank account, and in a few weeks, the exact amount specified is automatically withdrawn. Its professional, there are no surprises, and its a really excellent deal to get thru the occasional emergency. I needed car repair. I knew exactly when and where my next paycheck comes. I could afford it--but not until the following Friday! A couple of clicks on LendUp and I've got the money NOW and in a day I have my car fixed. Well worth it. Sure, it would be better if I had savings and credit cards. But I don't. What I do have is a steady job and a predictable income. It's tough living on the "edge". But LendUp provides a simple, professional, and easy way to tide me over the cracks, so to speak.

When I started blogging in 2008 I hadn't yet heard of WordPress so began on another blogging site. In Fall of 2009 an author told me about her blog on WP, so I checked it out. I have been blogging on WordPress since January 2010 and hardly even visit my other blog anymore. WordPress is where I prefer to be. It is easy to operate, and when I do have the occasional problem I can't figure out from their help pages I simply ask someone on the WP team. The next day I have my answer. WP uses Akismet to block spam and has a high rate of success. I have so many great themes from which to choose for my blog, and it's easy to set up. My only complaint is that I would like to have affiliate ads on my blog but it is not permitted. Even with that drawback, I Love WordPress; it is my friendly and reliable blogging home.

Hotels went from satisfactory to very nice as the trip progressed. Bring a hot spot if you need good internet connectivity. Their motor coach WiFi was very hit and miss. Plus without any warning you may get bumped off the WiFi due to “bandwidth limit”. I hope you like chicken or fish. That seems to be the dinner menu choices more often than not. There is a toilet on the bus but they really don’t want you to use it. Bus stops every 2-1/2 hours at the “Auto Grill”. This is a very nice rest stop. Good food. Our tour guide/trip manager was a historian. He had more to share than my brain could absorb. There were other guides of specific monuments and they were awesome too. Our tour was 14 days, which we extended to 16 in London. I wouldn’t do that long of a trip again but I have nothing but great memories from this Continental introduction.

We asked to get t-shirts dyed a specific color, and customer service thought we meant the text being a specific color (they cannot custom dye shirts). Kabbage is awesome! The process from application to completion of the business loan was simple, concise and swift. I contemplated applying for the loan, since I'm currently building my business credit but the quiet voice within me kept nudging and saying, "Trust the process." I first learned of Kabbage through nav.org. Nav recommended Kabbage as a resource for building business credit. My approval rate was extremely high but the feelings of being denied stung like a bee. However, Kabbage kept popping up....in my email, on social media, in my head......so I decided to LEAP! In less than 5 minutes, I was approved and within 48 hours the funds were deposited into my account. I even received an immediate call from customer service within seconds of submitting the app. The rep was polite, knowledgeable, understanding and hassle free. The funds are already being put to good use and will aid in putting more available inventory on my ecommerce store. Thank you Kabbage! This loan was right on time! I highly recommend their services to entrepreneurs and small businesses who have been denied by big banks and lenders. Kabbage sees and values "us." What a blessing!!!

I have ordered and used several ink cartridges from Inkfarm.  I have been very satisfied with the results.  Except for the last batch I received, which was 6 black cartridges for my Epson printer.  The first two worked very well, as I have come to expect.  The third could not be accepted by my printer.  I tried the recommended steps to allow it to work, then called Inkfarm.  Inkfarm suggested I try unplugging the printer and leaving it unplugged for fifteen minutes, then try the cartridge again.  That also did not work, so I called Inkfarm again.  In the meantime, I had plugged in cartridge number 4 and was running a rather long ink job, which, at a glance, appeared to be OK, but when I took a closer look I discovered that the printing was very unsatisfactory, so I reported that to the rep I was talking to, a very nice lady.  She said she would send me two re- placements, which I have not yet received.  In the meantime, I have inserted the fifth of the six cartridges, and thought it was working fine.  This was also a long printing job, and after reading the printed results I discovered there were defects in the results.  I have not asked for a replacement for this cartridge because this job was informal, and I could read the results OK, but it won't be satisfactory for a business letter, for example.
